loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta works hard to support her family. Loreta is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Loreta requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Loreta has been in this business for seven years now.

Loreta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ton's Group

texts.en:
Phron is 54-years-old and married with nine children. She is living in a village of the Moung Russey district, Kampong Cham province. Phorn makes a living working as a rice farmer, and she also supplements her income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR per day.
 
Phorn has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles already. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, Phorn will use her portion to pay for harvesting rice. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice.

loans.name: Nhóm 16- Thôn Bắc 07- Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên operates a food stall, where she sells fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Liên is 35 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 16- Thôn Bắc 07- Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2009, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Liên has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham de 73 años de edad, está casado y tiene 5 hijos de 50, 48, 46, 44 y 40 años de edad, todos independientes y con hogar propio. Él estudió hasta 1er grado de educación básica porque su familia no tenía la capacidad de costear sus estudios. Su esposa es ama de casa, solo ella y un nieto viven con él.

Abraham desde muy joven aprendió de su padre a fabricar tejas, ladrillos y adobes, ya cuenta con 45 años de experiencia haciendo esta actividad. Decidió dedicar se a esto porque le daba muy buenas ganancias y era un negocio familiar, lo hace en la casa y le apoyan un hijo y un nieto, pero únicamente trabajan en la época seca.

Solicita el préstamo para pagar mano de obra que le apoyen en la elaboración de adobes, tiene muchos pedidos y tiene que sacarlos a tiempo, contratará personas de la comunidad para ser una fuente de empleo considerando lo difícil que es conseguir trabajo. Abraham espera Dios le preste vida para continuar con su negocio ya que es la herencia que le dio su padre.
texts.en:
Abraham  is 73 years old. He is married and has five children, ages 50, 48, 46, 44 and 40 years old respectively. All of Abraham's children are independent adults with their own homes. Abraham has only a first grade education as his family did not have enough money to pay for his studies. Abraham's wife is a housewife; the couple has one grandchild living with them.

From a very young age, Abraham learned to make rooftiles, bricks and adobe bricks and he now has 45 years experience in this work. Abraham decided to work in this trade as he earns very good profits, and because it is a family business. Abraham works at home and supports one son and one grandson with this work. He only works during the dry season.

Abraham is applying for this loan in order to pay labourers to help make adobe bricks. He has many orders and needs to fufill them on time. Abraham will hire staff from the community in order to provide work as it is difficult for people to find jobs. Abraham hopes that God will give Abraham life in order to continue with his business as he inherited it from his father.

loans.use: to pay labourers to help make adobe bricks.

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Minh Hợp Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết has a retail business, selling cake, salt, sugar etcetera. She is requesting a loan to purchase cake, salt, sugar, etcetera, to resell.

Tuyết is 44 years old, and she is married, with four children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the Nhóm 06 Minh Hợp Minh Lộc solidarity group.

In 2012, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tuyết has successfully repaid three previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuyết has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase cake, salt, sugar, etcetera, to resell.

loans.name: Nhóm 02- Thôntrung 08 - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phương operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell. She is 40 years old and married with five children. Phương is the group leader of the Nhóm 02- ThônTrung 08 - Quảng Nham Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. 

In 2012, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Phương Phạm faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 15- Thôn Bắc 07 - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Duyên operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell. She is 49 years old and married with five children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 15- Thôn Bắc 07 - Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2014, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Duyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Duyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 10 Thôn Trung 8 -Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chúc operates a food stall, selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Chúc is 41 years old, and she is married and has four children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 10 Thôn Trung 8 -Quảng Nham solidarity group, which is comprised of three members.

In 2012, Chúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. Chúc has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Chúc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Chúc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 01 - Thôn Trung 08 - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Luyến operates a food stall, selling seafood. She is requesting a loan to purchase more seafood to sell. She is 54 years old and married with four children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 - Thôn Trung 08 - Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2007, Luyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Luyến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Luyến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothes.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, in her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Lyn

texts.en:
Ma. Lyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Lyn is 49 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Ma. Lyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ma. Lyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Elver

texts.es: Elver y su familia viven en una casa de acabado fino donde Elver tiene un arreglo de anticretico. Elver sigue siendo transportista, vive y trabaja en la ciudad de La Paz. Su ocupación laboral hace que exponga su vida hasta altas horas de la noche, pero es la única manera que tiene para sobrevivir. Necesita crédito para otro mantenimiento de movilidad. Aunque la esposa de Elver le ayuda porque tiene trabajo, lo que ambos ganan no es suficiente, por ejemplo, la aparición del teleférico en La Paz ha perjudicado la actividad de transportista de Elver y por eso este cliente quiere su ayuda.
texts.en:
Elver and his family live in a finished home where he has an "anticrético" contract [a type of rental agreement in Bolivia].  Elver lives and works in La Paz, where he's still a taxi driver.  His job keeps him out until late at night, but it's his only way to survive.

Elver needs a loan for more maintenance on his vehicle.

Even though Elver's wife helps him because she has a job, what both of them earn isn't enough.  The appearance of the aerial tramway in La Paz, for example, has been detrimental to Elver's work as a taxi driver, that's why he needs your help.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Nhóm 21 Thôn 9 Quảng Hải Group

texts.en:
Thúy works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thúy is 28 years old and she is married with 1 child.  She is the group leader of the Nhóm 21 thôn 9 Quảng Hải solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is Thúy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thúy has been involved in this business for 9 years. The main hardship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Thúy hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, that her business will do well, and that she can build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 05- Tiểu Khu 3 - Tt Hà Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tình has a tailoring service. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth for her tailoring service.

She is the group leader of the 05- Tiểu Khu 3 - TT Hà Trung solidarity group, which consists of four members. This is Tình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Tình is 31 years old, and she is married with two children. She has been involved in the tailoring business for more than 10 years. The main hardship she faces in her business is a lack of capital.

In the future, Tình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth for her tailoring service

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is single and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for two years now.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish for her business.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a widowed woman, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 57 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Antonieta has a buy and sell charcoal business, in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замира профессиональная портниха из района Б.Гафурова города Худжанд. Ей 34 года. Она мать одиночка и одна воспитывает троих детей. Ее сыну уже 17 лет, а дочерьям по 15 и 10 лет. Замира очень любит своих детей, которые для нее являются стимулом для продвижения жизни. И Замира стремится обспечить лучшие условия для них.
Замира работает в ателье в течение 5 лет. Она не только берет заказ на пошив женской одежды, но и обучает девушек и женщин своей профессии. 
На сумму этого займа Замира хочет купить новую модернизированную вышивальную машинку, чтобы расширить свою деятельность. Она является целеустремленным человеком и в будущем планирует открыть свое частное ателье.
texts.en:
Zamira is a professional seamstress from the city of Khujand in the B. Gafurova region. She is 34 and a single mother raising three children. Her son is already 17 and her daughters are 15 and 10. She loves her children very much and they keep her going in life. She tries to take care of them as well as she can.

Zamira has been working in a workshop for five years. She not only takes orders to sew women's clothing, but also teaches girls and women how to sew.

With the loan amount, she wants to buy a new, modern sewing machine in order to expand her business. She is a purposeful woman and in the future wants to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy a new, modern sewing machine

loans.name: Sros

texts.en:
Sros is a 28-year-old, single garment worker and she lives with her farmer parents in Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. Sros has been a worker since 2013, earning approximately USD 5 a day. Her parents fatten and breed cows for calves to sell. 

Now, Sros would like to request a loan to buy cement, bricks, zinc sheets, and wooden pillars to build a toilet and a cow stable for her parents. This loan will provide Sros and her family with hygienic living conditions and help her parents have enough space for their cows. 

In the future, Sros is going to build fences around her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, zinc sheets, and wooden pillars to build a toilet and a cow stable for her parents.

loans.name: Nuria America

texts.es: Nuria de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella tiene un puesto de venta de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace vario años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Nuria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Nuria is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her two daughters.  

She sells food from a stand near her home. For several years now she has been able to cover her household expenses with the earnings from her stand. 

Nuria is requesting a loan to buy more of the basic ingredients she needs such as rice, chicken, beans, fruits and vegetables, etc., in order to vary her menu and make better profits.

loans.use: to buy more basic ingredients such as rice, chicken, beans, fruits and vegetables, etc.,

loans.name: Nhóm 45-Đông Lân 2-Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Ms. Long has a retail business selling cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these items to sell. She is 58 years old and single with one child. Long is the group leader of the Nhóm 45-Đông Lân 2-Điện Biên Solidarity Group, which consists of four members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Long joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Long faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Long hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem, who is 58 years old, is residing in Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. She has seven children, three who are married and live independently and four who are single and live under her support. To make a living and support her family, Yem manages and operates a farming business in a small rice farmland that is located in her community. So far, she has been in this business for 34 years. 

Currently, Yem would like to request a KIVA loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so she can experience a convenient way of traveling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: 020402110003 _Liên Minh _ Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mão operates a food stall, selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to use, to catch fish for sale.

Mão is 51 years old, and she is married and has four children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 020402110003 _Liên Minh _ Hoằng Trường solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Mão joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid nine previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mão has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Mão hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to use, to catch fish to sell.

loans.name: 09 Thôn Tân Xuân Phụ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tới operates a food stall, selling seafood. She is requesting a loan to purchase more seafood to resell.

Tới is 33 years old, and she is married and has two children. Tới is the group leader of the 09 Thôn Tân Xuân Phụ solidarity group, which is comprised of four members. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Tới joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. Tới has successfully repaid two previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Tới faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tới hopes to maintain a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood to resell.

loans.name: 021301060002 - Thôn 3 - Xã Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Lý works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. She is 40 years old and married with one child. Lý is the group leader of the 021301060002 - Thôn 3 - xã Hoằng Kim Solidarity Group, which consists of three members.  She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Lý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lý faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Lý hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 54 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, beers, candies, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc. 

Antonieta has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Antonieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soft drinks, canned goods, beers, candies, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc.

loans.name: Asalhon

texts.ru: Асалхон, 44 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Асалхон- среднее образование, она в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад. Благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Асалхон, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. Также на собственной земельной доле мерою 0,40 ГА и 5,0 ГА арендованной земли, она выращивает рис. Этот бизнес приносит Асалхон и ее семье хорошую прибыль в размере около 25,000 сом (KGS). Поэтому она решила взять в аренду еще 10 ГА земли и обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS). Асалхон рассчитывает на арендованной земле также выращивать экологически чистый рис, что приведет к получению большей прибыли от ее бизнеса и позволит накопить средства на покупку дойной коровы с теленком.
texts.en: Asalhon is 44, married, and the mother of three children. She has a high school education and earns supplemental income for her family through raising livestock and planting crops, which she started five years ago. Thanks to her dedication and hard work, she currently has two cows, as well as 0.4 hectares of shared land and 5.0 hectares of rented land, where she grows rice. Asalhon and her family earn a good profit of about 25,000 som (KGS). She decided to lease an additional 10 hectares of land and asked Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 125,000 som (KGS) to do so. She will grow organic rice to increase her income and allow her to save enough money to purchase a dairy cow and calf.

loans.use: to lease ten hectares of land in order to grow organic rice

loans.name: Mariama Kindy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé le 22 janvier 2003 et le banc villageois vient  d’entamer son vingt deuxième cycle. Malgré les difficultés de la zone à maintenir une activité génératrice de revenues, ces membres sont d’une détermination assez solide et très courageux. Les membres sont solidaires entre eux et vivent dans le même village. L’activité principale est le petit commerce, accompagné de la culture sous pluie.

Madame Mariama (debout à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. C’est une femme d’un engagement sans faille dans les activités du banc villageois. Elle s’active dans l’achat et la revente de produits agricoles plus particulièrement de l’arachide, qu’elle obtient auprès des villageois producteurs pour la revente plus tard à un meilleur prix.

Son nouveau prêt lui servir d’acheter au moins 70 sacs de 50 kg pour les revendre plus tard.

Elle utilise les bénéfices pour renforcer son épargne et participer activement à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on the 22nd of January 2003 and the members of the village bank have just started their second cycle. In spite of the difficulties of running an income generating activity in this area, these members are determined and brave. They help each other, and live in the same village. The principal activity is small business and farming in the rain.

Mrs. Mariama (standing on the right with one hand raised), is the star borrower of this group. This is a woman who is totally devoted to her activities within the village bank. She works in the commerce of agricultural products, especially groundnuts that she buys from the producers in the village for resale at a better price.

Her new loan will enable her to buy at least 70 sacks of 50 kg for resale.

She uses the profits to increase her savings and to actively participate in providing for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy at least 70 sacks of 50 kg for resale.

loans.name: Nhóm 04, Thôn 02, Quảng Thái Group

texts.en:
Luận has a retail business, selling kids' toys. She is applying for a loan to purchase more kids' toys to resell.

Luận is 38 years old, and she is married and has six children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 04, Thôn 02, Quảng Thái solidarity group, which is comprised of three members.

This is Luận's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in the toy-selling business for six years. The main hardship that Luận faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Luận hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more kids' toys to resell.

loans.name: 020403140004 Thành Xuân _ Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thảo has a retail business, selling rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice to resell.

Thảo is 51 years old, and she is married and has three children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 020403140004 Thành Xuân _ Hoằng Trường solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. Thảo has successfully repaid two previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in her rice-selling business for five years. The main hardship that Thảo faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her children to do well in school, to build a new house, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to resell.

loans.name: 08-Thôn 5-Quang Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tơ works in agriculture, raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Tơ is 50 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 08-Thôn 5-Quang Trung solidarity group. This is Tơ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

Tơ has been involved in her business for 5 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Tơ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 021301070001 - Thôn 3 - Xã Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thương has a stall selling tofu. She is requesting a loan, with which to purchase more material to make tofu for sale.

Thương is 25 years old, and she is married and has one child. She is the group leader of the 021301070001 - Thôn 3 - Xã Hoằng Kim solidarity group, which is comprised of three members. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, to improve her business. Thương has successfully repaid two previous loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Thương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thương hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more material with which to make tofu for sale.

loans.name: 021302040001 - Thôn 4 - Xã Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa operates a food stall/restaurant, selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell. She is 50 years old and married with two children. Hoa is the group leader of the 021302040001 - Thôn 4 - xã Hoằng Kim Solidarity Group, which consists of five members.  She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. In the future, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Bernarda works hard to support her family. She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Bernarda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

She has successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Bernarda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Dania

texts.es:
La señora Dania  de 45  años  de edad,  vive con sus dos hijos  en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en general como ser: arroz, frijoles, maíz, pastas de tomate, churros, jabón, frescos, verduras, lácteos, embutidos y pollo, además vende tacos, enchiladas, carne asada, pollo, yuca, etc. 
Doña Dania sus venta es con los vecinos y amigos que a diario visitan su negocio, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, con su esfuerzo a podido sacar adelante a sus hijos en los estudios.
Doña Dania está solicitando el préstamo para compra de arroz, frijoles, pastas de tomate, pollo, chile verde, cebolla, lechuga, etc. porque necesita invertir más en su negocio para lograr más ganancias y también comprar leña seca para cocinar sus golosinas, desea aprovechar la época de navidad.  Es su séptimo crédito que solita a Prisma es muy buena paga. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Dania is 45 years old, and lives at home with her two sons. She has made a living for the past 20 years selling groceries such as rice, beans, corn, tomato paste, churros, soap, drinks, vegetables, dairy, cold cuts, and chicken. She also sells tacos, enchiladas, grilled meat, chicken, yuca, etc.

Dania sells to her neighbors and friends who visit her store daily. She is a working woman with a desire to succeed. With her effort she has been able to put her children through school.

Dania is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, tomato paste, chicken, green peppers, onions, lettuce, etc. because she needs to invest more in her business to receive more profits. She will also buy dry firewood to bake treats, in order to take advantage of the Christmas season. This is her seventh Prisma credit, and she is a good client.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November, 2014.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, tomato paste, chicken, green peppers, onions, lettuce, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Eutropia

texts.en:
Eutropia is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent.  She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and to increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and to be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies.

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica has a fish vending business in Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. At the age of 41 and married, she has five children and has never stopped pursuing her goals for the sake of the family. Jessica is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

From her desire to earn extra income, she opened a sari-sari (small grocery) store in front of her house, and PMPC stood by her to start her chosen business. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items, to increase inventories, and to purchase more stocks of fish to sell. Jessica continues to seek business ideas and opportunities, proof that she has the determination to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase inventories, and to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 38, having been married in Pagadian, Concepcion has three children. She runs a store to provide for the basic necessities of their family. Every day, she patiently tends her store until evening.

Concepcion wants to expand her business. She recently signed up for her membership in Paglaum MPC, to access insurances and financial assistance. Now, she has borrowed a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for their needs.

loans.use: to pay for an inventory of assorted goods to sell

loans.name: Ma. Venus

texts.en:
Ma. Venus started her small-time business and became successful in managing her sari-sari store. She has to make sure to have enough inventory to serve her customers well. She rolls her capital and additional revenue back into the business, to gain more profit. Every day she has made good sales, since hers is the only store in their barangay.

Recently, she approached Paglaum for some much-needed capital, to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to establish a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Eseese

texts.en:
Eseese is 51 years old and married, with four children. She has a small plantation, where she grows taro and bananas. She can sell these in her community, or at the market. She has been doing this for three years.

Eseese needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a spade, a crowbar, crops, a wheelbarrow, sprayers, and a tiller. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Eseese will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a spade, a crowbar, crops, a wheelbarrow, sprayers, and a tiller.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Carmelita is 55 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Carmelita has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her weaving business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Carmelita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 59 years old and married. She is from Pagadian, Philippines. Dionesia has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of activity, which she has done for two years. This is how she helps her husband in sustaining their needs. 

Dionesia wants to provide her family a simple yet comfortable living space for all of them. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for her house. Dionesia has recently became an active member of PMPC. Now, she is on her way to rebuilding her house.

loans.use: to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for her house

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 49 years old, married and a resident of Ozamiz City. She earns a living through her small sari-sari store business.

She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of Php 10,000 to buy candies, packs of chocolates, canned goods, etc to sell to help the family in their daily needs.

Venus deeply wishes to maintain a member-in-good-standing status with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy candies, packs of chocolates, canned goods, etc to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: April Ann

texts.en:
April Ann is a businesswoman from Molave. She is 28 years old, single, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store, and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. April Ann is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing, without records of default.

Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items, to supply the demand of her customers. April Ann continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en: Kimberly is from Pangatian, Nueva Ecija. Her parents cannot sustain her schooling; that’s why she wants to obtain an education loan of PHP 15,000 from the Kiva lenders. With the never-ending price hike of food and other necessities, it is a struggle to make this suffice. But for her parents and siblings, she will make it possible. She wants to graduate and find a stable job for a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old and is married with 2 kids.

In 2012, Shirley applied for membership with PMPC. Hearing of all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Now, Shirley is asking a financial assistance of Php 50,000 to purchase inventories on chocolate, canned goods, candies, etc. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase inventories on chocolate, canned goods, and candies for her store.

loans.name: Melyn

texts.en: From Pagadian City, Melyn earns a living through her clothing sales. She works to have enough inventories to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase more clothing inventories to sell. Melyn hopes to live comfortably and help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventories to sell

loans.name: Rizalie

texts.en:
Rizalie is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 32 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Charlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Charlyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, coffee, cereals, juice, canned goods, snack foods and biscuits to sell.

Charlyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items including but not limited to those listed above.

Charlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, coffee, cereals, juice, canned goods, snack foods and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en:
Edelita, 44 years old, lives in Pagadian and is married. In order to survive, she has found ways to attain income through her sari-sari (small grocery) store. It began with displaying inventories of canned goods, noodles, sugar, eggs, and some shampoo and soap. 

Edelita then joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari store in January of 2013. She became a member in good standing, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she is applying for 12,000 PHP to pay for additional merchandise to draw more customers to shop in her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise to draw more customers to shop in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Melda

texts.en:
Melda is a 64-year-old married woman from Pagadian City, Philippines. She has four adult age children who are all married. Melda recently signed up for membership in Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) when she learned of the financial assistance it gives. 

Melda owns and manages a small restaurant in front of her house, which is on a national road that many people pass through looking for places to eat. Due to the improvements to their city, many people travel in and out of the vicinity, so she has decided to expand her business to cook more dishes in order to draw more people to visit her eatery. To fund this project, she needs additional capital, so she has requested a loan from PMPC. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her place for business expansion.

loans.use: to cook more dishes in order to draw more people to visit her eatery

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en: Felicitas is a businesswoman from Pagadian City. Philippines. She is a diligent and persevering mother when it comes to the welfare of her family, since she has always been known to provide the best for them. She is earning a living in her retailing business. To generate more income, Felicitas decided to expand her resources after she learned that she can access financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, she requested a loan to restock inventory for her store to increase sales. Felicitas smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing her family a better life.

loans.use: to restock inventory for her store to increase sales

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Fayzigul

texts.ru: Файзигул добрая и отзывчивая женщина в возрасте 48 лет. Она развелась с мужем. У нее двое детей. Файзигул забрала детей себе после развода. На сегодняшний день ее дочери 18 лет. Она студентка высшего учебного заведения. Сыну 12 лет он ученик средней общеобразовательной школы. Файзигул зарабатывает на жизнь, занимаясь швейной деятельностью. Она принимает заказы на шитье женской одежды на дому. На сегодняшний день шитье одежды это ее единственный источник дохода. Файзигул не хочет терять работу, из-за того что ее машинка не пригодна для дальнейшего использования. Файзигул не имеет достаточной суммы денег, чтобы приобрести новую, и по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Fayzigul is a kind and responsive 48-year-old woman. She is divorced from her husband and has two children. Fayzigul took custody of the children after the divorce. Her daughter is now 18 years old. She is a university student. Her son is 12 years old, and he is a student of a general-education secondary school. Fayzigul earns a living by being involved in a sewing business. She accepts order to sew women's clothing at home. Today, sewing clothing provides the sole source of income for her. Fayzigul does not want to lose her work because her sewing machine is not suitable for continued use. Fayzigul does not have a sufficient amount of money to buy a new sewing machine and is requesting a loan for this reason.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine in order to save her source of income

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is from Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a carpenter. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through her eatery business. It began with displaying a small amount of viands to their neighbors until she opened a small space for the eatery. To generate more income, Gloria joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in March of 2012. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she has applied for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store and to pay for additional raw ingredients for her eatery business. She hopes that her business will continue, so that she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari (small grocery) store and to pay for additional raw ingredients for her eatery business

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 39-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elizabeth has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. Elizabeth has requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Elvita

texts.en:
Elvita is 44 years old and married with five children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running the general store for 6 years.  She also earns an income from food vending.  Elvita has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Elvita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 50 years old and married with two children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from pig fattening and vegetable vending.

Evelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Назокат 52-летняя жительница района Шахринав. Она разведена и живет с дочерью. Назокат на протяжении 6 лет зарабатывает на жизнь путем животноводческой деятельности. Она разводит мелкорогатый и крупнорогатый скот на своем небольшом скотном дворе. Назокат любит домашних животных и довольна своей деятельностью. За счет прибыли с деятельности она обеспечиват свою маленькую семью. Сейчас для продолжения данной деятельности Назокат необходимо закупить пару скотов. Но так как у нее нет достаточного сбережения, она запрашивает кредит. Назокат собирается приобрести козлят и овец и таким образом расширить поголовья своих скотин. Этот кредит поможет ей продолжить бизнес и сохранить источник дохода.
texts.en: Nazokat is a 52-year-old resident of the Shahrituz district. She is divorced and lives with her daughter. Nazokat has been earning a living for 6 years through her animal husbandry business. She fattens up small livestock and cattle on her small livestock yard. Nazokat loves livestock and is happy with her business. She supports her small family with the profit from this business. Currently, Nazokat needs to buy livestock in order to continue her business. She is requesting this loan because she does not have enough savings. Nazokat is planning to buy goats and sheep to increase her livestock headcount. This loan will help her continue the business and save her income source.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. Evelyn is married and has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Evelyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like abaca fiber and rope for her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for 29 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like abaca fiber and rope for her business

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Flor has been in this business for five years. Flor earns additional income from abaca weaving.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Flor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 54 years old and married with six children. Francisca works very hard to provide for her family.

Francisca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like candies, biscuits, cereals, coffee, and soft drinks to sell.

Francisca has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items. 

Francisca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like candies, biscuits, cereals, coffee, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Doris Evelyn

texts.es:
Doris, de 35 años de edad, estudió hasta primero grado, está casada y su esposo es empleado en una empresa comercial.- Tiene dos hijos de 16 y 19 años, uno de ellos estudia y el otro trabaja. Doris, tiene un negocio de pollos de engorde desde hace dos años, negocio que decidió iniciar por la demanda que tiene en varias temporadas del año.

Además, ella se dedica a la venta de comida típica los fines de semana, el préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en el negocio de pollos de engorde, ya que necesita comprar los alimentos como concentrados, vitaminas, entre otros, para que estén listos para la temporada de Diciembre, que es cuando se venden por festividades navideñas.

Doris, planea seguir trabajando en su negocio y sueña poder tener un negocio más fuerte para obtener mejores ganancias, ella considera que con el apoyo de su familia y el financiamiento lo logrará.
texts.en:
Doris is 35 years old, and only went to school through first grade. She is married and her husband is employed in a commercial business. She has two children who are 16 and 19 years old; One is currently working and the other is in school. 

Doris has been raising/fattening chickens for the last two years. She decided to start this business based on the demand during various seasons of the year. In addition, she sells typical food dishes on weekends. She will use this loan to invest in her chicken raising business, because she needs to buy food products such as feed, vitamins, and others, so that the animals will be ready for the December season, when they can be sold for Christmas festivities. 

Doris plans to continue with her business and hopes to expand it in order to make better profits. She feels sure that with her family’s support and this loan, she will be able to succeed.

loans.use: to invest in her chicken raising business, because she needs to buy food products such as feed, vitamins, and others.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, three in school, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising chickens. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru: Феруза женщина 30 лет. Она  замужем  и имеет одного ребёнка. Феруза занимается торговлей мужской обуви и одежды. Она торгует на местном рынке. В этом ей помогает её мама. Она покупает товар с оптовых рынков Худжанда или Истаравшана и продаёт на базаре,который находится в Зафарабадском районе. Муж находится в миграции в РФ. Он каждый месяц присылает ей деньги на семейные расходы. Он хочет получить кредит для ремонта своего дома.  Она  рада за своевременную поддержку МДО Арванд и благодарит за помощь.
texts.en: Feruza is a 30-year-old woman. She is married and has one child. Feruza is involved in selling men's shoes and clothing. She sells at a local market. Her mother helps her with this business. She buys merchandise from wholesale markets in Khujand and Istaravshan and sells it at a market located in the Zafarabad district. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. He sends her money for family expenses every month. Feruza wants to obtain a loan to repair her house. She is happy with MDO Arvand's timely support and grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy livestock and organic manure

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Pascual tiene 38 años de edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el es casado y cuenta con tres hijos los cuales son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de la comunidad los hijos se ha convertido el motivo principal par poder salir adelante en la vida y tener un futuro mejor.
	
El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de bananos en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 15 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para el mantenimiento de banano, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de bananos produzcan frutos de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de bananos y ver crecer a sus hijos y convertirse en profesionales en la vida y la construcción de su vivienda para tener una condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
Pascual is 38 years old, he is an enterprising man and decided that, to improve his life, he wouldn't let himself be beaten by obstacles he encounters in life, rather he would achieve all his goals and dreams.  He is married and has three children who are excellent students in the nearby school in his community. The children have become his primary motivation to be able to get ahead in life and have a better future.

He gets his income through the production of bananas in the community where he lives. His parents taught him this work. For the past 15 years, he has sold his product in the market and in the nearby areas in his community, and so he has income to improve his family's living conditions.

The respective use for this loan will be caring for his banana crop, since for him it is very important that his banana plants produce the highest quality fruits and so he won't lose the customers he counts on. 

One of his greatest aspirations is to plant more banana plants and to see his children grow and become professionals in their lives, and to build a house to have suitable living conditions.

loans.use: to care for his banana crop.

loans.name: M. Shahdat

texts.en:
Shahdat, 38, is married and the father of three children. He owns a small business manufacturing clothing .  He is hardworking and honest. 

To improve his business, Shahdat wants to purchase fancy beads which will be used in making trendy and formal clothes so his business will attract more customers.  Due to insufficient financing, he has requested a loan to purchase the fancy beads.  This loan will help him boost his business and increase his market outreach. 

He is thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan. 

His dream is to become a successful business man.

loans.use: purchase fancy beads for his clothing factory.

loans.name: Alexandr

texts.en:
Alexandr is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia's Department of Business Administration. Here is his story:

“Everyone has a dream, which he or she tries to reach. And dreams differ as do tastes.  One person hopes to become rich, another strong and smart.  My dreams are to find my own place in society, to have my own happy family, to be a successful businessman.  As I am the only son and future supporter of my parents, I want to be a responsible,  smart and  well-educated person.

My family lives in Tokmok, a small town in the Chuy region of Kyrgyzstan.  My parents decided to live there because it was costly to raise two children in Bishkek.  My parents are vendors at the market, so they are effected by the retail season, the shipment of goods, frequent closures of the borders with neighboring countries and so on.  You never know how much you will earn in any month or year.  My sister is a student at another university.  She studies Korean language. 

I value every dollar my parents invested in me and I appreciate their hard work to make our life comfortable, but I can’t give up my study at AUCA.  I have no doubts that AUCA will help me reach my future goals, as I imagine it, with honesty and integrity.  Critical thinking and academic freedom are what I love most about AUCA.

It is for the above mentioned reasons that I am asking for a loan to pay for my tuition fees so that I can graduate from the university."

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is 32 years old and single with 1 child. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Ruta needs a loan to buy crops, boots, a machete, chemicals, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. 

Ruta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy crops, boots, a machete, chemicals, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op.  She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 40,000.00.  This loan is intended to buy soft drinks, rice, shampoo, candies, biscuits to sustain the demand of the customers.

Bebelyn dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: To buy softdrinks, rice, shampoo, candies, and biscuits to sustain the demand of the customers

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities like eggs, cooking oil, matches, canned goods, vinegar, toothpaste soap and soft drinks. She is a married woman with seven children residing in Ormoc, City, Leyte.  Of the seven children, one is still attending school.  She faces financial problems sustaining her livelihood.

Juditha is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy assorted groceries, soft drinks and canned goods.  These stocks creates impact on various displays in her store and cater to her respective customers' needs, thus improving her daily income and providing good food to the whole family.

Juditha hopes that she will manage her business well enough to improve her status of living as well as to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries, soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Camilla

texts.en:
Camilla is 31 years old and married with 4 children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market.  She has been doing this for 5 years. 

Camilla needs a loan to buy 4 new wheelbarrows, sprayers, a chainsaw, chemicals, overalls, boots, a machete and a shovel.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

 Camilla will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy 4 new wheelbarrows, sprayers, a chainsaw, chemicals, overalls, boots, a machete and a shovel

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 54 years old and married.  She lives in Dumalinao, Pagadian City.

For the past two years,Imelda has been a farmer.  She is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer to improve the growth of her crops. 

In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Helen has been in this business for five years now.

Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin, age 45, lives in Kapsowar, which is a small agricultural center in the Rift Valley area of Kenya.  He is a husband and a father of two lovely children.

Benjamin started a mixed farm in 2005 and he continues to farm for a living.  His primary income sources are eggs, milk, and crops.  Benjamin enjoys poultry farming and dairy farming, above all other activities.  The main challenges he faces with this type of farming are disease outbreaks and expensive dairy feed. 
 
Benjamin is seeking a loan to purchase dairy goats.  To him, raising goats is an enjoyable and lucrative farming experience.  He understands the challenges and the market uncertainties that come with goat farming.  This knowledge has influenced his strategic plans to incorporate a few measures beforehand.  

Benjamin plans to use the income from this investment to repay the loan and to pay for his children’s education.  When he was asked how the loan would benefit his family, he said, “I will be able to educate my children and also feed my family.”

loans.use: To buy a good quality breed of dairy goat

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Tucked away in the countryside near the Gitugi, Thika area of Kenya is a jobless man-turned farmer named Cyrus, the father of five children. He is a hard-working man and is honest and faithful to what he does and what he says. Cyrus is interested in many farming activities. Currently, he is doing dairy farming, maize farming, and horticulture. He has spent the last 10 years in agriculture and loves it. His main sources of income are milk and maize. He makes extra money on the side through a boda boda (motorcycle) business. He is very appreciative of the fact that farming has earned sustainable returns. This enables him to enjoy profits and expand. Cyrus is seeking a loan to purchase a chaff cutter, which is a mechanical device that he will use in cutting straw or hay into small pieces before being mixed together with other forage to feed his cows. Cyrus has been having problems feeding his cows and most of the time his cows refuse to eat but through this loan, the chaff cutter will aid the animal's digestion and prevent the cows from rejecting any part of the food. Through proper feeding, his cows will produce more milk and hence increase his income. Cyrus believes the key to increased milk production is proper health. A dairy cow needs roughage and protein to be healthy. Through increased income from milk selling, he will provide a better life for his family and afford his children's education.
Help this man to progress and go from being just an ordinary farmer to a large-scale dairy farmer. He has the knowledge but needs a small boost to get all his talent up and running.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Tasiu

texts.en:
Tasiu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Tasiu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his two children.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Tasiu had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Tasiu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40% higher than the market prices at harvest. 

When asked, Tasiu  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is 36 years old. She is married with two children aged 5 and 6, both of whom go to school.  She has a shop and has been in the business for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.ru: Нафиса- жительница кишлака Сароби Шахристанского района. По профессии она ткачиха. Но чтобы получит высшее образование Нафиса поступила ХГУ. Она учиться на заочном отделение. Услышав  о кредите на учебу с низким процентом она обратилась в МДО Арванд за поддержкой. Чтобы оплатить договор учёбы.  Нафиса очень рада  за такую возможность  и благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Nafisa is a resident of the Sarobi village of the Shahriston district. She is a seamstress, but to obtain college education, Nafisa was accepted to the Khujand State University. She studies part-time. After learning about low-interest education loans, she came to MDO Arvand for support in order to pay for her tuition. Nafisa is very happy with this opportunity and grateful for the support.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
29-year-old Caroline does not boast of a university degree or even a certificate from an agricultural institute, but she is an accomplished farmer from Kapsowar area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, they are blessed with one child. 

For the past five years Caroline has been involved in dairy farming. And because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, farmers from their village and neighboring villages troop to her home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques. Caroline has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good quality breed of sheep. Sheep farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and wool prices in the recent past have been going up, so Caroline, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of sheep that she will keep, and she knows that she will not only get wool and meat from the sheep but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her wool and meat will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also be selling to big wool processing firms. 

Caroline said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural based loans, and their interest rate is low and is on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going child.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Ndeye Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois est créé en juin 2009. Il regroupe des femmes issues de différents quartiers de la commune de Sédhiou sous le labelle Sœurs Jumelles de par leur entente et la solidarité de groupe de plus elles ont des liens de parenté. Les activités principales que mènent ces femmes concernent : le petit commerce, la transformation et l’artisanat.
    
Madame Ndèye (debout à l’extrême  droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée 62 ans et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 filles et 01 garçon. Elle  vend des tissus pour hommes et femmes. Elle s’approvisionne au Mali et en Gambie. Elle vend à crédit par mensualité ou au comptant selon le client.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 500 pièces de « thioub » tissus teintés et 15 pièces de Bazin unique. 

Avec les bénéfices servent à payer les frais de scolarité des enfants, acheter de la nourriture pour la famille et assurer les frais de soins de santé.
texts.en:
This bank villageois has been created in June 2009. It is composed of women from different neighborhoods of the Sédhiou and is known as Twin Sisters because there is good rapport and mutual support among the group members, who are also related to each other. The group members work as vendors, process food for sale and manufacture artisanal items.

Mrs. Ndèye, the one standing on the right raising her hand, is the star borrower of the group. She is 62 years old, married,  and has three children: two daughters and one son. She sells fabric for men’s and women’s outfits. She stocks up in Mali and in Bambia. She sells in credit, in monthly installments, or for cash, depeneding on the customer.
With her new loan, she plans to buy 500 pieces of “thioub” tie-dyed fabric and 15 sets of regular damask-type “bazin” fabric.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric for resale.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 28 years old. She is married with four children between 1 and 8. Three of them go to school. She has been running a small grocery shop for eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, soap and biscuits to resell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, soap and biscuits to resell

loans.name: 04 Yên Hòa Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa has a retail business where she sells cake, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to sell.

Hoa is 35 years old and she is married, with two children. She is the group leader of the 04 Yên Hòa Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of seven members. 

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 19 years old. He comes from a family of five children. He is an emerging entrepreneur and has just completed training with Zoona to finally make his dream of running his own business come true. Benson needs a loan to kick start his new business venture. 

When Benson finished secondary school last year, he could not go to college to pursue a course in Business Management, as he does not have sponsorship. He describes himself as a determined person who has survived many ups and downs in his life. He says this makes him very strong and focused in whatever he applies himself to. Benson will use this loan to start up a business of mobile money transfers by purchasing a trading booth, which he can use to serve his customers to facilitate mobile money transactions. Benson explains that running his own business will give him the opportunity to provide for his basic needs and improve his standard of living. This prospect excites him and he cannot wait to begin operating his very own Zoona mobile money outlet.
 
Benson’s dream is to one day be in a position where he can help support his siblings to improve their quality of life.

In this photo, Benson poses at an existing Zoona business owner's trading booth.

loans.use: To purchase a Zoona branded kiosk where he can serve his customers

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman who has six kids. Four of her children attend school, but the other two do not. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a grocery and vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market, to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces challenges from the high cost of transportation to her place of operation, and seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a big shop, in future.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman but has no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over six months, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of business.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a female Kiva borrower. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks, sweets, biscuits and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a conducive area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of enough capital to buy stock. She will use the 70,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of drinks, sweets, and other items.

loans.use: buy more stocks of drinks, sweets, and other items

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a 53-year-old, married man who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. For income generation, he deals in produce-selling, farming, timber-cutting, and poultry-keeping. He is a hard-working man with great hopes of educating all his children, but he faces a hardship of having fees for his children ready, on-time. He also complains of the high cost of poultry feed and unpredictable weather changes. 

Tom is asking for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Ana Marina

texts.es:
Ana de 23 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica, su esposo es agricultor, solo él y su hijo viven con ella. Ana es ama de casa pero trabaja como empleada doméstica en la casa de una vecina que le paga por sus servicios, se dedicó a esto por no encontrar otro tipo de trabajo con el que pueda apoyar a su esposo; por lo general trabaja 6 horas al día.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar jabón, aceite, detergentes, pan, golosinas y demás para abastecer el negocio que  inicio y con ello tener una mejor fuente de ingresos para su familia. Ana espera le resulte la inversión y lograr estabilizar el negocio para luego fortalecerlo más.
texts.en:
Ana 23 years old, married, and has one child who is 2 years old. She went to to school up to the ninth grade. Her husband works in agriculture; he and their son live with her. Ana takes care of her home and also works as a maid in her neighbor’s home, where she is paid for her services. She does this work because she hasn't found another job to help her husband contribute to the household. She usually works 6 hours a day. 

Ana is requesting a loan to buy soap, oil, detergents, bread, sweets, and more, to stock the business that she started in order to have a better source of income for her family. Ana hopes to obtain the loan to be able to establish the business and then grow it.

loans.use: to buy soap, oil, detergents, bread, sweets, and more.

loans.name: Capitoline

texts.en: Capitaline is 50 years old. She is married with seven children between the ages of 18 and 25 years old. Three of them go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been running a business for 20 years. With this loan, she would like to buy sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be reinvested and used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Marcelinne

texts.en: Marcelinne is 32 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 10, all of whom go to school. She has a shop and has been in business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more baking powder for making more snacks for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more baking powder for making more snacks for sale.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 29 years old and lives in Mundri in the Western Equatoria State, region of South Sudan. This loan of 1,500 South Sudanese pounds is to help Joel expand his timber business and pay for rent and labor.
