loans.use: To expand his timber business

loans.name: Icyerekezo Group

texts.en:
Icyerekezo is a group led by Olive who is 26 years old. The group name means “vision” in English. She has been a group leader for 3 years. 

She has a shop and has been in business for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and improve her standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Doña Juana ha sabido combinar su tiempo entre su pulpería y la tortillería que tiene en su casa, está casada y tiene ocho hijos pero solo cuatro a su cargo. Doña Juana desde los 15 años trabaja y la pulpería la puso gracias a una liquidación que obtuvo de unos de sus trabajos siempre la han apoyado sus hijos y su esposo. Solicita el crédito para comprar granos básicos y productos de aseo personal entre otros. Este crédito le ayudara a ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y lograra suplir su demanda. Dentro de sus metas próximas esta agrandar el espacio de su tortillería y ofrecer mayor cantidad a sus clientes y luego poner un negocio de comideria.
texts.en:
Juana has divided her time between her store and a tortilla bakery that she has in her home.  She is married and has eight children, but only four are under her care. Juana has worked for 15 years in the store that was opened thanks to a settlement she received. Her work has always supported her children and her husband.  

She is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, personal products, and other items.  This loan will help her to provide a greater variety of products for her customers and obtain the supply desired to meet demand.  Her next goals are to enlarge the space of her tortilla bakery, offer enough quantity to her customers, and later add her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, personal products, and other items.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 27-year-old single and hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. 

He is a mechanic and has been selling motorcycle spare parts for the last four years to earn a living. 

William is hoping to make a retail shop despite high taxes charged and a high rate of defaulters hindering his dream. He intends to use the loan to buy spare parts for selling.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for selling.

loans.name: Hermes Dario

texts.es: Hermes, es un joven de 28 años de edad, dedicado a la administración de un estadero (sitio de esparcimiento y diversión para adultos, donde se expenden bebidas alcohólicas), este negocio inicialmente era de su padre, quien se lo cedió desde el año 2004.  Este negocio se encuentra ubicado en un barrio al sur occidente de Barranquilla, el horario de atención  en la semana es a partir de las 6 p.m. a  12:00 de la media noche y los fines de semana es a partir de las 12:00 meridiano hasta las 2:00 a.m., sus principales clientes son las personas que transitan en el sector y se encuentran fidelizados por el buen ambiente que tiene su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará un enfriador con capacidad de 1000 botellas y hará adecuaciones en el  local.  Esta inversión podrá recuperarse a corto plazo, gracias a que sus ventas se generan con pagos de contado, lo que beneficia el flujo de caja y la reinversión en la compra de bebidas. Hermes tiene como meta familiar casarse y conformar una familia y en su negocio espera a largo plazo construir una segunda planta para incrementar la capacidad del negocio.
texts.en:
Hermes is a young man of 28 years of age, and he makes a living administrating a “estadero” (a site that provides recreation and fun for adults, where alcoholic beverages are sold). This business initially belonged to his father, who gave it to him in 2004 . 

This business is located in a suburb south west of Barranquilla; the weekly opening hours are from 6 pm to midnight, and weekends are from 12:00 meridian until 2:00 am. His main customers are the people passing through town, who are loyal because of the good atmosphere his business has. 

Currently he is applying for a credikiva, which is the first financing that he requests from the “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo”, with which he plans to purchase a cooler with the capacity to hold 1000 bottles, and make adjustments to the premises. This investment will be recovered in the short term because his sales are generated on a cash basis, benefiting cash flow and reinvestment in the purchase of drinks. 

Hermes has a goal of getting married and form a family, and for his business his long-term plan is to build a second floor to increase the business’s capacity.

loans.use: purchase a cooler with the capacity to hold 1000 bottles, and make adjustments to his business

loans.name: Okari

texts.en:
Okari had no savings, pension or income with which to support his five children, siblings and elderly mother after dropping out of school because of a lack of tuition fees and facing a lack of employment. 

Seeing little future in their impoverished village in the Nyanza area of Kenya, he and his wife Lucy moved their family to the more prosperous town of Kitale, hoping to make a go of farming and create a better life for their family. 

In Kitale, Okari decided that he would be independent and contribute to his community by starting poultry farming. Deciding what kind of farming to start was not difficult. He says he was brought up with chickens raised by his grandfather and grandmother. He adds, "It was in my blood.” 

Okari became interested in poultry farming out of the desire to be a solution to the issue of food insecurity, which remains a thorn in the flesh for the whole of Africa. Some time back, Okari joined the Ekebara self-help group, composed of mostly marginalized farmers who could not secure loans from formal financial institutions. The group secured loans from Juhudi Kilimo through a group-based guarantee mechanism. 

After being successfully registered into the company, group members went through training on basic financial and business skills. Group members are a source of encouragement and empowerment for each other.

Okari has applied for a loan of 180,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase more poultry. He is looking to venture into large-scale poultry farming. With time, he will expand.

Income generated from his investments will enable him to meet high farming expenses. His family will also get to enjoy all the benefits that come along with an increased income.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Gona

texts.en:
Gona is a married man with five kids, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees and bills.

Gona operates a grocery vegetables-selling stall. He sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. He faces the challenge of high cost of transportation to his place of operation. He dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES), he wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Jyambere Group

texts.en:
The group is called JYAMBERE, which means “Go ahead” in English. They sell various products and they wish to expand their businesses and improve their future. 

Fortunee is the group leader, age 49. She is married and has four children between 7 and 24 years old, and all of them go to school. 

She has a shop and has been running it for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and biscuits for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and biscuits for sale.

loans.name: Elida Luz

texts.es: Elida de 43 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, con las ventas que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero no tiene de suficiente capital por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, hierro, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra para que ella y sus hijos puedan vivir mas comodos.
texts.en: Elida is 43-years-old; she’s a  single mother and lives in her own home with her four children. She makes a living selling personal products. With the sales that she obtains, she manages to move forward. She wants to improve her housing by building a room in the place that is shown in the picture, but she doesn’t have enough capital. This is why she is requesting a loan to purchase cement, sand, iron, bricks and to pay for the manual labor so that she and her children can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, iron, bricks, and to pay for manual labor

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 55 years old and lives in Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now in their adult and school age. Juliet has been engaged in vegetable gardening and copra production businesses for 15 years already. At present, she's also engaged in a hog raising activity. She earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase one piglet and sacks of booster feed for her new livelihood activity. Juliet has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, She hopes to expand her hog raising business as her new livelihood activity.

loans.use: to purchase one piglet and sacks of booster feed.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a married woman and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past four years, she has owned a food stall business and she sells food to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of client, as perishable goods lead to losses.

With the KSh 50,000, she wants to purchase a stock of goods, like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat . She dreams of expanding to a modern café in her business. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of goods, like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Marbin Antonio

texts.es:
Marbin, de 28 años de edad, estudió bachillerato industrial opción mecánica automotriz, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos, son padres de 3 hijos de los cuales solo uno de ellos asiste a la escuela.- 

Marbin, es comerciante de frutas y verduras desde hace 8 años y decidió dedicarse a este trabajo por la demanda del negocio y también porque obtiene buenos ingresos y es un trabajo que le gusta hacer.

Marbin, sale en su carro a vender las frutas y verduras por todas las colonias cercanas, el préstamo es para la ampliación y mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que cambiará el techo de su casa, pues se encuentra en mal estado.

Se siente feliz porque sabe que con el crédito podrá cubrir esa necesidad, el planea seguir haciendo mejoras en su vivienda para darle buenas condiciones de vida a su familia y espera en un futuro obtener un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Marbin is 28 years old and he attended an industrial high school, specializing in car mechanics. His life partner works as a housewife and they have three children, but only one of them attends school. 

For the past eight years, Marbin has been selling fruit and vegetables and he decided to do this work due to the demand of the business and also because he receives a good income and it is work that he enjoys doing. Marbin goes out in his car to sell fruit and vegetables to all the nearby communities. 

The loan is to expand and improve his home, to change the roof on his house, because it is in bad condition. He is happy because he knows that with the loan he will be able to meet that need. 

He plans to continue doing improvements on his home so he can give his family better living conditions and he hopes to get a new loan in the future to invest in his fruit and vegetable business.

loans.use: to expand and improve his home. He will change the roof, because it is in bad condition.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX. He is 32 years old and is a first-time borrower with UGAFODE MDI. He is married to one wife and has two children. The children are aged 5 and 3 years old respectively.

He is active in tree planting. He works for seven hours a day. He also works as a security guard at a forest reserve in Kyamuhunga Subcounty, where he also earns some money to supplement his income.

He started this business so as to raise money to be able to pay school fees for his children when the time comes for them to go to school. He says he will use the money to make a nursery bed so as to avoid spending much money on buying trees to plant.

His dream is to educate his children. The main challenges he faces in tree planting are weather changes. He is honest.

loans.use: to buy organic manure, trees, and grass for the nursery bed.

loans.name: Anadeus

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders ! Meet Anadeus, a very energetic, hardworking, and ambitious farmer who is 23 years of age.  He is based in Lolminigai, a remote village in the rich highlands of Eldoret, Kenya. For the past ten years he has been involved in mixed farming and selling eggs, milk and with his personal business he has been able to earn a decent and honest livelihood. 

Anadeus passionately loves poultry farming and as he likes to put it “poultry farming is close to my heart”. When asked what he enjoys in poultry farming he responded, “feeding his poultry.” Anadeus sells eggs and poultry products to his neighbors and to the local market and the demand has really grown. He benefits from word of mouth because of his high quality eggs, and this has made demand for his eggs overwhelm him.  

He is seeking funds to buy additional poultry. Through the loan, he will be able to satisfy the increasing demand, and improve his income level.  With the loan he is going to expand to full capacity, and this will improve his profit margins. Through Juhudi Kilimo he has gained both financial and technical training on the best poultry farming techniques.  He is confident that increased profits will be used to repay the loan and to improve his living conditions. Additionally, he will benefit from poultry manure.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry for his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Mary, 61 years old, married, and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. She does maize and bean farming and also operates a general kiosk selling foodstuffs such as sugar, salt, cakes, rice, flour, juice and other domestic item. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled her to manage the business well. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer that will help improve on crop yield. She looks forward to a bountiful harvest, hence increased income. This will assist her to cater for the family needs and in paying school fees. Mary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: This is Elizabeth who is the first born in her family. She lives in hostels as she is far away from her family. She is studying for a Bachelor's degree, majoring in Law. She is in her 4th year and is only one step away from graduation. She is inspired by the need to make a difference in the society. She is struggling to meet her tuition fees with a Kiva loan she will be able to clear her fees and study with peace.

loans.use: to pay for tuition costs

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
A farmer from Kampong Cham Province, Soeun, 44 years old, works very hard on the rice field which is located near her house. She has four children in total; two are single and two are married. Her husband, Savang, 50, is also a farmer on the same field. The couple earns approximately USD 4 a day, on average. Farming is the main task that they have done since 1988.

In this farming season, Soeun lacks money to buy some farm supplies. To continue farming, she is borrowing some money from KIVA now to buy supplies such as fertilizers, seeds and insecticide. She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, seeds and insecticide

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
La señora, María Julia de 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo, tiene casa propia  y  vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 6 años a su negocio que es un pulpería.
Doña María Julia es una mujer  trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante, poco a poco ha ido mejorando su negocio y su vivienda.
Doña María Julia está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de azúcar, frijoles, queso, leche, huevos, aceite, arroz, etc., con esta inversión pretende surtir su negocio y que le genere los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
Su sueño es surtir más su negocio y un día mejorar mas su vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
María Julia is 49 years old, lives with her husband, and has her own home.  She lives in the San Lorenzo village in the south of Honduras.  She has made a living for 6 years at her store business. María Julia is a working woman with a great desire to succeed.  She has gradually been improving her business and her home.

María Julia is asking for a loan to purchase sugar, beans, cheese, milk, eggs, oil, rice, etc.  With this investment she aims to supply her business and to generate the income necessary to succeed with her family.

Her dream is to have a well stocked business and to one day make more improvements to her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November, 2014.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans, cheese, milk, eggs, oil, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert, 43 years old,  lives in Pagadian City, Philippines. He is married and has 4 school-age children. Gilbert operates a motor and welding shop to earn a living to raise his family. He has had this business for 15 years and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month. 

Gilbert has requested a loan to purchase additional materials, equipment and other accessories for his business to improve services. Gilbert has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Gilbert hopes to own a wide and comfortable space where he can relocate his shop to expand his business operation.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, equipment and other accessories for his motor and welding shop business to improve services

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra is 54 years old and single. She lives in Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. For the past two years, Alejandra has been a farmer. She earns 10,000 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC. Alejandra is requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for farming purposes

loans.name: Ntukabumwe Group

texts.en: NTUKABUMWE is a group led by Felicien who is 43 years old. The group name means “Don't be alone” in English. He has been a group leader for 3 years. He sells fruits and has been selling in a business for 9 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, Felicien would like to buy more mangoes and oranges for resale. The profits from the business will be used to improve his standard  of living.

loans.use: to buy mangoes and oranges to resell

loans.name: Rukiri Tukurakurane Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 40-year-old hardworking woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. She has been dealing in produce buying and selling since 2010, and also distilling alcohol, to meet her children's school fees. She hopes to educate her children in spite of price fluctuations of agricultural products.

Rosemary is asking for a loan to buy maize and beans for selling. She is a member of Rukiri Tukurakurane Group, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan, since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for selling.

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Phylis, a mother of four from Koibarak, a rural village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Phylis has been involved in farming for 10 years! Her primary income sources are milk, maize, eggs and other personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet. 

From her experience, dairy farming is not only profitable but also enjoyable: all the animals on her farm are referred to by names. The challenge, however, is that growth is constrained by limited funds/capital. 

Phylis is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She has been keeping poultry for fun for many years. Recently, however, she was taught how poultry can be a big business if it is made commercial. She feared the high costs involved in setting up a commercial poultry farm at first, but after looking at the projections, she sees the point. 

The loan will help Phylis' family improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Ma. Norma

texts.en:
Ma. Norma is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Ma. Norma has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 55 years old and married with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Epifania has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

In the future, Epifania would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en: Noah is 45 years old and married. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda, where he trades in cattle, grows crops and operates a butcher shop to earn income to support his family. He is a family man who would like to see his children attain education. Noah's major challenges are price fluctuations leading to income instabilities and drought that affects his animals due to lack of water and pastures. Noah is asking for a loan to buy more cattle for his business to sell this festive season.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell this festive season.

loans.name: Ombogo

texts.en:
Ombogo is a married  businessman and blessed with three children, all attend school. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not running water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Ombogo has operated a business to sell table cloths, bed sheets, and curtains. He cites changing seasons and stiff competition from other operators to be his major challenge. 

He will use the loan  to pay for medical coverage for his family. He decided to join Yehu to access loans and expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for medical coverage.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a mother of three children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

For the past four years, she has operated a fruit selling business. In addition, she wants to start selling meat in a butcher shop. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other fruits sellers. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase fruits and meat for sale in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and meat for sale in her business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан 1967  года  рождения,  женат и имеет 4-х  детей.  Жена трудится в дехканском хозяйстве. Хасан живёт в сельской местности.   Он  более  10 лет занимается откормом скота, в данный момент Хасан имеет 2 дойные коровы и 1 телёнка, дети помогают ухаживать за ними. Хасан с 2007 года сотрудничает с МДО Арванд, на данный момент его уровень  VIP клиент  в  Арванде, он очень порядочный и образцовый  человек. Он как всегда обратился в МДО Арванд  для  получение кредита для купли продажи крупно рогатых скотов.Он заранее благодарит за сотрудничество.
texts.en: Hasan was born in 1967, is married and has 4 children. His wife works at a dekhan farm. Hasan lives in a rural area. He has been involved in fattening up livestock for over 10 years and at the present time has 2 dairy cows and 1 calf. His children help him take care of the livestock. Hasan has been partnering with MDO Arvand since 2007 and currently has a VIP client status at Arvand. He is a very decent and exemplary person. As always, he came to MDO Arvand to obtain a loan to buy cattle. He is grateful for the partnership in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: José Neftali

texts.es:
José, de 55 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer año de bachillerato, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tienen 3 hijos que viven con ellos actualmente y estudian en la Universidad. 

José perteneció al ejército durante 29 años hasta que se jubiló en esa institución, además, actualmente trabaja como empleado de seguridad en un hospital, funciones que desempeña todos los días en turnos rotativo.

El préstamo es para mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que desea darles buenas condiciones de vida a sus hijos y considera que con el préstamo podrá cubrir esa necesidad.-  José planea seguir trabajando y ver graduados a sus hijos de la carrera que actualmente estudian.
texts.en:
José is 55 years old and studied up to the third year of high school. He is married and his wife takes care of their home. They have three children who curently live with them and study at university.

José was a member of the army for 29 years, until he retired from it. He now works in the security department in a hospital, where he works in shifts every day. 

He is seeking this loan in order to make improvements to his home, as he wishes to give his children good living conditions, and the loan will cover this need. José's plans are to carry on working and see his children graduate with their degrees.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home and give his children good living conditions

loans.name: Dúo Venceremos Group

texts.es:
DUO VENCEREMOS
Doña Angelina es originaria de la Aldea Xetzac Tecpan, ella tiene 55 años de edad y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a 2 hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesos y crianza de animales.
Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y al apoyo de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio, ya que ella empezó con un pequeño negocio y gracias a Dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante.
El crédito que ella recibió lo utilizo para la compra de leche para elaborar sus quesos y compro también concentrado para animales.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela, para un futuro mejor ya que hoy en dia la educación es muy importante para los jóvenes.
texts.en:
DUO VENCEREMOS. Doña Angelina is from the village of Xetzac Tecpan, she is 55 years old and is responsible for 2 children. She makes and sells cheeses and raises animals.

Thanks to the support of her husband and her children she continues to forge ahead with her business. She started with a small business and thanks to God, little by little she has been able to suceed.

She used the loan which she received to buy milk to make her cheeses and also to buy animal feed.

Her dream is to expand her business further to obtain a better income and send her children to school for a better future, as today education is very important for young people.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the making and selling of cheese.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora, Francisca de 61 años de edad, es una mujer soltera que se dedica a la venta de marisco, tiene casa propia  y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Hondura.
Doña Francisca  se dedica desde hace 9 años al negocio, vende los mariscos en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa y Comayagua, es una mujer  trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante y agradece a Prisma ya que poco a poco ha ido mejorando su negocio y su vivienda.
Doña Francisca  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pescado, camarón, jaibas, etc. 
Con el apoyo del crédito  pretende surtir y mejorar su negocio y a su vez espera que le genere las ganancias necesarias y crecer más en su negocio.
Su sueño es surtir más su negocio y un día mejorar mas su vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 61-year-old single woman who makes her living selling seafood. She has her own house in the community of San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras. Francisca has been working in this business for nine years. She sells her seafood in Tegucigalpa and Comayagua.

Francisca is a hardworking woman with a strong desire to get ahead. She is thankful for Prisma, as she has been able to improve her home and her business little by little. She requests this loan to purchase fish, shrimp, crabs, etc. With the aid of this loan, she intends to stock and improve her business, and in turn, generate more profits and grow her business. Her dream is to better stock her business, and one day, improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase fish, shrimp, crabs, etc., for her business

loans.name: Eda Estela

texts.es:
La señora  Eda Estela  de 63  años  de edad es madre soltera ,vive con un  nieto en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 12  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio ubicado en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, en su negocio vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar.
Doña Eda Estela es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante, vende de todo y gracias a su actividad ha podido salir adelante con sus hijos, es un ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación.
Doña Eda Estela está solicitando el préstamo para compra de pollo, dulces, churros, refrescos, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, carnes, lácteos, etc. con el apoyo del préstamo pretende, mejorar su ingreso y salir adelante, está muy contenta de poder trabajar  con Prisma.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Eda Estela, 63 years of age, is a single mother. She lives with a grandson in her house. For the past 12 years, she has made her living in the grocery store business located in a community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. In her business, she sells everything related to basic needs for the family.

Eda Estela is a hardworking and very enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead. She sells everything, and thanks to her business, she has been able to get ahead with her children. She is an example of hard work and dedication.

Eda Estela is applying for a loan to buy chicken, sweets, doughnuts, soft drinks, rice, beans, sugar, meats, dairy products, etc. With the support of the loan, she hopes to improve her income and get ahead.

She is very happy to be able to work with Prisma. Her dream is to improve her business and her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sweets, doughnuts, soft drinks, rice, beans, sugar, meats, dairy products, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. There she has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out clothing repairs. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Maria Sheryll

texts.en: Maria Sheryll, 32 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 2 years, Maria Sheryll has operated a business selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. Maria Sheryll has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers. In the future, Maria Sheryll would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ingenzi Group

texts.en: Ingenzi is a group led by Berthe who is 55 years old. The group name means “Necessary” in English. Berthe has been a group leader for 3 years. She sells foodstuff and has been in a business for 5 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. With this  loan, Berthe would like to buy more rice to resell. The profits from the business will be used to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: buy rice to sell

loans.name: Amina Hassan

texts.en:
Amina Hassan is a maize farmer and a member of the Babban Gona Farmers Organization. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Zahariya, Thomas and Dan-Asebe.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Amina Hassan had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, she can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later at prices up to 40% higher than at harvest time. 

When asked, Amina Hassan spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children. She hopes to eventually become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kyanjuki Thukolere Haghuma Women Group

texts.en:
Idaya is twenty-eight years old and married with three children. She is a member of Kyanjuki Thukolere Haghuma Women, living in Kasese Uganda. Idaya is a fish vendor who has been selling fish for thirteen years. She began the business after dropping out of school due to lack of funds for school fees. She also sells cassava flour to get additional income. 

Idaya has a dream of expanding her business and getting more profits. However, she is faced with a challenge of poor roads, price fluctuations and bad weather. Idaya wants money to buy fish and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Nyanyo Kpakpa Group

texts.en:
These three women come from the same neighborhood and are part of the Nyamyo Kpakpa Group. The name of their group means 'good friends.' They are bound by good social, economic, and business relationships. They are selling slippers, shoes, beef, vegetables, gizzard and other foodstuffs. They will need a total loan amount of GHS 4300 to expand their businesses.

Hannah is the group's representative. She's standing in the middle of the photograph. She's married and the mother of a boy. She's a merchant. Her new loan request of 1,500 GHS will enable her to buy tomatoes, eggs, peppers, and onions to sell to customers. The generated profits will enable her to cover her children's food and health needs, but will also help strengthen her savings account with Kiva Field Partner ID Ghana.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, eggs, peppers, and onions to sell to customers

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru:
Одил мужчина в возрасте 60 лет. Женат и имеет троих детей . Одил работает мастером. Он получает заказы на отделку домов и этим зарабатывает на жизнь. В его деле ему помогают его сыновья.  Одил  хочет произвести  ремонт в своем доме, но для этого ему не хватает собственных средств для покупки строительных материалов. Он обратился в МДО Арванд и хочет получить кредит. 
Заранее благодарит  МДО Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Odil is a 60-year-old man. He is married and has three children. Odil works as contractor. He receives orders to renovate houses, and this is how he earns a living. His sons help him with this business. Odil wants to make repairs in his house, but does not have enough of his own money to buy building materials. He came to MDO Arvand and wants to obtain a loan. He thanks MDO Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to repair his house

loans.name: Hudoykul

texts.ru:
Худойкул  жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина . Ему 46 лет. Худойкул женат. Он имеет 3-их детей. У Худойкула высшее образование. Он живет со своей семьей в сельской местности.
Худойкул занимается своим бизнесом. Он покупает на рынках скот,  ухаживает за ним некоторое время, а после продаёт скот. Получает Худойкул от этого дела не плохой доход. 
Сейчас Худойкул хочет увеличить количество скота и купить корм для них на зиму. Для этого он обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Худойкул заранее благодарит за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Hudoykul is a happy and hardworking man. He is 46 years old. Hudoykul is married and has 3 children. Hudoykul has a college education. He lives with his family in a rural area. Hudoykul is involved in his own business. He buys livestock at markets, cares for it for a set period of time and then resells it. Hudoykul earns a good income from this business. Now Hudoykul wants to increase his livestock headcount and buy livestock feed for the winter. This is why he is requesting a loan from Arvand. Hudoykul is grateful for the support in advance and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: to buy livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Philibus B.

texts.en:
Philibus is a maize farmer and a member of the Babban Gona Farmers Organization. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his 3 children.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Philibus had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Philibus spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, hoping to eventually become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 07 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Dung operates a small restaurant selling soup. She is applying for a loan to purchase more ingredients for the soup she cooks.

Dung is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Thôn 07 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of three members. She joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2013 to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Dung is 49 years old, and she is married with two children. She has been involved in the restaurant business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for the soup she sella

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock such as beverages, canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Wonderful Kiva lenders! Introducing you to Robert. Robert is a 35-year-old honest, hard-working and ever-smiling father of four adorable children. He hails from Litein in Kenya, a tea-growing area where the staple food is “Mursik,” a mouth-watering delicacy prepared from milk. Robert has been involved in farming for the past 15 years and he owns dairy cows that produce milk for sale. Besides his dairy cows, he also keeps poultry and when you visit his farm you will witness tea growing as well as a variety of vegetables. Robert has a passion for dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows “Seroy” (from a person's name); but all is not well for this humble man. He is facing the challenge of the lack of a proper dairy unit which is why he is seeking funds to construct a proper dairy unit. With your loan, he will be able to better manage his dairy farm and create more value. A better dairy unit will assist Robert to save more money because his cows will never be sick and this will also boost his dairy's milk production. Through building a dairy unit with the loan, Robert will be able to collect the cows' by-products, namely, cow dung and urine which can be sold or better yet used on his farm. With a dairy unit, he will be able to better feed his animals and collect by-products such as dung to generate biogas fuel, make organic fertilizer and plaster his mud hut. The money that he will earn from the dairy unit will be reinvested back into the business to create growth. Robert is a very ambitious man and he projects that through the loan he will have higher quality dairy cows and be able to permanently change his living conditions and secure his children's future.

loans.use: to construct a proper dairy unit for his cows

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel, 33 years old, is married and has two children. She has operated a pig fattening business for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store. Maricel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Venancio

texts.en: Venancio, who has been operating a human laboratory since 2001 as his source of income, is a married Ugandan man of 29 years with two children. He is also employed in a health centre and plans to improve his business as well as a video hall for increased income. Venancio is hardworking and honest though challenged by bad weather changes hindering road transport. He intends to use the loan to buy a microscope to use in his laboratory.

loans.use: to buy a microscope to use in his labaratory.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, a married and hardworking man, lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He sells produce together with a bar to generate his family income. Joseph desires to grow his business into a big well-stocked produce store in order to meet his customers' demands. He wants to buy a car to make his service delivery easier and quicker despite challenges of bad weather changes leading to poor roads. Joseph is requesting a loan to buy maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize for selling.

loans.name: Tugumisirize Saaco Group

texts.en:
William is an honest Ugandan married man of 67 years with five children. He lives in Kagadi where he has been selling alcohol and farming since 2001 for income generation. He hopes to grow his business despite capital insufficiency. which is his major challenge. William is asking for a loan to buy more jerrycans of alcohol to sell. 

He is a member of Tugumisirize Saaco Group where each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of alcohol to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Sani Musa

texts.en:
Sani Musa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Sani Musa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his 2 children.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sani Musa had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sani Musa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Sani Musa spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zarzamora Group

texts.es:
Doña Hilaria es una mujer un poco seria, pero de vez en cuando una también deja salir una sonrisa. Ella tiene 42 años de edad y está casada desde hace 23 años, con el señor Gregorio quien trabaja en la construcción de casas, juntos conformaron una familia con 6 hijos de los cuales tres aun dependen de ellos.

Hace nueve años Hilaria escuchó hablar de VisionFund y decidió solicitar su primer préstamo para la cría y engorda de borregos, pero en realidad ya tiene 20 años de experiencia porque en la comunidad donde vive es una actividad muy fácil para llevar a cabo. Los borregos difícilmente llegan a enfermar y no hay tanta necesidad de comprar alimento porque se aprovecha el campo para alimentarlos. Desde muy temprano, Doña Hilaria barre el corral de sus animales, a mediodía los saca a pastar al campo y los deja amarrados mientras ella aprovecha el tiempo para hacer la limpieza de su casa. Ya que el sol comienza a caer nuevamente los guarda en el corral.

A Doña Hilaria le encanta criar sus borreguitos porque desde pequeña sus padres la involucraron en el cuidado de los animales que tenían en casa. Ahora tiene siete borregos los cuales está por vender en de diciembre; sus ganancias le ayudarán a solventar los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus niños, pero ya no tendrá suficiente dinero para volver a invertir en animales pequeños. Por ello solicita un préstamo con el cual podrá continuar su actividad. Afortunadamente Hilaria es muy conocida en la comunidad y sus clientes llegan a comprar directamente a su casa “Por muchos años me dedicado a la cría de los borregos siempre trato de dar un buen precio para que regresen” comentó Doña Hilaria.

Don Juan, Raúl, y Julia  que son los demás miembros del grupo también se dedican a la cría de borregos. Todos ellos tienen una amplia experiencia cuidando animales y saben que la mejor época en ventas está por llegar ya que las personas de la comunidad tiene fiestas y celebraciones por el cierre de año. 

Los integrantes están muy agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA porque les ha ayudado a mejorar sus negocios y su calidad de vida. Doña Hilaria quiere continuar con la cría y engorda de borregos para solventar los gastos de educación de sus hijos porque quiere seguir apoyándolos económicamente.

*La fotografía se tomó en la plazoleta central del municipio donde viven los integrantes y se aprecian los conocidos arcos.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a bit of a serious woman, but every once in a while a smile escapes her. She is 42 years old and has been married for 23 years to Gregorio, who works in home construction. Together they formed a family with 6 children, 3 of whom still depend on them.

Nine years ago, Hilaria heard about VisionFund and decided to apply for her first loan to raise and fatten lambs. But in reality, she already has 20 years of experience, because in the community where she lives, it is a very easy activity to do. The lambs rarely get sick, and there is not much need to buy food, because they take advantage of the fields to feed them.

Starting very early, Hilaria sweeps her animals' pen. At noon she takes them out to pasture and leaves them tied up while she takes advantage of the time to clean her house. Once the sun starts to set, she puts them back in the pen.

Hilaria loves to raise her little lambs, because from a young age, her parents involved her in the care of the animals they had at home. Now she has seven lambs, which will be ready to sell in December. Her earnings will help her cover household expenses and her children's education, but then she will not have enough left to re-invest in small animals. That is why she is applying for a loan, with which she will be able to continue her business.

Fortunately, Hilaria is very well known in the community, and her customers come to her house to buy directly from her. "I have been raising lambs for many years, and I have always tried to give a good price so that they come back," says Hilaria.

Juan, Raúl, and Julia, who are the remaining members of the group, also make their living raising lambs. They all have a lot of experience taking care of animals and know that the best season for sales is coming, since people from the community have parties and celebrations for the end of the year.

The members are very grateful to VisionFund and Kiva, because they have helped them improve their businesses and their quality of life. Hilaria wants to continue raising and fattening lambs to cover the costs of her children's education, because she wants to continue supporting them financially.

*The photograph was taken in the small municipal square where the members live and the renowned arches can be seen.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
Шахноза жизнерадостная девушка 22 лет. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Шахноза живет со своей семьей в городе Душанбе. У неё нет высшего образования.
 Чтобы зарабатывать на пропитание Шахноза работает швеёй. Шахноза шьет национальные платья. От данного дела она получает хороший доход.  Она берет заказы на дому, чтобы одновременно и работать и воспитывать своего ребенка, заниматься домашним хозяйством.  Сейчас Шахноза хочет купить новую швейную машинку для продвижения своего бизнеса. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Шахноза заранее благодарит за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат
texts.en: Shahnoza is a happy, 22-year-old young woman. She is married and has one child. Shahnoza lives with her family in the city of Dushanbe. She does not have a college education. Shahnoza works as a seamstress to earn a living. She sews national dresses. She earns a good income from this business. She accepts orders at home, so that she can works and concurrently take care of her child and the household. Now Shahnoza wants to purchase a new sewing machine in order to grow her business. This is why she is requesting this loan from Arvand. Shahnoza is grateful for the support in advance and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine in order to grow her business

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
To be young and starting a new family with a fragment of land is a challenge for people in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Erick, the father of one boy, has overcome this challenge and has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. He is a hardworking, very honest and warm-hearted farmer. The Kapsowar area of Kenya has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. 

Erick’s upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, he promised himself that he would work hard to get out of poverty, which is why he started farming six years ago. Through farming, he has been able to earn a decent income. Erick is the breadwinner of his family, and this really pushes him to work hard so that his family will have a bright future and his parents will have a comfortable life. 

Erick is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming so that he can use the excess space on his land. He dreams of buying more land and increasing his farming. Accessing funds is very difficult for men who are smallholders in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Erick is optimistic that his dream will be realized and his life will completely change. Through the income from horticultural farming, Erick will assure his family of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for his child and siblings who depend on him. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

loans.use: to start horticultural farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start her own business by buying ready-made women's clothes and reselling them.

loans.name: Sohibjon

texts.ru:
Сохибчон очень активный и жизнерадостный молодой парень 22 года. Сохибчон женат. У него пока еще нет детей. Он учится в высшем учебном заведении. Он живет со своей семьей в сельской местности. 
Помимо учебы у Сохибчона есть работа. Его работа позволяет Сохибчону одновременно и учится и работать. Чтобы оплатить свою учебу Сохибчон обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой помощью. Сохибчон заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Sohibjon is a very active and happy 22-year-old young man. Sohibjon is married and does not yet have children. He attends a university. He lives with his family in a rural area. Besides studies, Sohibjon also has a job that allows him to study and work concurrently. Sohibjon came to MDO Arvand for financial help to pay for his tuition. Sohibjon is grateful to Arvand for the support in advance and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: to pay for his university education

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en:
As a farmer from Kampong Cham Province, Chheang, 44 years old, is working very hard. He works on the rice field which is located near his house. His wife, Vanna, 28, is also a farmer in the same field. This couple has only one child, who is studying in school. On average, they can earn approximately USD 4 a day. Being farmers is the main task that they have done since 1998.

In this farming season, Chheang is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue his farming, he is borrowing some money from Kiva now, to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides. He is thankful to lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a single woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as persistent. 

She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fish spoiling. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more fish stock. 

 She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her family's living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.	She will use the anticipated profits to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 43 years old and married. She is from the village of Zamboanga del Sur. Cristina operates a specialized retail store selling fashionable items and accessories in the local community, which she has been doing for over six years. She earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2013, Cristina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She requested her second loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Benson's Group

texts.en: Benson is a 42-year-old tree farmer and widower. He has eight children, six of whom are in school. He also cultivates watermelons, tomatoes and eggplants. Benson decided to join Komaza to improve his family's standard of living. He says his favorite part about working with the organization is enjoying the partnership with them. Benson plans to spend the money earned from his tree farm to start a family business. Benson is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to receive inputs such as tree seedlings, technical training and planting support through Komaza.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou, 49 years old, is married and has three children, all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 19 years, Marilou has operated a business buying and selling kitchen wares in the Philippines. Marilou has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of kitchen wares to sell. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of kitchen wares to sell

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 31 years old and lives in Mundri in the Western Equatoria state region of South Sudan. She is married with four children. 

A the loan of 1,500 SSP will help her to pay for new stock to sell.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Habibu

texts.en:
Habibu is a widowed mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees. 

For over nine years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 56 years old and married, with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Juliana is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Juliana has been in pig-fattening for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mwadiga

texts.en:
Mwadiga is a widowed mother of two children, one of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is married and has been blessed with three  children, two of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Hellen operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruit for resale.

loans.name: Njina

texts.en:
Njina is aged 36 years. She is married with four children; two of them are in school and two are not yet in school. She started a hotel and a decorations business in 1994, and is now a well-known business lady in Ishaka Municipality in Bushenyi District. She works for 10 hours a day and she says most of her clients are hospital students, especially those who are preparing birthday parties. 

Njina has been a UGAFODE client for almost six loan cycles and now she has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 - the same amount as the previous cycle. She started these businesses to generate income, and she says she will use this loan to buy more stock. She also says paying school fees for her children will be a great achievement, and has been her dream idea. She is honest to her clients. She says the high rent for the room she operates from is her main challenge. She says she has worked with UGAFODE MFI for so long, saying that services have been perfect. She is so grateful for the support.

loans.use: To buy materials for decoration.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is a married man and has been blessed with six children, of whom one is in school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables to local customers. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation to his place of operation. 

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks

loans.name: Teeltaaba2 De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur  ZACHARIA est le  représentant  du groupe TEELTAABA2  DE ROLLO. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé à 30 ans et le moins âgé a 10 ans. 04 vont à l’école. Il  a 10 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait du maraichage depuis 05 ans. Il  s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier, ces clients sont les habitants des villes voisins. 
Il  veut  s’acheter  02 sacs d’engrais ; 20 litres d’essence.
Monsieur désire épargner ces bénéfices. Il  ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Zacharia is the representative of the Teeltaaba2 de Rollo group. He is doing very well.

Zacharia is married and the father of 6 children, the oldest of whom is 30 years old and the youngest of whom is 10 years old. Zacharia has 10 people in his care.

He has been farming for 5 years. Zacharia gets his supplies at a market in his neighborhood; his customers are residents of the surrounding cities.

Zacharia would like to purchase 2 bags of fertilizer and 20 liters of fuel. He hopes to be able to save his earnings. Zacharia's big dream is to grow his business and to be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bags of fertilizer and 20 liters of fuel

loans.name: Marry's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 51 year old Komaza tree farmer. She has nine children, five of whom are in school. Mary is married, and her spouse is a member of the  Komaza staff. In addition to growing trees, Mary also cultivates maize, cowpeas, cassava and green grams. She supports her family with farming. Mary decided to join Komaza because she loved her neighbor's trees. She plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to to pay school fees, and buy a dairy cow. Mary’s favorite part about working with Komaza is enjoying the environmental aesthetics that the trees bring. 

Mary is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her.

Flora is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a website, Facebook marketing, and additional materials for her salon.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 35 years old and married with three children.  

Victoria is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Victoria has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bundle of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: M.fiaz

texts.en:
M.Fiaz is a 32-year-old, married, and energetic man, living with his spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a general store in which he sells shampoo, bath soaps, detergents, biscuits, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, as well. His relatives also like to purchase items from his general store. 

M.Fiaz speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town. That is the reason his business is running well. 

Due to his good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stocks to cope with the demand. Therefore, M.Fiaz requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy more stocks for his general store. 

M.Fiaz hopes that lenders will support him and this loan will prove productive for his business, as well. He is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle system and he is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for his general store.

loans.name: Upile Group

texts.en: Eliza is a 33-year old married woman who supports her family by selling clothes. She used to be farmer and now she owns a market stall with the help of the loans she has been obtaining. She has been running this business for previous years and she started the business in order to pay medical bills and pay school fees for her children. She requested the loan so she could order more cooking oil to reach more customers in her locality. She hopes to expand her business and her vision is to be able to pay school fees for her children. Since she started accessing the loans there has been a positive change as she is a able to feed her family.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more perfumes and incense to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Sreyleak

texts.en:
Sreyleak is a-23-year-old, married garment worker. She has a small child, and she lives in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been a laborer since 2013. Her husband is 24 years old, and he is a bread vendor. Together, they can earn approximately $13 a day.

To help improve her husband’s business, Sreyleak would like to request a loan. She will use it to buy a motorcycle, for her husband to use to carry bread to the nearby villages to sell. With the motorcycle, her husband will be able go farther, to have more buyers and improve the family’s finances. For her plan, she is going to build a new house when she has enough money.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to use, to carry bread to other villages to sell.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru:
Эта молодая швея по имени Парвина повторно обращается за кредитом. Первый свой кредит она использовала целенаправленно и уже успешно погасила его. Пользуясь случаем она благодарит кредиторов Kiva за финансирование.
Парвина неустанно продолжает свою деятельность и наменера достичь еще большего успеха. Для этого она снова обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести необходимые ткани и нитки для шитья. Количество ее клиенток увеличиваются и ей необходимо расширить деятельность. Поэтому этот кредит ей сейчас важен, чтобы не потерять клиентов.
texts.en:
This young seamstress, named Parvina, takes a loan for the second time. Her first loan was used purposefully, and she already repaid it successfully. She takes this opportunity to thank the Kiva lenders for the financing. 

Parvina continues her business tirelessly and intends to achieve even more success. To do this, she again applied for a loan, in order to purchase necessary fabric and thread for sewing. The number of customers is increasing and she needs to expand her business. Therefore this loan is important to her, in order to not lose customers.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread for sewing

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is managing her eatery business in Dumalinao, Pagadian City. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. The business has been doing well in supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and will also accept catering for added income.

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be happier to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan, 31, is living in Batheay District, Kompong Cham Province of Cambodia. He has two dependent children who are currently attending school. To make a living, he has been working as a construction worker since 2005. On average, he is able to make an earning of USD 2.00 per day. Apart from the construction sector, he also has a small piece of farmland where he grows rice seasonally. 
 
In this farming season, he is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue his farming, he is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  He is thankful to lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 61-year-old woman from the town of Carles, Iloilo. She has five grown children. She has been engaged in fishing for 36 years now. She is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fuel for her fishing boat as well as fishing nets to replace the old ones. Alma hope that with the loan, she can do fishing without delay.

Her income will then be used to buy healthy meals for her family, do home renovation and reinvest in the same business.
   
In the future, she hopes to be able to expand her fishing business so she can have enough savings.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fuel.

loans.name: Bodour

texts.en:
Bodour is a 20-year-old lady; she lives with her family of twelve members in Mafraq. There are five members in the family who go to university to get their bachelor's degrees, one of them is Bodour. She is in her third year majoring in special education. 

Their parents are trying their best to make sure all of their children get a higher education, but Bodour wanted to help out this semester by taking out a loan to pay for her next semester fees and make it easier on her parent to pay for her siblings at once.

loans.use: To pay for her next semester fees.

loans.name: Roqueza

texts.en:
Roqueza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials for her furniture making business.

Roqueza has been in this business for 5 years. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her furniture making business

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 45 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Vicenta is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Vicenta has been in pig fattening for 16 years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mitchelie

texts.en:
Mitchelie, 40 years old, is married with 3 children. She has her retail business to make additional income for a living. Before, she often helped her husband peddling fish in their village. 

She took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods for her mobile retail store. She is hoping to expand her business and build a shelter for her retail store in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for her mobile retail store.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 44 years old and lives in Buenavista, Pagadian City. In order to help the family, she sells rice cakes. Aside from selling rice cakes, she operates a sari-sari store. In 2013, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. 

She wants to obtain financial assistance of an amount of PHP 13,000 to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store to increase sales and earn more profit, because selling rice cakes is not sufficient for her daily needs. 

She plans to send all her children to college so that they can help her in the future, and to repair their house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina es una mujer de 41 años de edad, que se encuentra dedicada al comercio desde el año 2001, anteriormente ella trabajaba con empresas, pero al quedar embarazada decidió retirarse y para estar mas tiempo con su hijo y poderlo cuidar, encontró en el comercio una alternativa para recibir ingresos y compartir mas con su familia.  Su negocio consiste en la venta de video juegos, CD de música variada, DVD de videos o películas, accesorios para teléfonos celulares  y venta de minutos a celular.  Así mismo aprovecha negocios de temporada por ello está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará juguetes para la navidad al por mayor para obtener una mejor ganancia, también invertirá en una vitrina mostrador para los accesorios de celular.  Esta inversión beneficia su negocio, porque logra incorporar una línea de productos que se venden en una temporada del año en el que la demanda  y el poder adquisitivo de las personas es mayor, por lo tanto la recuperación de la inversión es a corto plazo. Luz Marina es madre de dos hijos menores de edad a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida por ello trabaja con mucha dedicación y sacrificio para darles educación de calidad y a largo plazo planea comprar su casa propia.  Su meta en el negocio es incrementar las utilidades aunque su principal desafío se lidiar con el escaso capital de trabajo que posee.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a 41 year old woman who has made a living in commerce since 2001. Previously she had worked with companies, but when she was pregnant decided to take some time off and spend more time with her child and take care of him.  She discovered commerce as a way to earn income and share with her family.  Her business is in the the sale of video games, music CDs, DVD films, cellphone accessories, and cellular minutes.

In order to take advantage of seasonal business, she is now applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that will enable her to buy toys for Christmas at wholesale and make a better profit.  Also she will invest in a counter display case for cellphone accessories. This investment benefits her business because it allows her to incorporate a line of products that are sold in a season of the year in which the demand and purchasing power of people is greater. Therefore the payback of the investment is short term.

Luz Marina is the mother of two younger children and wants to give them a better quality of life. Therefore she works hard and sacrifices to give them a quality education and is planning long term to buy her own home. Her goal in this business is to increase profits and her main challenge has been dealing with the limited working capital that she has.

loans.use: to buy toys for Christmas and a counter display case for cellphone accessories.

loans.name: Edireda

texts.en:
Edireda is forty-eight years old and is married with five children, living in Kasese Uganda. Edireda operates a restaurant that she has been running for the last four years in order to improve on the family income. 

Edireda has a dream of providing her customers with the best services. However,she is faced with a challenge of market competition and limited capital to expand her business into a modern restaurant. 

Edireda needs a loan to buy raw foods like bananas and fresh beans, plates and saucepans to use in the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy raw foods like bananas and fresh beans, plates and saucepans to use in the restaurant.

loans.name: Leaney

texts.en:
A farmer living in Battambang province, Leaney is 51 years old and a mother of four children. To make a living, she grows rice and makes wine to earn additional income to support her family. She can earn an income of about 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is her second cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in Banking. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in Banking.

loans.name: Ahliddin

texts.ru: Ахлиддин родился в 1989 году в древнем городе Истравшан в семье рабочего. Ахлиддин женат и имеет 2х детей. Он  вместе  с семьей живет  в доме который построили сами. В этом доме они живут  душа в душу. Ахлиддин вместе с женой старается воспитать  своих детей хорошими  людьми . Ахлиддин  очень жизнерадостный мужчина и любящий отец. Ахлиддин  уже   13 лет занимается животноводством. ОН знает все тонкости этого дела. Дополнительный доход Ахлиддина от молочного изделия. Он занимается куплей продажей молочных изделий. Ахлидин обратился в МДО Арванд для получение кредита для покупки скота. Он заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Ahliddin was born in 1989 in the ancient city of Istaravshan in a working family. Ahliddin is married and has two children. Together with his family he lives in a house which he built himself. They live together in perfect harmony in this house. Ahliddin and his wife try to raise their children to be good people. Ahliddin is a very happy man and a loving father.
