Ahliddin has worked with livestock breeding for 13 years. He knows all the tricks of his trade. He gets an additional income from dairy products, which he sells. Ahliddin turned to "MDO Arvand" to get a loan to purchase cattle. He thanks in advance for the support and faith.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago, de 56 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, en aquellos tiempos la enseñanza era limitada, ya que no había muchas personas preparadas como maestros para enseñar, por esa razón solo estudió hasta ese grado, para poder continuar tenía que viajar a la ciudad y la economía de sus padres no alcanzaba para cubrir los costos.- Santiago está acompañado desde los 23 años, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos, juntos han trabajado y logrado tener una familia de cinco hijos, todos son mayores de edad, solo uno de sus hijos está estudiando noveno grado, los demás trabajan ya que tienen sus propias familias.  

Él se dedica a la agricultura, actualmente tiene sembrado 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol, con lo que le da abasto a las necesidades en el hogar.- Toda su vida se ha dedicado a este tipo de actividades, ya que desde pequeño su padre le enseño todo lo relacionado a ello, años atrás también se dedicó a operador de maquinaria, trabajando en calles y en muchas otras actividades de  construcción. 

El terreno donde trabaja le queda a 1 km, el recorrido lo hace a pie, en los trabajos involucra a su hijo menor, también, paga mano de obra para poder cubrir todas las labores diarias, el horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 12:00 md. 

Santiago, utilizara el préstamo para el pago de mano de obra y maquinaria para sacar sus cultivos, ya que se acerca el tiempo de la cosecha, y con esto cubrirá la necesidad de poder llevar los granos básicos al hogar.

El sueño de Santiago, es poder seguir trabajando para sacar su familia adelante y espera que sus hijos sean personas de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Santiago, who is 56 years old, studied as far as fourth grade. In those days teaching was limited since there weren't many people trained to teach and so he only studied this far. To continue with his education he would have had to travel to the city and his parents' finances did not stretch to covering the expense.

Santiago has had a partner for 23 years. His life partner does domestic work and together they have worked and managed to raise a family of five children. They are all adults and only one son is studying, in ninth grade. The others are working and have their own families now.

Santiago works in agriculture. Currently he has 14,000 square metres planted with corn and 7,000 square metres of beans, which enable him to meet the needs of his household. He has done this work all his life, because starting when Santiago was little his father taught him everything about it. Years ago he also worked as a machinery operator, working in the streets and in many other construction activities.

The land he works on is 1km away and he gets there on foot. He involves his younger son in the work and also pays for labour in order to be able to do all the daily tasks. The working day is from 6am to 12 noon.

Santiago will use the loan to pay for labour and machinery to harvest his crops, since the harvest time is approaching, and with this he will be able to satisfy the need to be able to provide basic grains for the household.

Santiago's dream is to able to continue working to help his family get on in life and he hopes his children will become decent members of society.

loans.use: to pay for labour and machinery to harvest his crops.

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru: Фахриддин жизнерадостный парень 29 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Его жена трудится в дехканском хозяйстве. Фахриддин таксисит, и более 7 лет занимается перевозкой людей на своей легковой машине ZAFIRA по маршруту Зафаробод - Айни, Айни –Дусти, и неплохо зарабатывает.   Фахриддин   решили с женой купить новую мебель: спальный  гарнитур, диван кресло  для улучшение  удобства в доме, но для покупки  мебели им нахватает  собственных средств.  Фахриддин решил обратится в МДО Арванд. Он подал заявку на кредит.  Фахриддин благодарит Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Fahriddin is a happy guy of the age of 29. He is married and has two children. His wife works at a dekhan farm. Fahriddin is a taxi driver, and has worked with transporting people in his own passenger car, and Opel Zafira, on the routes Zafarabad - Ayni and Ayni - Dusti for a period of seven years. He earns well. 

Fahriddin and his wife decided to purchase new furniture: A bedroom set and a sofa chair for improving the comfort of their home. However they do not have enough money to purchase this furniture. Fahriddin decided to turn to "MDO Arvand" and he applied for a loan. Fahriddin thanks "Arvand" for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married male and lives in Kagadi, Uganda where he earns an income from produce selling.  He also has a butchery shop business to supplement this income. 

Paul is challenged by bad weather especially through the rainy season when roads are almost impassable and transport costs increase. 

His desire, for his family, is to have all his children complete university. He is asking for a loan to buy beans for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans for selling.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single young man from Tulkarm city. He lives with his parents and seven brothers and sisters in a small house. His father works as an employee in a local firm. This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad is a student in his last year where he studies Accounting, he hopes to find a job soon after he finishes his studies.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and start preparing his seminars. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Dúo San Vicente Pacaya Group

texts.es:
Dúo San Vicente Pacaya
Vitalino es casado, se dedica a  la elaboración y venta de pan en su comunidad se siente muy satisfecho ya que actualmente también distribuye pan en las colonias cercanas a su domicilio,  y su producción a aumentado mucho y eso ha ayudado para que su familia se encuentre mejor económicamente,  quisiera comprar un carro para realizar más rápido sus ventas y  cansarse menos pero confía en Dios que pronto llegara, agradece el apoyo brindado por KIVA,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de pan para la venta.
texts.en:
San Vicente Pacaya Duo

Vitalino is married and makes a living making and selling bread in his community. He is very satisfied because he also currently distributes bread to communities near his home. His production has increased, which has helped his family to be better situated financially. He would like to buy a cart to sell his products more quickly and get less tired. He has faith in God that it will soon come. He is grateful for the Kiva lenders' support. He is applying for this loan to buy materials to make bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy materials to make bread to sell.

loans.name: Los Higos Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo “Los Higos” son personas muy platicadoras mientras que Doña Teresa contaba su historia todos los demás se mostraban muy interesados y divertidos. Ellos son vecinos y se conocen desde hace varios años, aún conservan su lengua materna, tradiciones y cultura pero sobretodo una gran amistad que los une. Los integrantes del grupo son Manuel, Amelia y Gabriela quienes invertirán en la venta de fantasía; Victoria, en trastes; Icela, en productos de limpieza y José Manuel, en nopales para su venta. 

Doña Teresa es una mujer muy amable siempre está muy sonriente aunque es un poco discreta con lo que dialoga, en la comunidad le dicen de cariño Tere, tiene 35 años de edad y está casada desde hace 20 con el señor José, juntos formaron una familia con cuatro hijos todos ellos se encuentran estudiando. Don José  platica que toda su vida se ha dedicado al comercio de artículos de temporada debido a que sus padres también eran vendedores. Cuando decidió formar su propia familia con Doña Tere, se independizó pero buscó nuevos puntos de venta para no competir con su papá ni sus hermanos.

Doña Tere comenta que al ver que con el comercio se obtenían buenas ganancias, se dispuso ayudar a su esposo. Ya son 15 años de actividad y los ingresos han ido aumentando lo que ayuda a solventar los gastos del hogar y de la educación de sus hijos. Dependiendo de la temporada del año Tere vende distintos artículos, el día de muertos vende flores y adornos, herramientas en la época de cosecha de maíz y en otros meses artículos de fantasía, frutas y verduras. 

Tere compra toda la mercancía en la ciudad de México en cantidades grandes para poder obtener un mejor precio y revenden en fiestas, ferias y plazas ya que no cuentan con un establecimiento, la pareja camina por las calles para no pagar cuotas por establecerse en algún espacio fijo. La jornada de trabajo es de 4 am a 8 pm y siempre están al tanto de la apertura de nuevas plazas para abarcar más puntos de venta.

Doña Tere está muy agradecida con VisionFund porque gracias al apoyo económico, la actividad es estable y puede continuar con la posibilidad de ofrecer a sus hijos una carrera profesional. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de Tere, ella viste un pants de color rosa.
texts.en:
The members of the "Los Higos" ["The Figs"] group are chatty people; while Doña Teresa told her story, all the others appeared to really be interested and entertained. They are neighbors and have known each other for several years. They still maintain their native language, traditions, and culture, but above all, they are united by their strong friendship. The other members of the group are Manuel, Amelia, and Gabriela, who will invest in and sell costume jewelry,Victoria, who sells kitchenware, Icela, who sells cleaning products, and José Manual, who sells prickly pears. 

Teresa is a very courteous woman. She is always smiling, although she is a little bit reserved in conversation. In the community, they speak of Tere with affection. She is 35 years old and has been married since she was 20 to Señor José. Together, they have formed a family with four children, who all are in school. Don José says that all his life, he has worked selling seasonal items because his parents were also vendors. When he decided to start his own family with Doña Tere, he started out on his own, but looked for new sales locations to avoid competing with his father or his siblings.

Doña Tere says that upon seeing that good earnings could be obtained through sales, she made up her mind to help her husband. They've been in business for 15 years and their income has been growing, which helps them pay their household expenses and their children's educational expenses. Depending on the time of the year, Tere sells different items. At the Day of the Dead, she sells flowers and adornments; during the harvest, she sells tools, and in other months, she sells decorative items, fruits, and vegetables.

Tere buys all the merchandise in large quantities in Mexico City so that she can get a better price. They resell it in festivals, street markets, and plazas, since they do not have an establishment. The couple walk through the streets to avoid paying fees for establishing their business in a fixed location. Their work schedule is from 4:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., and they are always aware of the openings of new plazas in order to add new sales locations. 

Doña Tere is very grateful to VisionFund because, thanks to their economic support, her business is stable and she is able to continue having the chance to offer her children a professional career.

*The photograph was taken at Tere's house. She is wearing pink pants.

loans.use: to buy Christmas decorations

loans.name: Ana Josefina

texts.es:
Uno de los negocios característicos de Suchitepéquez es la crianza de animales de todo tipo. Desde hace 3 años, Ana de 24 años, quien vive en Suchitepéquez, se dedica a la crianza de pollos, negocio que genera una satisfactoria ganancia para poder superar en la vida.

La  actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo todos los días es la crianza de pollos en la comunidad donde ella vive, ella viene realizando dicha actividad durante 3 años dicho negocio le deja muy buena ganancia para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y la de ella.

Hace una solicitud de préstamo para la compra de más animales y los insumos como el concentrado que necesita para la crianza de pollos para luego venderlas por los alrededores de la comunidad y pueblos vecinas.

Son sus metas para generar más ingresos y el sostenimiento de su familia como el desarrollo de su comunidad donde ella vive para que todos tengan las condiciones de vida adecuadas.
texts.en:
One of the typical businesses in Suchitepéquez is rearing all sorts of animals. For the last 3 years Ana, who is 24 years old and lives in Suchitepéquez, has made a living raising chickens, a business which gives her a satisfactory profit to be able to get on in life. The work she carries out with so much effort every day is raising chickens in the community where she lives. She has been doing this for 3 years and this gives her a good profit to improve her own and her family's living conditions.

She is asking for a loan to buy more animals and supplies such as concentrated feed which she needs for raising the chickens so she can then sell them around the community and neighbouring towns.

Her goals are to make more income and to provide for her family as well as the development of the community where she lives so that everyone can have decent living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animals and supplies.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Battambang province, Sokhorn is 57 years and a mother of five children. She takes care of her family's needs via rice cropping on three hectares area. Moreover, she can earn additional income to support her family via working for others for a fee. She has been involved her business for 15 years and earns about 41,700 KHR per day. 

For Sokhorn, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She leads a group of two to get new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan to pay  harvesting fees. She hopes she can get more yield from her rice farm.

loans.use: To pay harvesting fees.

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en:
Procesa finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 66 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with helping her with her capital in support of her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. 

In the future, Procesa wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers to sustain the good growth of crops.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a mother of two children aged 24 and 14 years old. She is 51 years old, a married woman and a resident of Ormoc City, Leyte. She is engaged in a hog raising  business. She raises and sells hogs. In addition to that, she engages in snack food vending. She sells snack food to the local in her community, to augment her income.

Julia is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP  buy additional piglets and supplies for food vending. 

These are essential tools that will help Julia raise and sell more hogs. This is also the time when she maximize all possible business ventures that will help improve her earnings. 

Julia is hoping that she could handle her hog raising business successfully in order to finance the education of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and supplies for food vending.

loans.name: Sokim

texts.en:
Sokim, who is a 58-year-old woman, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two unmarried children and three married children. 

To make a living and support her family, she has been involved in a rice farming business on a small piece of farmland since 1980. Besides the farming business, she has one more way to make additional income: it is harvesting palm juice to sell. 

Now, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy palm juice-harvesting materials, such as ladders and bamboo containers. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it will help to increase her family income. 

Sokim is thankful to all lenders for their financial support of poor people. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy palm juice-harvesting materials, such as ladders and bamboo containers.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is from the city of Dipolog. She is 51 years old and is married. Nelly owns and operates a fancy jewelry business, operating a specialized retail store selling fancy jewelry in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Nelly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Nelly is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and be used as working capital. This loan will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and be used as working capital.

loans.name: Dicky

texts.en:
Dicky is a Ugandan, a married and hard-working man of 55 years, with eight children. He lives in Kagadi where he has been selling produce and he is a head teacher of a primary school, getting a government salary. He hopes to grow his business despite challenges of lack of sufficient capital and price fluctuations of produce, leading to low profit returns. 

Dicky is requesting a loan to buy maize and cassava to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida has mastered her hog raising business in Dipolog. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to get credit to fully support her business. 

Just as she takes care her hog raising business, so with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always go there for any financing needs. Now, the loan of Php 5,000 will help her build concrete pig pens that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pens.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earning as well for her family. 

As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Nilda wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Keyvin

texts.en:
Keyvin is 21 years old, from Rizal, Nueva Ecija. His family’s source of income is through farming. Having farming as their source of income is hard for them because they only get their earnings after harvest. 

Keyvin knows that his parents are working hard, but still they struggle to make ends meet. That’s why he wants to seek financial assistance of PHP 15,000 from the Kiva lenders to help sustain his schooling.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Kenia Lizzeth

texts.es:
La Señora Kenia  de 24  años de edad,  tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, no tiene esposo, vive en su  casa que alquila, en una comunidad  de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras y se dedica desde hace 01 año  al negocio de venta de tortillas sus clientes son los vecinos y personas que llegan a comprar este producto.
Doña Kenia está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal,  con el apoyo de este préstamo desea salir adelante con su negocio es su primer préstamo que solicita y espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda para su negocio y su familia.
 Su sueño es tener su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Kenia, 24, has two dependent children and no husband.  She lives in a rental house in a community in San Lorenzo, Valle, in the south of Honduras.  She has worked for a year selling tortillas.  Her customers are neighbors and people who go to her to buy the product.

Kenia's requesting the loan to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder.  With the support of this loan she wants to get ahead with her business.  It's her first loan, and she hopes this investment will be a big help to her business and her family.

Her dream is to have her own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, November 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer for corn and vegetable farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
Umeda comes from North Tajikistan. She lives in a country where people are usually busy with farming business. Umeda is married and has 5 children. Her husband always helps her with managing her business. Umeda is very hardworking woman and she works every day hard to earn a living. 

She feeds cows. Then Umeda sells the cows in a local market. She has regular customers, thanks the good condition of her cows. Umeda little by little is developing her business. She is going to buy two cows and in this way to increase working capital. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy two cows. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy two cows.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of working to support her family. 

Recently, Helen requested a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income. 

Aside from her project of building additional pig pens, she has thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale and plans to take in swine production for her business expansion. Someday, Helen hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income.

loans.name: Naida

texts.en:
Naida is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Naida is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Naida has a general store business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 2 years. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Chantou's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Battambang province, Chantou is 34 years old and a mother of two children. To support her family, she grows rice as a single main source of income. This is the second loan cycle for Chantou with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully.

She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizers and rice seed. She hopes that she can improve her business to be better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed.

loans.name: Plakiseda

texts.en:
Plakiseda is a 46-year-old married Ugandan woman living in Kagadi with 3 children. She operates a retail shop for development. 

She hopes to grow her business and make more profits despite the challenges of delayed payments by debtors and the general price fluctuations. 

She intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar, salt and other items for selling.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar, salt and other items for selling.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a 38-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Cheryl has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jessica is 44 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jessica has a general store business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jessica has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Rom is 28 years old and a mother of two children. To support her family condition, she grows rice on a four-hectare area as a single source of income. She can earn income of about 40,200 KHR per day. 

For Rom, this is her seven cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She leads a group of three members to get new loan. As a leader, she will use her entire loan to rent the harvest machine to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To rent the harvest machine to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Nurbek

texts.en:
Nurbek is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Sociology. Here is his story:

“I have a family of five people: my father, my mother, me, my younger sister and younger brother. My father is a driver. Sometimes he repairs cars and has additional salary. My mother is a housewife because of my younger siblings. They both have problems with their health, and mother has to stay with them at home the whole day in order to give them medicine, to help them to reach the room, and to feed them.

We showed them to the doctors and tried to treat them for their illnesses, but without a change, as they need to be cured just in Moscow or in Israel. We are not able to buy all their medications in Kyrgyzstan, and treating them medically abroad is out of the question for my family, which is terrible torture for us. I do my best to help my family at home; I help my mother with the household and support my father in washing and repairing cars.

Therefore, I firmly decided to rely only on myself, to prove to myself that I can learn English and become a student of a good university. A good university means a good and high-quality education, which helps to fight poverty and inequality and to spur lasting progress. AUCA is the most prestigious university in Central Asia. Although the tuition at AUCA is very expensive for my family, I made up my mind to study here.

This year I finished AUCA New Generation Academy, as I have been lucky to win an AUCA scholarship. Each year, the NGA awards full scholarships to a total of 70 applicants drawn from all seven regions of the Kyrgyz Republic to study at the NGA, which offers a one-year course of study that aims to prepare its graduates for university education. After my studies at NGA, now I can’t imagine myself without AUCA. I am very lucky, happy and proud to be a student of it.

I am asking for a loan to pay for my university tuition. I await your mercy and thank you for your time and attention to my story.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Ronila

texts.en:
Ronila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for her business.

loans.name: Rath's Group

texts.en:
Rath, 27, is a farmer who is living in Kampong Cham province and she is a mother of two children. She struggles for her living via cassava-growing as her main source of income. She has been involved her business for nine years and earns about KHR 29,200 per day. 

For Rath, this is her sixth cycle with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. 

In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labor fees. She hopes that she can further expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 2 years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mukonyezi Group

texts.en:
Mary, a married woman of 48 years, sells second-hand clothes alongside farming in Kagadi Uganda for better standards of living. She desires to grow her business and educate her children with her income, despite the challenge of a lot of competition that affects her income.

Mary is requesting credit to buy clothes for selling. She is a member of Mukonyezi Group, where each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Nout's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Battambang province, Nout is 42 years old and a mother of two children. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family via rice cropping. She has been involved this business for ages and earns about 26,700 KHR per day. 

This is Nout's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan wisely to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. 

In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan to pay the harvesting fee. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay the harvesting fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Karen Yanina

texts.es:
La señora Karen de 34  años de edad es casada, tiene tres hijos  que dependen de ella, dos de ellos van a la escuela, vive en una comunidad San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, no  tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 09 Años  a la venta de ropa, cosméticos, carteras y calzado para toda las edades.
Doña Karen su venta es en su casa y de forma ambulante, sale todas las tardes a visitar los clientes y ofrecerles los productos que vende.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de ropa blusas, faldas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, sandalias, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y surtir mas su negocio es su cuarto  crédito que solicita  su sueño es ampliar el negocio y construir su casa algún día.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre de 2014.
texts.en:
Karen, 34, is married and has three children who depend on her. Two of them are going to school. She lives in a community called San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. She does not own her own home. For nine years, she has been selling clothing, cosmetics, wallets and footwear for all ages.

Karen makes sales at home and as a traveling saleswoman. She goes out every afternoon to visit clients and offer her products for sale. She is applying for a loan to buy shirts, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, sandals, etc. With the support of this loan, she hopes to improve her earnings and stock her business. This is her fourth loan. Her dream is to expand her business and build her house someday.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, sandals, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина активная бизнеследи с города Худжанд. Ей 37 лет. Она живет без мужа с двумя сыновьями и одна обеспечивает их. Ее старшему сыну уже 18 лет и он после окончания школы пошел работать в автомастерской. Младшему сыну 12 лет, он еще учится в школе. Сыновья для Мадины являются смыслом жизни и она работает усердно, чтобы они не испытывали нужду. Два года назад Мадина по совету сестры открыла свой торговый бизнес. Она продает разные вещи: детскую одежду, постельное белье, женские тапочки и т.д. В данный момент Мадине необходимо увеличить ассортимент товара, чтобы увеличить объем продаж. На заемные средства она собирается приобрести ассортимент детской одежды, постельного белья и других вещей для развития торговли. Ваша поддержка сейчас ей очень важна.
texts.en:
Madina is an active businesswoman from the city of Khujand. She is 37 years old. She lives without a husband with two sons and supports them on her own. Her elder son is already 18 years old and, after graduating from school, he went to work at an auto mechanic's shop. The younger son is 12 and still goes to school. Her sons for Madina are the meaning of life and she works hard so they will not have needs. Two years ago, Madina on the advice of her sister opened her own trade business. She sells various things: children's clothing, bed linen, women's sneakers, etc.

Currently, Madina needs to increase her assortment of goods in order to increase sales. With the money borrowed, she intends to acquire an assortment of children's clothing, bed linens, and other things for developing trade. This support is very important for her.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of children's clothing, bed linens, and the like.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
In the year 2012, Anastacia learned about Paglaum MPC in Pagadian City and the financial assistance it gives. 

She is married and has 6 children. She and her husband have been engaged in farming activities for 25 years in order to make a living to sustain their family. 

As a farmer, Generosa experienced hardship.  She found herself plowing the farm land and planting any agricultural commodities like root crops. Through farming, she earned an amount of about Php 5,000 a month which was just enough for their needs. 

Then, she tried her luck and took out a loan to jump start her corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Anastacia feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as working capital. 

Recently, she got a loan to purchase additional fertilizer for her corn production. Anastacia wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for her corn production.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette makes a living through her retailing business. She sells jewelry accessories in Pagadian City and earns a promising income to support her family. She has opened up a membership with PMPC to gain access to capital. She wants to increase her inventory. 

Now, she took out a loan to purchase jewelry accessories for income generation. Jeanette hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry accessories for income generation.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine, 20 years old, is from Pangatian, Cabanatuan City. She has six siblings who are solely provided for by her father, who is a construction worker. Because of their low income, Catherine wants to avail herself of a PHP 15,000 education loan so she can continue her studies. She is hopeful that lenders will approve her loan for this will be of great help to her in reaching her dreams and being able to help her family.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Munisai

texts.ru:
Мунисаи молодая жительница города Куляб. Ей 22 года. Она трудолюбивая и очень вежливая девушка. Она живет с родителями. Несмотря на свой юный возраст Мунисаи уже пережила развод с мужем. Детей в браке не имеет. Мунисаи нашла в себе силы встать на ноги и продолжить жить. 
  На данный момент Мунисаи занята торговой деятельностью. Она продает детскую и женскую одежду. Ее мама тоже занимается торговлей. Отец Мунисаи временно безработный. Также у Мунисаи есть братишка-студент и 14 летняя сестренка-ученица средней школы. Мунисаи приносит в дом очень важный источник дохода, помогающий прокормить семью. Сейчас Мунисаи необходимо привести новый товар зимней одежды на продажу, но для привозки и покупки у  Мунисаи нет достаточной суммы денег, и она видит решение этой проблемы в получении кредита.
texts.en:
Munisai is a young resident of the town of Kulyab. She is 22 years old. She is a hardworking and very polite young woman. She lives with her parents. Despite her young age, Munisai has already gone through a divorce. There are no children from the marriage. Munisai found the strength in herself to stand up and continue living.

Currently, Munisai is engaged in trade activities. She sells children's and women's clothing. Her mother also is involved in trade. Munisai's father is temporarily unemployed. Munisai also has a little brother who's a student and a 14-year-old sister who is a high school student. Munisai brings home a very important source of income, helping to feed the family. Now, Munisai needs to buy new winter clothing goods for sale, but she does not have enough money for the transport and purchase. She seeds a loan as the solution to this problem.

loans.use: to purchase and transport children's and women's clothing for sale.

loans.name: Sadokat

texts.ru:
Садокат в возрасте 20 лет уже замужем и живет в доме мужа, вместе со свёкорю и свекровью. Они живут в селе района Дангара. Муж Садокат является торговцем, а сама Садокат занимается выращиванием скотов на продажу. У этой молодой пары пока нету детей, но они мечтают иметь несколько детей. 
Животноводческой деятельности Садокат научилась от мужа и уже три года как она ведет этот бизнес. Она в основном выращивает молодых бычков и телят и после определенного периода муж продает их на скотном рынке по выгодной цене. Эта деятельность Садокат приносит не только доход, но и радость. 
Целью запрашиваемого кредита является закуп молодых телят для увеличения поголовья скотин. Садокат надеется на финансирование с вашей стороны и заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
20-year-old Sadokat is already married and lives in her husband's home, together with her in-laws. They live in a village in the Dangara region. Sadokat's husband works in trade, and Sadokat herself raises livestock for sale. This young pair does not yet have children, but they dream of having several.

Sadokat learned livestock raising from her husband for three years while he ran the business. She mainly raises young bulls and calves and after the appropriate period her husband sells them at the cattle market at a premium. This activity brings Sadokat not only income, but also joy.

The purpose of the loan request is to buy young calves for expanding the cattle count. Sadokat hopes for financing and gives her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to purchase young calves.

loans.name: Ericka Arely

texts.es:
La señora  Ericka de  22  años de edad es soltera,  tiene dos  hijo  que depende de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 02  años  a la venta de tortillas.
Doña Ericka sus clientes le prefieren por su buena atención y porque vende tortillas de  lunes a domingo, es una mujer trabajadora que ha salido adelante a través de este pequeño negocio tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Ericka está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de maíz, leña y cal con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y salir adelante es su primer crédito que solicita a Prisma.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Ericka is 22 years old. She is a single mother with a young son who depends on her. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She has her own house and has worked for two years selling tortillas. Her customers like her because of her quality attention and because she sells tortillas from Monday to Sunday. She is a hardworking woman that has gotten ahead thanks to this small business. 

Ericka is requesting this loan to buy corn, firewood and lime. The loan will help her improve her business. This is her first loan through Prisma. Her dream is to improve her house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -- November 2014.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime for her business.

loans.name: La Montaña Group

texts.es:
El grupo “La Montaña” está ubicado en una comunidad mazahua donde las personas aún conservan su lengua materna; los integrantes se sienten muy orgullosos por permanecer en un lugar con gran riqueza cultural, personas amables y tantas celebraciones que dan más color y convivencia a sus días. En esta comunidad además, una de las actividades principales es la elaboración del llamado “pan de monte” o “pan de piojo”.
Don Hipólito, uno de los integrantes del grupo ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida cerca de los hornos. Recuerda que desde pequeño, su abuelo y su papá le enseñaron la elaboración del pan y su abuelo era muy conocido en la región no solo por el gran sabor de las piezas que horneaba sino por la amabilidad con la que atendía a sus clientes. 
A los 15 años Hipólito inició su propio negocio haciendo pan aunque le era difícil transportarlo por la falta de un vehículo, utilizaba su pequeño burro para llevar de un lado a otro las cajas de madera llenas de pan. Todas las mañanas salía de casa a las 5 am para poder recorrer tres o cuatro comunidades y regresaba hasta las 7 pm. 
Ahora Don Hipólito es padre de familia, se casó con Juana y tiene siete hijos, de los cuales dos niñas aún dependen de la pareja. Él continúa con el mismo negocio y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa. Con las ganancias de la venta de pan logró mejorar el lugar donde hornea el pan y así, desde las 4 am todos los días la pareja comienza a trabajar con la masa para vender por las tardes en el centro de la comunidad. “Amo mi trabajo porque de él vivo, de él crecieron mis hijos” comentó orgulloso.  Además, Hipólito se muestra agradecido con VisionFund y Kiva porque gracias a los préstamos anteriores puede invertir un poco más y comprar ingredientes en mayor cantidad. Las ganancias más recientes le permitieron comprar dos camionetas donde ahora transporta el pan. Su nueva meta es vender pan a otras tiendas  para que más personas prueben el sabor del pan que hornea. 
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Cristina, nuera de Don Hipólito, quien también se dedica a vender pan y Don Seberiano, gran amigo de Hipólito desde hace varios años, quien invertirá en mercancía para su tienda de abarrotes. 
*La foto fue tomada en el parque del municipio, un lugar concurrido por estudiantes y amigos que aprovechan el espacio para convivir y platicar. Don Hipólito se ubica en medio de los integrantes.
texts.en:
The “La Montaña” group is located in a Mazahua community where the people keep their native language.  The members are very proud of being in a place of such cultural richness, friendly people, and many celebrations that provide more color and coexistence to their days.  Making what is referred to as “Mountain Bread” or “Lice Bread” is one of the main activities in this community.

Hipólito, one of the group’s members, has spent most of his life around the ovens.  He recalls that his father and grandfather taught him about bread baking. His grandfather was very well known in the area, not only because of the great flavor of the bread he baked, but also for the friendliness with which he served his customers. 

At age 15, Hipólito started his own business baking bread, although it was difficult to transport it for lack of a vehicle.  He used a small donkey to take the wooden boxes of bread from one place to another.  He would go out every morning at 5:00 am so he could cover three or four communities and he would return home at 7:00 pm.

Now Hipólito is a father.  He is married to Juana and has seven children and two daughters are still dependent on this couple for support.  He continues in the same business with his wife’s help.  He was able to improve his baking area with his earnings and he and his wife begin working the dough daily at 4:00 am so they can sell it in town in the evenings.

“I love my work because I make a living with it and my children grew up with it,” he states proudly.  Hipólito also shows his gratitude to Vision Fund and Kiva because, thanks to the loans, he was able to invest a little more and buy ingredients in greater quantities.  The more recent earnings allowed him to buy two vehicles, which he now uses to transport the bread.

His new goal is to sell bread to other stores so that more people can taste the flavor.

The other group members are Cristina, Hipólito’s daughter in law, who sells bread, and Seberiano, one of Hipólito’s good friends for several years.  He will buy groceries for his store.

*The picture was taken in the municipal park, a place frequented by students and friends who take advantage of the space to socialize.  Hipólito is in the center of the image.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

location.town: Guadalupe Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a businesswoman from Buenavista, Pagadian City. She is 56 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Teresita is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default.

Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Teresita continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos, tiene 21 años de edad, esta soltero, vive con sus padres en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Carlos lleva 4 años de dedicarse a su propio negocio de venta de ropa como ser camisas, camisetas, blusas, faldas, pantalones y gorras. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante y vende en su casa también.  Esta solicitando un segundo ciclo a la institución por 10,000 lempiras para comprar más ropa como camisetas, pantalones, blusas y aprovechar en la temporada navideña a incrementar sus ventas e ingresos para ayudar a la familia. Su plan es crecer como microempresario.
texts.en: Carlos is 21 years old, single and lives with his parents in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Carlos has had his own business for 4 years selling clothing like shirts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, pants and hats. He does this itinerantly and also sells from his house. He is requesting his second loan from the institution of 10.000 HNL to buy more clothing like t-shirts, pants and blouses. He wants to take advantage of the Christmas season to increase his sales and income to help his family. His plan is to grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy more clothing like t-shirts, pants and blouses to take advantage of the Christmas season to increase sales and income and help his family.

loans.name: Kimhon's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province, Kimhon is 40 years old and a mother of four children. She grows rice as a single main source of income to support her family. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to pay the harvesting fee. She hopes that she can improve her rice farm to be better than before.

loans.use: To pay the harvesting fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 31 years old, married and has six children, four of whom are in school. She farms rice in the Philippines. Gloria requested a 5500 PHP loan through NWTF to pay for laborers to prepare her land for farming. Gloria has been farming rice for 15 years and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay the salary of laborers to prepare her land for rice farming.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Riza requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more clothing stock to sell to her customers. She would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing stock to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enhance his cold drink wholesale shop business

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
Lynette is 37 years old, married and has four children, who are in school.

Lynette is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lynette has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lynette would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dúo Trabajadores De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
Dúo trabajadores de San Mateo
Este dúo está formado por don Juan Isabel, él tiene 57 años de edad y desde ya hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura en general como siembra de tomate, arveja, suchini, ejote y todos sus productos son entregados en la cooperativa cuatro pinos, él está solicitando el crédito para la compra de abono para su siembra de ejote y arveja su deseo es tener una buena cosecha para entregar un buen producto para que no se lo rechacen, ya que todos sus productos son generalmente exportados por la cooperativa.es el primer credito que solicita pero promete estar puntual con sus págos ya que es la manera de responder por tan gran ayuda y por la confianza que le dan atravez del credito.
texts.en:
San Mateo Workers Duo

Juan Isabel, 57, is a member of this duo. For seven years, he has been working in agriculture, such as growing tomatoes, peas, zucchini, and green beans. All of his products are delivered to the Cuatro Pinos cooperative. He is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer to grow green beans and peas. His wish is to have a good harvest to deliver a good product so that it does not get rejected. All of his products are usually exported by the cooperative. This is the first loan for which he is applying, but he promises to be on time with his payments as a way to respond to the great help and the trust which is being given to him through this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana was born in 1963. She is an honest and hardworking woman. Tatyana is married and has no children. For the past three years, she has been  selling women's and children's clothing. Tatyana has a store in a local market, and she tries to renew the assortment of her goods every season. She manages her business alone as her husband is a lawyer and does not have time to help. Tatyana is going to buy a new assortment of clothes for the new season, and she wants to be able to offer her customers a choice of fashionable clothes. She is asking for a loan of 3000 TJS to buy the clothing stock. She awaits your help.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Yungaqui Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE YUNGAQUI II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicitas ella es casada y tiene 44 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.

Los que está pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieronj permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de verduras.
texts.en:
These are the members of the “INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE YUNGAQUI II” communal bank, located in Cusco.

Felicitas is 44 years old and married.  She has two children and sells grains such as corn, wheat, and quinoa from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm daily and has been doing this for four years.  Things are going well for her.  Her dream is to have a shop from where she can sell her grains.  She is asking for a loan to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

The members who’s pictures are pasted on were absent due to work commitments and were photographed later.  The other members sell grains, animals, groceries, and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Aseel

texts.en:
Aseel, who appears in the photo, is a 19-year-old single young man from the city of Nablus. He lives with his parents in a small house. His mother works as an employee in a local firm in the city. She earns a low income that is not enough to cover all of the family`s needs.

Aseel is a student, studying Information Technology. He wants to earn a B.A. degree and find a job in the future to help out his family with their expenses. Aseel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Aseel will be able to do his homework and write reports.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 32 years old and married with five children between one and thirteen years of age. She and her family reside in Carles, Iloilo. Ma. Teresa and her husband have been relying on fishing for an income. This is their business for eleven years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy crude oil and fishing nets to support their daily fishing. With this equipment, Ma. Teresa can enhance their catch and expect better earnings.

Her profit will be used for school fees and reinvestment in the same business. In the future, she dreams of having another fishing boat as part of her planned expansion.

loans.use: to buy crude oil and fishing nets

loans.name: Elba Rubidia

texts.es: Elba de 29 años de edad se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace 8 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados  y ya tiene clientes establecidos, ella vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos y concentrado para seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: 29-year-old Elba has worked raising chickens for 8 years. She sells her products in different markets and has loyal customers. She lives in her own house with her family. She is requesting a loan to buy chickens and pellets to continue with her business and improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pellets.

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito is a married man with seven children. He is 62 years old and three of his children are still in school. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Julito has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. He has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Julito has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, he would like to save enough money so that he can afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cart for making and hot dogs and supplies for setting up her stand.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 33 years old and has three children. She is married, and her three children are in school.

Christine is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Christine has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Christine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dúo Guadalupe De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Guadalupe de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señora Berta Blanca quien se dedica a la venta de  ropa de paca desde hace 6 años y es vendedora ambulante.  Le gusta mucho vender y al lado de su esposo quien la apoya en su negocio sigue soñando en una venta grande de ropa variada y tener su propio local.  Sus hijos ya están grandes y todos tienen familia pero está muy contenta por los nietos que Dios le ha regalado.  Le han pedido variedad de blusas para dama, vestiditos para niños, playeras para jóvenes, camisas formales y algunas chumpas, ya no tiene en la venta mucha variedad, por tal motivo necesita hacer un préstamo para poder comprar la ropa que le hace falta y no quedarles mal a las personas que siempre la visitan buscando una prenda.
texts.en:
The leader of Dúo Guadalupe de San Pedro is Mrs. Berta Blanca, who has been selling bulk at street markets for 6 years. She loves to sell, and along with her husband, who supports her in her business, she dreams of having her own store and selling lots of clothing in a variety of styles. Her children are grown and have families, and she is very happy with the grandchildren that God has given her.
Her customers have asked her for variety of blouses for women, dresses for girls, t-shirts for young people, dress shirts, and some jackets, but she doesn’t have much variety for sale. So she needs a loan to buy the types of clothes that she lacks so that she doesn’t let down the people who always visit looking for a specific piece of clothing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell (new clothing).

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ana María es una mujer muy trabajadora. Desde hace 12 años tiene una carpintería y tapicería el cual trabaja junto con su esposo e hijos donde realizan preciosos trabajos de muebles y los venden a comerciantes mayoristas quienes lo comercializan en los mercados capitalinos. Gracias a este negocio y el apoyo de préstamos Ana Maria ha podido construir su vivienda la cual casi está terminada quedando aun pendiente hacer las divisiones de los cuartos y poner el piso que actualmente es de tierra. Para esta obra Ana María solicita este crédito para comprar los siguientes materiales: cemento, arena, piedrín, cerámica, bloques, hierro, entre otros. Ella espera que con esta mejora pueda concluir la obra que lleva ya mucho tiempo haciéndola, siendo su principal objetivo brindar a sus hijos un hogar seguro y bonito.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is a hardworking woman. She has had an upholstery and hardware store for 12 years. She works in the store with her husband and children. They make beautiful furniture and sell it to wholesale retailers who distribute it in the capital city. Thanks to this business and the support from Kiva loans, Ana Maria has been able to build a new home, which is almost finished. All that remains is the construction of room divisions and the installation of the floor. 

Ana Maria is requesting a loan for this construction work, which she will use to buy the following materials: cement, sand, gravel, ceramic, blocks, iron, among others. She hopes that these improvements will allow her to conclude the work that she started a long time ago. Her main goal is to provide a safe and pleasant home to her children.

loans.use: to pay for building room divisions and a new floor at her home.

loans.name: Bibigul

texts.en:
Bibigul was born in 1958 year. She is a kind woman, and a careful mother for her three children. Bibigul lives with her family in the South Tajikistan. 

Bibigul always wanted to start a new business. Now she is going to realize her dream. Bibigul took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ with a women's organization, and got a certificate. Bibigul is going to organize a business with farming. She has land where she will sow vegetables such as carrots, onions and cabbages. Bibigul will sell the harvest she gets in a local market. 

She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for organizing a new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for organizing a new business

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 07 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Tươi is 35 years old, and she is married with two children.

Tươi works in agriculture raising pigs. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In 2013, Tươi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Tươi is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Thôn 07 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

She is applying for a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. 

In the future, Tươi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en:
Jayson is 19 years old from Rizal, Nueva Ecija.  

His family earns an income from farming.  Not having a constant income is hard for them especially since Jayson is pursuing a certificate in Mechatronics. Because of that, Jayson wants to apply for an education loan of 15,000 PHP. He will use this to pay his tuition fees and other school-related expenses. 

He wants to finish his studies, help his family out of poverty, and say and prove that he can stand on his own.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 54 years old and married with one child in school; she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines., and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, noodles, spices, etc.

Mary Jean has been in this business for 11 years, and earn additional income from farming rice.

In the future Mary Jean would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.en:
Ciriaca works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ciriaca requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

She has been in this business for 35 years now.

Ciriaca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is 52 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Ignacia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ignacia has been in this business for five years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Margaret, 56 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kwanza, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and is blessed with eight adorable children. 

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 15 years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Kitale area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable.  She stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES to buy poultry. 

Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging.  Through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Tito Santiago

texts.es:
Tito, comercializa lazos y hamacas, vive con su compañera de vida y su hija, tiene dos hijos más que no dependen  de él; su actividad económica la realiza desde hace más de 21 años, tiene un horario de 6:00 a.m. a 5:30 p.m., cuenta con empleados para que le ayuden a atender su negocio, su local está ubicado en una zona muy importante para el comercio, por el momento no representa dificultades en la administración de su negocio.
Invertirá en hamacas y lazos, para tener mejor mercadería en su negocio, espera ahorrar en la compra al por mayor y generar más ganancias. 
Su visión es tener un negocio más amplio, generar más empleo y darle a su familia mejor alimentación y vestuario.
texts.en:
Tito sells hammocks and ties for hammocks.

He lives with his life partner and a daughter, and he has two other children who do not depend on him.

He has had his business for over 21 years. His work hours are from 6:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m, and he counts with hired help for his store, which is located in a major commercial zone. At this time there are no difficulties in managing the business.

He will invest in hammocks and ties for hammocks in order to offer better merchandise. He hopes to save by buying at wholesale prices, and to generate more income.

Tito's vision is to expand the business, hire more help, and to improve the food and clothing for his family.

loans.use: to invest in hammocks and ties for hammocks, in order to have better merchandise in his store.

loans.name: Srim's Group

texts.en:
Srim, 31, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of five children, three of whom are in school and other two are too young. To support her living, she grows rice and sells coconuts to earn more income. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. 

She leads a group of two to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm. 

She hopes that she can get more yield, and she wants to buy pigs to raise.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 24-year-old single Palestinian man who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, Wael started four years ago distributing tobacco and foodstuff to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Wael is a hard worker and ambitious man, who is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with the more requested products of tobacco and foodstuff to satisfy his customers' needs.

Wael hopes to develop his business in the future and open his own wholesale shop, which will increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with more requested products

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is from Carles, Iloilo. She is 32 years old, and married with five children. Her eldest is 15 and her youngest is 5. For 15 years, she has been dependent in the fishing business of her husband. At the same time, Cristina also is involved in a sari-sari (variety) store business. 

Cristina noticed how the fishermen in her place need fuel, and this gave her a better income. She is asking a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy rice, crude oil, gasoline and kerosene.

Her income will be used for the school fees of her children, and for reinvestment in the fishing business.   
 
In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.    .

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, chips, noodles, crude oil, gasoline and kerosene

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El señor Marcos de 52 años de edad es soltero  tiene tres hijos  que depende de él, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05 años  a la venta de cuajada y queso.
Don Marcos  cuaja la leche para hacer la cuajada y también elabora el queso los cuales sale a vender, también vende granos básicos, sus clientes le prefieren por su buena atención y porque vende buen producto.
Don Marcos  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de leche, maíz, etc. espera con el apoyo del préstamo mejorar su negocio y salir adelante en el al igual desea seguir apoyando a sus hijos,  es su primer crédito que solicita a Prisma.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa y su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Marcos is 52 years old, single and supports his three children. He lives in the San Lorenzo community in the south of Honduras. He owns his own house and for five years now has been making a living selling curd and cheese. Marcos process milk to make curd and he also produces cheese to sell.  He also sells basic grains.  His clients like him because of the good customer service and because he sells good products.

Marcos asks for a loan to buy milk, corn, etc.  With the help of the loan he hopes to improve his business to get ahead. He also wants to continue to support his children. This is the first loan he requests from Prisma.

His dream is to improve his house and his business.
San Lorenzo, Honduras, November 2014.

loans.use: to buy milk, corn, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en:
Sasun is 30 years old and he lives in Ijevan city of Tavush region. Sason greatly thanks for his first Kiva loan, which he ended successfully; he used it for the purchase of seasonal clothes for reselling in which his mother was engaged for some period of time. 

Now Sasun is back from the Russian Federation, and here he works as a driver and he does his best to sustain his big family’s numerous needs. He lives with his parents and with his brother’s family. 

This time Sasun has another request, and this time he will use the loan amount personally for him for his health. 

This loan is in an amount of 600,000 Armenian drams for solving his dental problems; he must undergo a long course of treatment and he must do also fillings on several teeth. As he says he will be happy to solve such a great and very expensive problem for him so easily with the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to solve his dental problems; he must undergo a long course of treatment and he must do also fillings of several teeth

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 54 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock.

Luisa has been raising livestock for four years and also earns additional income from basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Las Ñustas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS ÑUSTAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosario ella es soltera y tiene 40 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de artesanía.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "LAS ÑUSTAS" community bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and the department of Cusco.

The member is Rosario. She is single, 40 years old, and has 3 children. She works in her restaurant business and makes various dishes such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and meat stir-fries. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

She has had this business for 10 years, and it is going very well for her. The member's dream is to expand her restaurant business.

The other members make their living in the clothing sales business, shoe sales business, grocery store business, and handicraft sales business.

All the members are grateful to all who are part of this dream through this loan, and are committed to making their payments on time. One group member couldn't be in the picture, and so her own photo was added on the right-hand side of the group's photo.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is mother of four children and a resident in Ormoc City, Leyte. Her oldest child is 18, and the youngest is 2. She is a 39-year-old married woman, and engages in operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells a variety of items ranging from soy sauce, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, noodles to canned goods.  She has been operating a variety store for two years now.  For additional income, she raises and sells hogs.

Lea is asking a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional stock like canned goods, noodles, beverages, soft drinks and to purchase an additional piglet. This is very helpful in operating her store again, and it could cause more consumers to shop and purchase. It will also improve her hog raising business to be more productive, thus increasing her earnings.

In the future, Lea hopes that this is the beginning of her road to recovery for livelihood improvement, and continue to support the education of her children as well.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, noodles, beverages, soft drinks and purchase an additional piglet

loans.name: Las Rebeldes Group

texts.es:
En un municipio del estado de Oaxaca se ubica el grupo Las Rebeldes; las integrantes decidieron nombrar así al grupo haciendo referencia a su personalidad. "Somos rebeldes con causa, nuestra causa sacar adelante el negocio y a nuestra familia" comentó una de las clientes de VisionFund.

Las rebeldes son:
Petra - Venta De Carne De Cerdo
Maria Irene - Venta De Calzado Y Ropa
Guadalupe - Venta De Tamales Y Tortillas De Mano
Filomena - Venta De Antojitos
Roberta - Venta De Abarrotes
Gelasia - Venta De Abarrotes 
Laura - Venta De Refrescos
Maria - Venta De Postres
Veronica -Venta De Antojitos Desde Hace 10 Años  Tiene 31 Años De Edad 
Maria Isabel - Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo
Alicia - Venta De Lenceria
Maricela - Venta De Verduras

Verónica es mejor conocida como Vero, es soltera y tiene 31 años de edad. Ella se dedica a vender antojitos en su casa iniciando a las 6:30 pm y terminando hasta que el ultimo cliente se vaya o los antojitos se terminen.

La motivación principal para continuar con su actividad es su madre, la señora Laura, quien inicio el negocio hace más de 30 años vendiendo tacos dorados en el centro del municipio y posteriormente una mayor variedad de antojitos mexicanos. Desde pequeña, Vero y sus tres hermanos apoyaban a su madre atendiendo a los clientes “recuerdo cuando mi madre vendía en el centro y mi hermana mayor era quien nos cuidaba” admiración y respeto es el que tiene Vero por los dos grandes ejemplos que tiene en su vida. 

Desde hace 10 años Vero se ha dedicado a vender tacos dorados utilizando la receta de su madre, el puesto lo coloca debajo de un techo que han establecido, pone una gran mesa donde prepara la carne y enrolla los tacos para después freírlos en una cacerola grande. Vero utiliza las ganancias obtenidas para apoyar con los gastos en casa, reinvertir en la compra de ingredientes y material para el negocio y hacer cada uno de los pagos correspondientes a los préstamos anteriores.
