Esta vez, Vero necesita surtirse de más ingredientes como chile, cebolla, aguacate, crema, frijol, aceite, tortillas, queso, servilletas, palillos, gas pues con el inicio de la época de corte de caña en su comunidad, las ventas incrementan y quiere prepararse para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes quienes acuden a comprar por el buen sazón que tiene.

Todos los días Vero agradece a Dios por la gran familia que le ha brindado ya que actualmente también uno de sus hermanos la apoya en su actividad. También comenta que se siente muy afortunada por estar con sus padres y cuidar de ellos como en un principio lo hicieron con ella. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el lugar donde el grupo lleva a cabo sus reuniones. Vero viste playera blanca, mayones negros y tiene una bolsa color café.
texts.en:
The "Las Rebeldes" ["The Rebels"] group is located in a municipality of the state of Oaxaca. The members decided to name their group "Las Rebeldes," making reference to their personalities. "We are rebels with a cause. Our cause is to take care of our businesses and our families," says one of the VisionFund clients.

"Las Rebeldes" are as follows:

Petra - Pork Sales
María Irene - Clothing and Shoe Sales
Guadalupe - Tamale and Handmade Tortilla Sales
Filomena - Food Sales
Roberta - Grocery Sales
Gelasia - Grocery Sales
Laura - Drink Sales
María - Dessert Sales
Verónica - Selling popular food items for 10 years. She is 31 years old.
María Isabel - Catalog Shoe Sales
Alicia - Lingerie Sales
Maricela - Vegetable Sales

Verónica is better known as Vero. She is single and 31 years old. She works selling popular food items in her house, starting at 6:30 p.m. and finishing when the last customer leaves and the food is gone.

Her main motivation for continuing in her business is her mother, Señora Laura, who started the business more than 30 years ago, selling fried tacos in the center of town; later, she sold a larger variety of popular Mexican foods. Since she was little, Vero and her three siblings helped their mother by tending to customers. "I remember when my mother was selling downtown and my older sister was the one who took care of us." Admiration and respect are what Vero has for the two role models that she has in her life.

Since she was 10 years old, Vero has worked selling fried tacos, using her mother's recipe. She sets up her stand under a roof that they have established, puts out a large table where she prepares the meat and rolls the tacos, and then fries them later in a large pan. Vero uses the earnings she obtains to contribute to the household expenses, to reinvest in the purchase of ingredients and supplies for her business, and to make every one of her payments for her previous loans. This time, Vero needs to stock up on more ingredients like chiles, onions, avocado, cream, beans, oil, tortillas, cheese, napkins, toothpicks, and gas, as sales increase with the start of the cane cutting season in her community. She wants to get ready to satisfy the needs of her customers, who come to her to buy because of the good flavors that she has. 

Every day, Vero thanks God for the great family that he has given her, as one of her brothers is currently helping her out with her business. She also says that she feels very lucky to have her parents and to take care of them, as they did for her early on.

*The photograph was taken in the place where the group holds its meetings. Vero is wearing a white t-shirt, black leggings, and has a coffee-colored bag.

loans.use: to buy chiles, onions, avocado, cream, beans, oil, tortillas, cheese, napkins, toothpicks, and gas

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora has mastered her hog raising business in Kalasan, Pagadian City. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail credit to fully support her business. Just as how she takes care of her hog raising business with her membership with PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run to them for any financing needs. 

Melchora has saved an amount, but it is not enough to finance her project. Now, the loan of Php 5,000 will help her fill the needed amount to build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.name: Gonzaga

texts.en:
Gonzaga is a Ugandan married man living in Kagadi, aged 42 years with four children. He owns a butcher shop, and trades in cattle for better household income. He hopes to grow his business, despite competition from other people with similar business and cattle diseases. 

Gonzaga is requesting a loan to buy cattle for selling.

loans.use: to buy cattle for selling.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca (fourth from the left), along with her partners Laura (first), Lilia (second), Andrés (third), Marin (fifth) and Luis (last) are the most active members of Truequio, a cooperative formed to produce and export organic cucumber. Marin is Luis and Blanca´s father and Andres and Laura are brother and sister. They all live in the same town in Morelos, Mexico.

Truequio is part of a larger savings cooperative, UNDECO, started by Marin in the late 90´s. Unlike many other cooperatives in Mexico, Truequio is run by young members like Andres, Blanca and Luis. In less than three years they have built a packinghouse in a very small town in Mexico that meets USDA´s organic regulations.

Truequio helps more than 12 producers sell and export their cucumber. To do so, they collect every member´s production and take it to their packinghouse for sorting and packaging using an old 78 VW Bus. Truequio is asking for a loan to buy a 3.5 TON truck to replace the old VW Bus.

Their vision for Truequio is to help local farmers access organic markets in order to improve their living standards while promoting the benefits of sustainable agricultural practices. Blanca, Laura, Lilia, Andrés, Marin and Luis are truly committed to promoting organic agriculture among local producers in order to make healthy eating more accessible.

loans.use: to buy a truck to transport organic cucumber

loans.name: Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MICAELA BASTIDAS, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Micaela tiene 59 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa como casacas, pantalones entre otros, la socia vende a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican la venta de ropa, productos de belleza, venta de ropa (lencería), tienda de abarrotes.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Martina is a member of the Communal Bank “Micaela Bastidas”, which is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Micaela is 59 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling clothes such as jackets, trousers, and other garments. She sells to all of the customers who request these items. She is a responsible and industrious individual. She would like to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy jackets. She appreciates the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

The other members engage in businesses such as selling clothes, selling beauty products, selling lingerie, and managing a grocery store. The members who appear in the attached photos requested permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work reasons.

loans.use: to buy jackets to sell.

loans.name: Noeun's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Cham province, Noeun is 28 years old and a mother of one kid. She overcomes her family’s hardship via cassava growing. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn more income. She has been involved this business for ages, and earns about 32,900 KHR per day. This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. 

In a group of two members, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor cost. 

She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor cost.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: La Cuna De Los Barriletes Group

texts.en:
The six women of this group live in the town of Santiago, Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. The name of their group comes from the fact that the Guatemalan tradition of flying giant kites on the Day of the Dead originated in Santiago. The women range in age from 21 to 40 years and their businesses include sales of vegetables, food and clothing. Many of the group members speak the Mayan language Kaqchikel as well as Spanish, and most of them wear the typical indigenous skirts and blouses. They are hard working women and many of them get up at dawn to travel to the locations where they sell their products. These women are eager to be part of this group as they want to grow their businesses and profits and improve their living conditions. In the course of their nine months with Namaste they will receive classes in business literacy, managing their money and keeping books.  They will also each have a business adviser who will help them write a business plan and also give them monthly advice on how to grow and improve their business.

Hilda (first from left) is one of the members of this group. She is 26 years old, married and has two children, ages 2 and 7. Her husband is a driver. The seven year old goes to school. Hilda herself only went to school through first grade. Her business is selling vegetables in a market about 20 miles from her home. She arrives there each morning at 5:30 AM and works a long day. She will use her loan to buy more vegetables to sell and she especially wants to have more stock for the end of the year when sales are higher.
Her monthly net profit is 2416 Guatemalan Quetzales and she hopes to increase this by 30% during her nine-month cycle with Namaste. Her long-term dream is to buy a small piece of land so her children can have a better financial future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in a local market close to her home.

loans.name: Angélica María

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de Portoviejo vive la señora Angélica, tiene 19 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene una hija de 3 años de edad. Su marido trabaja eventualmente.
Doña Angélica es una joven mujer que le gusta cada día ir mejorando su calidad de vida y el bienestar de su familia, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. Parte de este crédito ella lo va a utilizar para realizar ciertos arreglos en su casa, quiere adecuar un cuarto para su pequeña hija, ella siempre utiliza parte de los créditos para ir mejorando su hogar razón por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que así ella mejora su calidad de vida. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y materiales de construcción  para los arreglos en su hogar. Le gusta los creditos porque con ellos ella cada día mejora su casa. Sus sueños son tener terminada por completo su casa.
texts.en:
In the La California area of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí which has been known for many years as "the city of the royal tamarind trees", lives Angélica. She is 19, is in a common-law marriage and has a 3-year-old daughter from this relationship. Her husband works occasionally. 
Angélica is a young woman who likes to make efforts to improve her quality of life and the well-being of her family every day. She works as a door-to-door saleswoman, selling clothes of all kinds. She will use part of the loan to make some changes to her home; she wants to convert a room for her young daughter. She always uses part of her loans to make improvements to her home and she is very grateful because in this way she is improving her quality of life.
This loan will be used to buy clothes and building materials for her home improvements. This is her third credit, and she likes it because the loans allow her to improve her home every day. Her dream is to finish work on her house.

loans.use: to buy clothes and building materials

loans.name: Las Gemelas Group

texts.en:
San Juan la Laguna is on the shores of the beautiful Guatemalan Lake Atitlan. Lake Atitlan is surrounded by mountains and three volcanos and is considered to be one of the most gorgeous lakes in the world. It is in the Tz’utujil-speaking San Juan la Laguna that the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Gemelas” or “The Twins” is located. There are ten members, four of whom are new to the group.  

“Las Gemalas” is asking for a new loan, which will be the second loan through Kiva, in order to continue their very productive activities, expand their businesses and increase their income. The majority of the group works in creating the artisan textiles that are popular, such as shawls, scarves, purses, huipiles (typical blouses), and curtains. 
 
Isabela is the President of the group and is a good leader. She is 25 years old and has had nine years of education. A few years ago, she acquired a tuc-tuc.  Tuc-tucs are three-wheeled covered motorcycles that are used in small villages throughout Guatemala as a type of taxi transporting people from one place to another. She needs to maintain the vehicle constantly, which can be very expensive. It is for the maintenance that she is requesting a new loan, especially to buy new parts for the tuc-tuc. Isabela hopes that with the new profits from her tuc-tuc, she will be able to continue to provide a primary school education for her child. Driving a tuc-tuc allows Isabela to be very independent but it does have its problems. 
 
The empowerment of the ladies of the Trust Bank “Las Gemelas” is notable. Thanks to the non-formal education program of Friendship Bridge, the ladies have gained a great deal of knowledge about savings, overindebtedness, good health practices, child development and self-empowerment. Thank you Kiva investors, for helping these Guatemalan women empower themselves to overcome poverty!

loans.use: to buy new parts for her mototaxi.

loans.name: Buen Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario el buen progreso es integrado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, es coordinado por Blanca una mujer laboriosa de 38 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos dependen económicamente de ella, se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas, comercializándolas en el mercado de la municipalidad, decidió impulsar este negocio hace diez años primeramente con las cosechas que sembraba en sus tierras, luego con los financiamientos logró comprar frutas al por mayor y venderlas al detalle además ha podido sembrar más en sus tierras. Ha trabajado con los financiamientos de ADIM  desde hace más de dos años, este crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de tamarindo. Al equipo de trabajo de esta socia lo integran, Miriam de 55 años de edad comerciante de cosméticos AVON y Zermat a los pobladores de su comunidad, y Olga de 61 años de edad y quien se dedica al destace de cerdo en su domicilio desde hace diecisiete años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "El Buen Progreso" (Good Progress) is formed by three entrepreneurial women. 

It is coordinated by Blanca, a hard-working woman of 38. She is married and is the mother of three children. She works in the purchase and sale of crops, selling them in the market of the town. She decided to launch this business ten years ago, primarily with the crops that were growing on her land. Then, with financing, she managed to buy fruits wholesale and sell them at retail. In addition, she has been able to raise more on her land. She has worked with ADIM financing for more than two years. She is applying for this loan for the purchase of the tamarind harvest. 

The other members of this work team are Miriam, who is 55 years old and sells Avon and Zermat cosmetics to residents of the community, and Olga, who is 61 years old and has been butchering pigs at her home for 17 years.

loans.use: to purchase the tamarind harvest; this is one of the products that has the most demand in the country.

loans.name: Alveiro De Jesus

texts.es:
Alveiro es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo de papa y lechuga; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Concordia.

Este personaje tiene como propósito mejorar sus cultivos y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes y la compra de semillas de papa.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Alveiro is a modest and hardworking farmworker with the drive and tenacity characteristic of rural men and women.  He's a man with an entrepreneurial mind, and he learned all the farming tasks like crops and raising animals--so much so that currently he has his own potato and lettuce crops.  He sells this food at the market plaza of a nearby town..

Alveiro's goal is to improve his crops, so he's turning to the help of a loan to buy potato seeds and farming inputs such as fertilizer. The loan will give him the chance to make progress as a businessman and as a person, as well as to increase his income and keep on supporting his household.

The only thing Alveiro wants is to be able to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and farming inputs such as fertilizer

loans.name: Genita

texts.en:
Genita, 50, lives in Kalasan, Pagadian City. She is married and was gifted with four children. Genita and her husband are earning a living through livestock raising. They made a good profit every quarter doing this type of activity.

Since Genita wants to be more productive, she plans to take on cattle production. She joined Paglaum Cooperative to access financial assistance for the much-needed amount and took a loan to buy a cow for her cattle production.

Someday, she hopes to buy farmland for her business project.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her cattle production.

loans.name: Del Carmen Group

texts.en:
San Juan La Laguna is a quiet and peaceful town on the shores of beautiful Lake Atitlán in the highlands of Guatemala. Many tourists travel here by small boat to learn about natural dyes. Thread, yarn and cloth are colored by a variety of these dyes using avocado, charcoal, coconut shells, cochineal (an insect that grows on a cactus pad), fruit and fruit seeds, as well as tree bark.

The seven members of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Del Carmen” are happy to report that they have finished paying the previous loan cycle that was generously funded by Kiva investors, and now they are applying for their second loan cycle. The group has elected Rosa as the secretary. She has a textile business, and has a little stand near the public beach where she sells traditional textiles like colorful purses, shawls and other lovely items. Because of the tourists who come to San Juan, Rosa has been successful with her business. She realizes that this time of year draws more tourists to the town, and so in order to be ready she wants to increase her inventory, so she is applying for a new loan to buy yarns and fabrics for sewing. Along with the other members of the Trust Bank, Rosa is requesting a loan that she hopes will be funded by Kiva investors.

The members of the Trust Bank share a common goal, which is to increase their income by expanding their businesses and improving their quality of life. Besides having access to loans, they receive educational training during their monthly meetings with a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. It is the combination of the loans and educational training that comprises the Friendship Bridge “Microcredit Plus” Program. 

Thank you, Kiva investors, for taking the time to read about the ladies in this Friendship Bridge Trust Bank. They are poised to step into a brighter and more prosperous future with their small loans and acquired knowledge.

loans.use: to buy yarns and fabrics for sewing.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Katupyry está formado por  16 integrantes, están  el séptimo ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza que a través de la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza podrán conocer la situación de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teresa, ella se está esforzando por su familia y por sus seres queridos, comenta que tiene una cantina en una escuela, y es ahí donde se gana la vida de una manera honesta y digno, le gustaría poder ir mejorando cada día mas, y es en vista a ello que se está esforzando mas y mas.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar golosinas, comestibles, bebidas, gaseosas, yogur y demás. Ella esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo de poder crecer e ir mejorando.
texts.en:
The group named Kuña Katupyry is made up of 16 members. They are in their 7th round of the Women's Committee program. They form part of the program for the elimination of poverty, and through the "Poverty Stoplight" questionnaire they can understand the situation of each member.

One of the members is Teresa, she is striving for her family and her loved ones. She mentions that she has a canteen in a school, and that is where she earns a living in an honest and dignified way. She would like to be able to go about improving each day, and with this in sight, she strives more and more.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy candies, groceries, drinks, sodas, yogurt and other items. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving to grow and continue improving.

loans.use: to buy candies, groceries, drinks, sodas, yogurt and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en: Modesto is a hardworking and responsible farmer with a loving family. Modesto and his wife, Zoila, own a small plot in the Chao Valley in northern Peru. When they came to the valley in 1988, they worked very hard to cultivate crops in the very arid land. They began planting asparagus and alfalfa. After four years, they started to grow organic avocado, which they used first for their own consumption. They quickly noticed that organic avocados could fetch a good price and began to focus on their production. Modesto’s dream is to support his family and send his four-year-old daughter to school. He and his wife work for about ten or twelve hours a day, beginning at five in the morning, but they say they would do everything for their child’s welfare. Modesto is seeking a loan of $700 to buy organic fertilizers so that his organic avocado trees will increase yields.

loans.use: to pay for organic fertilizers for his small avocado plot

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Kuña Guapa, lo que quiere decir en castellano mujer trabajadora, ellas se encuentran en el sexto ciclo, con 21 integrantes todas con actividades económicas independientes. Es un grupo muy emprendedor que viene trabajando muy bien, ellas son de una zona eminentemente rural, que aun se encuentra en crecimiento, y también con ese motivo las integrantes están luchando.
Lina es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la cría de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, patos y demás, que luego faena o vende, comenta que su trabajo es muy humilde, pero que está orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es el sostén de su familia y es muy honrada su labor.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar balanceados para sus animales, ya que por medio de él podrá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Ella está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Kuña Guapa, meaning hard working woman in Spanish. They are on their 6th loan and the 21 members of the group all have their own independent economic activities. It is a very enterprising group that works well, they are from an especially rural area which is growing and it is also for this that they are fighting hard. 
Lina is part of this group. She works breeding farmyard animals such as hens, pigs, ducks and others. She then slaughters them or sells them. She sais that her work is very modest but that she is proud of what she does as it supports her family and it is a decent job. She is asking for this loan to buy feed for her animals as this will enable her to continue her work as she has been doing. 
She is very grateful for the opportunity to is receiving as it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy feed for animals.

loans.name: Dúo San Pedro San Pablo Group

texts.es:
DUO SAN PEDRO SAN PABLO.
Este dúo está conformado por María Luisa quien es originaria de San Andrés itzapa doña María Luisa es dueña de una tienda y una pequeña librería que gracias a Dios y a la ayuda de kiva ha ido incrementando sus ventas ya que ahora además de la tienda y librería ya tiene un café internet en este ultimo negocio imvertira el credito que solicita, con el crédito que está solicitando lo utilizara para poder comprar algunas computadoras mas es el segundo crédito que solicita y promete pagar puntualmente para que siempre le brinden la ayuda que les están dando.
texts.en: This pair is made up of María Luisa who is originally from San Andrés Itzapa. María Luisa owns a store and a small book shop. Her sales, thanks to God and to the assistance of Kiva, have increased due to that fact that as well as the store and the bookshop she now also has an internet cafe. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy a few more computers. This is the second loan she has requested and she promises to pay on time so that she will always be offered the help that she is currently receiving.

loans.use: to purchase computers for her internet café

loans.name: Dúo Santisima Trinidad De Sumpango Group

texts.es:
DUO SANTISIMA TRINIDAD
El dúo esta conformado por Johana es casada y madre de familia, ellas es originaria de San Andrés Itzapa municipio de Chimaltenango, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y desinfectantes  doña Johana tiene un puesto en el local de su casa por lo que necesita de capital para poder invertir y ampliar en su negocio ya que la competencia  hace que sus ventas bajen, es la primera vez que solicita un crédito,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia en decinfactantes y cosmeticos para la venta.
texts.en: One member of the duo is Johana, originally from San Andrés Itzapa, Chimaltenango. She is married with children. She makes her living by selling perfumes and disinfectants at a stand on the premises of her home. Johana needs capital to be able to invest in and expand her business because competition has lowered her sales. This is her first time requesting a loan. She requests the loan in order to purchase disinfectants and cosmetic products to sell.

loans.use: To buy disinfectants and cosmetic products to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bananas etc.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: El señor Andrés es propietario de una venta de tacos, gringas, y hotdog, actualmente tiene 2 carretas para la venta del mismo y cuenta con un empleado para poder atender uno de  los dos puestos él es padre de 2 niñas las cuales aun son menores y tiene a cargo la mantención de su familia el señor Andrés desea que la herencia que DIOS  le ha dado tenga un mejor estilo de vida que la que él tuvo ya que el anhela que sus hijas sean mujeres de bien y exitosas y en esta  ocasión el toca las puertas de la institución para poder adquirir un crédito el cual utilizara para la compra de una hieleras y una carreta de chéveres esperando en DIOS  que le escuchen y atiendan a dicha solicitud y de antemano my agradecido.
texts.en: Andres is the owner of a food stall selling tacos and hotdogs. Currently, he has two carts he uses to sell food, and has one employee who attends one of the stalls. He is the father of two girls, who are still minors, and he is in charge of supporting his family. Andres wishes that what God has given them leads to a better way of life than what he had, as he hopes that his daughters can be well-to-do and successful. At this time, he knocks on the doors of this institution to be able to get a loan, which he will use to buy coolers and a food cart. He hopes in God that he will be heard and his request will be attended to, and he is very grateful in advance.

loans.use: To buy coolers and a food cart to sell bread with meat, etc.

loans.name: José Medardo

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad, es jornalero y estudió hasta el 3° grado no siguió por no tener los recursos económicos suficientes para seguir estudiando, ahora es un hombre acompañado y junto con su compañera de vida procrearon 2 hijos, de los cuales ya están trabajando y dependen de ellos mismos, José vive con su esposa y su madrecita quienes dependen de él.-

Su compañera de vida se dedica a vender en una tienda que tienen en su casita, mientras que José, se dedica al cuido de sus propios animales, trabajo que lo aprendió por la misma necesidad en que vivían, su horario es de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm todos los días.

El crédito que esta solicitando en la institución es para comprar repuestos para su motocicleta, ya que es la que utiliza para andar cuidando sus animales y ahorita la tiene en malas condiciones, para llegar al lugar de trabajo José viaja 2 kilómetros, su horario es de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm, el sueño de José es tener un negocio de compra y venta de lotes con viviendas.
texts.en:
José, 45 years old, is a laborer. He went to school through the 3rd grade but he didn't continue because he didn't have enough economic resources to keep studying. Now he is in a relationship and he and his partner have two children who are already working and taking care of themselves. José lives with his partner and his mother, who depend on him. His partner works tending a store that they have in their home while José makes a living caring for his own animals, work that he learned out of the necessity of his circumstances. His schedule is from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm every day.

The loan that he is requesting will go towards buying parts for his motorcycle, which he uses to go to care for his animals and which is currently in bad condition. To get to his workplace, José travels 2 kilometers.  José's dream is to have a business buying and selling residential lots.

loans.use: to buy parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is 25-years-old and works with his mother in a grocery store. The store opens from Monday to Sunday and he says that he likes it to keep a lot of stock to provide different products and good services for his clients. Ricardo says that his main achievement is opening the store with his mother and being able to see it grow, his goal is to open a sporting goods store and diversify his sources of income. Ricardo describes himself as credit worthy because in the past he has taken loans and always payed them on time.

loans.use: To buy products for a sporting goods store

loans.name: Barchinoy

texts.en:
Barchinoy is a careful and responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia and his income is not enough to offer the children all necessary things. 

Barchinoy is going to start her business and, in this way, earn a living. She is going to start a business, growing and selling vegetables. She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ at a women's organization and got a certificate. 

Barchinoy is asking for a loan of TJS 2,300 (somoni) to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. She awaits you mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for her vegetable business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 40 years old and has six children. She is married, and has three children who are currently in school.

Nenita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has asked for a 11,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Nenita has been raising livestock for ten years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is a Ugandan hardworking married man living in Kagadi. He has been selling produce, especially maize and beans, to get income. He hopes to grow his business into new market areas despite challenges of bad weather and price fluctuations. Sunday is requesting a loan to buy maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy maize for selling.

loans.name: Misael

texts.en:
Misael lives in a community in the Department of Copan Honduras. He is dedicated to coffee farming. Aged 21, he is married. It is clear that Misael works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that the solar energy system will improve his living conditions.

Misael is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Favor Y Gracia Group

texts.en:
The six women of the group Favor y Gracia live in el Tejar, Chimaltenango, Sacatepéquez, Guatemala. Their ages range from 26 to 64, and all have businesses such as selling tortillas, chickens, cosmetics, second hand clothing and shoes. These are women with little knowledge of money management and business administration, few economic resources, but with strong goals for their businesses and themselves.They are all eager to participate in the Namaste program because in the past they have received loans that did not come with any education and didn’t provide much in the way of positive results for their businesses. With Namaste they will receive classes in financial literacy and also a personal business adviser who will help them write a business plan and give them advice on how to manage and grow their businesses. 

Dora (third from right) is one of these ambitious women.  She is 52 years old and has a fifth-grade education.  She is married with five children, only one of whom, at 15, is still at home and in school. Her business is making and selling tortillas and she is starting to expand into selling other kinds of food as well. Her husband helps her in the business part time when she needs to get wood or carry corn to the mill. She provides about half the support for her family, working about eight hours a day making and selling her tortillas. She is going to use her loan money to buy a blender, a coffee maker, a second hand refrigerator and other similar items she will need for selling food other than tortillas.

She currently has a monthly profit of 3155 Guatemalan Quetzales. She hopes to increase this by 20% during the course of her nine-month loan cycle. Her dream is to eventually remodel her little shop into a small restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a blender, a coffee maker, a second hand refrigerator and other similar items she will need for selling food other than tortillas.

loans.name: Ismenia Paola

texts.es:
Ismenia es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo brindándole una educación de buena calidad.

Ismenia vive en unión libre con su pareja y desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender productos de uso personal a través de catalogo, con gran esfuerzo a superado muchos problemas que se le han presentado.

Actualmente Ismenia tiene unos muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a su hijo una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ismenia is a hardworking person and, thanks to her daily efforts, she has managed to get her son ahead and provide him with a good quality education. She is in a common-law marriage with her partner, and for some time, she has been selling personal products through a catalog. With much hard work, she has overcome many problems that have arisen. 

Currently, Ismenia has some very good orders from her customers, and since she doesn’t have much working capital, she is looking for a loan to purchase personal products and fill the large number of orders from her customers. Her great dream is to get ahead with her business, which will enable her to provide her son with a good quality of life and better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase personal products and fill the large number of orders that she has.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald tiene 38 años, 02 hijos y junto a su pareja son el sustento de su hogar. Se dedican a la agricultura desde muy jovenes. Necesita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos orgánicos para su cultivo de papa. Su mayor anhelo es ver realizados profesionalmente a sus hijos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ronald is 38 years old, has two children and together with his wife they support their household.  They have been working in agriculture since they were young.  They are requesting this loan to buy seeds and organic fertilizer for their potato crop.  

Their biggest desire is to see their children become professionals and offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer for his potato crop

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: Esmeralda tiene 22 años, 01 hijo y junto a su pareja son el sustento de su hogar. Se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno de engorde, asimismo ellos logran reutilizar el estiércol como abono orgánico para su pequeño fundo. Necesita el crédito para la compra de alimento concentrado para su ganado. Su mayor anhelo es ver realizado profesionalmente a su hijo y aumentar sus cabezas de ganado.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 22 years old, has one child, and together with her partner support their household.  She raises cows for a living, and as a benefit are able to re-use the manure from their cows as organic fertilizer for their small farm.  She is requesting this loan to buy concentrated feed for her cow.  

Her biggest desires are to see her child become a professional and increase the number of cows she owns.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for her cow

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Margaret. She is a smallholder farmer from Moisbridge in Kitale, Kenya. She is the mother of three lovely angelic looking children. 

Like many farmers in the region, she keeps a dairy cow. Kitale has a thriving market for dairy products. Margaret has sustained herself through dairy farming for six years now. She enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with farm animals that goes deep, to the extent that she names each of them. 

Margaret dreams of expanding her dairy farm, but due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now. From Kiva lenders, Margaret is kindly requesting 41,200 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a high yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production on the farm. As a result, she will have more milk for both consumption and sales. With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to service her loan on time. 

With increased income from the loan, Margaret will be able to cover the high farming cost of production. Many farmers compromise quality because of the high cost of inputs. However, with increased income, Margaret will not take such measures. In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a high quality dairy cow

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina tiene 66 años, es soltera y vive en Acarí, se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, actividad que aprendió de sus padres. Necesita el crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos para mantenimiento de su cultivo de olivo y de ésta manera asegurar e incrementar su producción. Sus planes para el futuro es poder ampliar más campos de cultivo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 66 years old, single, and lives in Acarí.  She has been working in agriculture since she was young, a profession that she learned from her parents.  She is requesting this loan to buy organic fertilizer to help maintain her orchard of olive trees and ensure that production increases.  

Her plan for the future is expand her orchard to more land and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers for her olive tree orchard

loans.name: Silverio Rojas

texts.es: Silverio tiene 43 años, 02 hijos y junto a su esposa trabajan día a día en labores agrícolas, para poder sustentar los gastos básico su familia. Requiere el crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos para mantenimiento de su cultivo. Para el futuro espera ser dueño algún día de sus propios terrenos agrícolas y poder mejorar la educación a sus hijos para que tengan mayor oportunidad de desarrollo.
texts.en:
Silverio is 43 years old, and has two children.  Together with his wife they work on their farm everyday in order to be able to afford their basic family expenses.  They are requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer to maintain theie crops.  

In the future they hope to own their own farmland and be able to better educate their children so that they have more opportunities to develop.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for their organic quinoa crop

loans.name: Ollantay De Wayracpunco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elva Gloria ella es casada y tiene 74 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganaderia, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Communal Bank “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCO”. This bank is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, belonging to the Urubamba province and the department of Cuzco.

The member is Mrs. Elva Gloria, who is 74 years old and is married with five children. She works in her livestock business where she raises and fattens the livestock and later sells them to different fairs. She works from 8am until 6pm. Through this work, she hopes to move forward. Her dream is to expand the livestock selling business. 

The member is requesting the loan to buy livestock. The other members make a living in businesses selling animals, selling livestock, selling food and through a grocery store business. The member is grateful to those who form a part of her dream through this means, and she commits to paying her contributions by the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Noeun's Group

texts.en:
Noeun, 47, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Kampong Speu province. She is the mother of two schoolchildren.

To improve her living, she grows rice as her single source of income and earns her about 18,000 KHR per day.

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living in healthy conditions.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia Edith vive en la ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú, ella pertenece al banco comunal "SIEMPRE JUNTOS", la socia continua trabajando en una entidad pública, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de vivieres para su hogar como alimentos de primera necesidad arroz,leche,azucar entre otros.
texts.en:
Edith, belongs to the SIEMPRE JUNTOS community bank in Cusco. She still works for a publicly-owned company. Edith is hard-working and responsible. She is grateful for the help from Kiva lenders and committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time. For the future, she expects to go on working and supporting her family.

Edith is applying for a loan that she will use to pay for food for her family, such as rice, milk, and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase food

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru: Умед молодой начинающий предприниматель из не большого района Шахритус. Ему всего 20 лет. Он хочет начать новую деятельность животноводства. Он не боится начать новый бизнес и смело идет к своей цели. Умед хочет получить кредит и на заемные деньги приобретет несколько голов скотин и будет их содержать в течение 30-35 дней, после откорма, Умед будет перепродавать скотин с наценкой. Таким не хитрым способом он хочет начать бизнес, зарабатывать и обеспечить свою семью.
texts.en:
Umed is a young beginning entrepreneur from the Shahrituz region. He is 20 and wants to start a business in animal husbandry. He isn't afraid of starting a new business and is confidently working toward his goal. 

Umed wants to take out a loan and use the funds to purchase livestock. He will fatten them for 30 to 35 days and then resell them for a profit. In this simple way he wants to start a business, earn a living and provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and start a new business in animal husbandry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two doors and pay for labour to install the doors in her home.

loans.name: Ruth Leyni Margareth

texts.es:
La socia Ruth sigue dedicándose a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otros más, la socia vende su mercadería  a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, azúcar entre otros.
texts.en:
The member, Ruth, continues to make a living selling basic necessities such as rice, sugar, pasta, oil and other items. She sells her merchandise to the clients that seek her out. She appreciates and values the loan and promises to pay her monthly installments responsibly. She is a responsible and hard-working person, which is how she helps her family to get ahead. 

She requests a loan to buy milk, sugar, and other items.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fodder for his sheep.

loans.name: Halbek

texts.ru: Халбек, 59 лет, женат, отец 3 детей. У Халбека высшее образование, работает учителем в школе-интернате, также он занимается грузоперевозками. Берется за любую работу, чтобы прокормить свою семью. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Халбек на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день, благодаря упорству и целеустремленности Халбека в его хозяйстве имеется: 3 дойных коровы, 2 бычка, 10 овец. На 2,40 Га земли, он выращивает ячмень и клевер. Халбек хочет приумножить поголовье скота, в связи с этим он обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. На доходы от кредита он хочет увеличить поголовье скота и в скором будущем отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Halbek is 59 years old, married, and the father of three children.  He has a higher education and works as a teacher in a boarding school.  Additionally he works in merchandise transportation and would take any job to feed his family.  For the past 15 years he has also been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture in order to provide his family with an additional source of income.  Thanks to his persistence and determination, he currently owns three dairy cows, two young bulls and 10 sheep. He also grows barley and clover on 2.4 hectares of land.  Halbek wants to increase his livestock headcount, and this is the reason why he has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  He will use this money to buy two steers.  He wants to use the earnings from his loan to increase his livestock headcount and, in the near future, to repair his house.

loans.use: to purchase two steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a deep-fryer and expand their menu

loans.name: Leidys Johana

texts.es:
Leidys es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y salir adelante junto con sus hijos. 

Hace aproximadamente 2 años inició desesperadamente la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos para su hogar. Fue así como inició la cría y venta de pollos, negocio que le ha venido generando ganancias con las cuales puede sostener los gastos de su hogar. 

Leidys busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de cuido para los pollos, adecuar el corral de sus pollos y comprar insumos que requiere para la elaboración de las arepas. Sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar puede lograrlo.

Leidys tiene la esperanza en que el préstamo le permita salir adelante con su negocio. Además, espera que su negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. 

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Leidys ¡
texts.en:
Leidys is a person who has had to face lots of adversity in her life. Nonetheless, she has always been strong enough to overcome it and get ahead with her children. About approximately two years ago, she began a desperate search for a stream of income for her home. This is how she began the raising and selling of chicks. This business has been generating gains with which she can sustain the expenses of the home. 
Maria hopes that a loan will allow her the possibility to purchase feed for the chicks, refurbish her chick's coop and purchase ingredients required in the production of arepas.
She knows that with help from the Interactuar corporation she will be able to achieve this. Maria hopes that the loan will allow her to be successful in her business. Additionally, she hopes that her business will grow and generate increased income with witch she will be able to offer her children a better quality of life and better opportunities for progress. With a loan you make today you can help improve Leidy's business as well as her life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the chicks, refurbish her chick's coop and purchase ingredients she requires for the production of arepas.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima  is a 27-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a printing shop. He is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members. 

Fatima  has been running her own beauty salon for past five years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the house hold. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e creams, hair brush, and other accessories, for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not able to buy these items for her business. 

Therefore Fatima  has applied for a Kiva loan . This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance Fatima  is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to improve her beauty salon.

loans.name: Tejedoras 1 Group

texts.en:
Amanda grew up among many limitations, her father died when she was 10 years old because of the war between the guerrilla and the army. Her mother alone had to raise five children. At that time Amanda worked sowing corn. When she was thirteen she did not had any clothes nor shoes. She began selling oranges and limes that she carried in a basket to the fields where she sold them. 
Now Amanda has ten children. She has had loans from the Association for three years, with the first one she began her general store, with her second and third loan, half of the amount she invested in the store and the other half used for the education of her son. This year she will use her loan to expand store. Her son graduated this year as Teacher. 
Amanda is the leader of the Tejedoras Group 1, the group is composed of seven women, and they will invest their loans in Retail and Agricultural Activities. On average they have three children. The Average of their loans is Q 4,800.

loans.use: to expand her general store

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
Las calles de Sololá es testigo de los colores más vistosos impregnados en las mostacias  artesanales.  Es imposible que cualquier turista deje de admirar estos productos, pararse y hacer una buena compra de ello. De 28 años de edad casada Sandra es un ejemplo en tener vivo las culturas de Guatemala, ella es una mujer emprendedora que no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que a ella se le presentan sino ella busca alternativas para salir adelante.

La actividad que ella dignamente realiza es la elaboración de mostacias artesanales ella ha venido realizando desde hace mas de 2 años ya que para ella es algo que le gusta hacer, para tener un ingreso económico par el sustento de su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida par ella y su familia, con los ingresos económicos que ella obtiene de sus ventas de dicha actividad que realiza mejora el futuro de su comunidad.

El motivo de la realización del préstamo  que ella está realizando es para la compra de productos  e  insumos de mostacias artesanales, para exhibir mejor sus productos a las personas turísticas que visitan el lugar donde ella está ubicada en su comunidad. Uno de los sueños de Sandra es la ampliación de su negocio y la realización de más productos artesanales para poder brindarles un buen servicio a las personas que lo visitan.
texts.en:
The streets of Sololá are witnesses to the bright colors in the handmade beads.  It is impossible for any tourist to stop admiring these products - they stay to make a good buy of them.  28 year old married Sandra is an example of being alive in the cultures of Guatemala. She is an enterprising woman who will not be overcome by the obstacles presented to her but rather she looks for alternatives to succeed.

She earns a living by making craft beads.  She has been doing it for more than two years and it is something she enjoys doing.  Her income enables the support of her family and improves the living conditions for her and her family.  With the income she receives from her sales, she is improving the future of her community.

The reason for the fulfillment of the loan is for the purchase of products and supplies for craft beads, and to better showcase her products to the tourists who visit the place where she is located in the community.   One of the Sandra's dreams is expanding her business and making more handcrafted products to provide a good service to people who visit.

loans.use: to buy products and supplies for handmade beads

loans.name: Nazam

texts.en:
Nazam is a 37-year-old man, residing in Lalamusa, Gujrat, Pakistan. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He is a father of three children. He has been doing his own business of shoe making for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and to manage the household.

Nazam wants to purchase different kinds of tools and accessories for his shoe making business but due to financial constraints he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Nazam has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy these accessories to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also help him to earn maximum profit from his business.

On this financial assistance Nazam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy shoe making accessories for his shoe making business.

loans.name: Tejedoras 3 Group

texts.en:
When María was 6 her mother died from an illness, they were 7 siblings, her father took care of them. Couple of times her father try remarry but the selected women could not take care of the family, and they left her father. They got raised by her father.
When she was 15 she married because she had many problems in her family. At the beginning of their married life they had problems but they got alone. Now she has a good marriage, and they have 6 children.
María and her husband began thinking that they have to do something that provide them income, she investigated about the Chajulense Association of Women United for Life and the loans they gave to women. She got her first loan from the Association and invested in tools and equipment for making ice cream. She began making and selling ice cream with her first loan, one of the equipment she bought was an ice chest that let her and his husband sell from house to house. With her second loan she bought two wheelbarrows for carrying and selling the ice cream. Last year, with her third loan, they have to change their product; their ice cream was too artisanal, so she began buying three different flavors of ice cream, this gave a better quality for her clients. With their four credit they are thinking of opening an ice cream shop, but they have to plan and consider whether this is possible this year.
María is the leader of Tejedoras Group 1, the group is composed of 6 women, and they will invest their loans in Retail and Textile activities. They are from the Ethnicity Ixil Maya. On average they have 5 children. Their average loan amount is Q 3,066.

loans.use: to expand her ice cream shop

loans.name: Tejedoras 2 Group

texts.en:
María only has one brother, her father and mother died when she was 7 years old, she does not remember them. Since then she live with a lady that took care of them. She worked doing housework for the lady. 
At 10 she began thinking what to do, at 12 she began working doing corn tortillas, she got one quetzal per day. When she was 14 the Chajulense Association of Women United for Life offered a training program for weaving, this let her work for a Textile Project and she began to get small benefits. When she left the project she got her compensation, she invested it in her general store.
She has devoted her life in supporting his brother and took the responsibility for her nephew education, his nephew obtained this year his title of Teacher of Primary Education.
María has have 7 years receiving loans from the Association, most of them have been invested in her general store, for stock up it, buying a refrigerator, to make up for a steal she suffered, to buy a computer for her nieces that studied school teaching, and for supporting the education of her nephew. This year she will use her credit to stock up her store.
María is the leader of the Tejedoras Group 2, the group is integrated by 6 women, and they are from Ethnicity Ixil Maya. Their principal activities in which they invest are Agriculture and Retail. On average they have 3 children. Their average loan amount is Q 6,233.

loans.use: to supply her store

loans.name: Zabita

texts.en:
Zabita is 57 years old and married and she has 5 children. All her children except the oldest son live separately . Her family is large as there are seven members. Her elder son's family lives with her. Zabita's husband is ill and he cannot work. Her son is a driver and his salary is not enough to cover the family's needs. 

For these reasons, Zabita raises vegetables on her land. She has been busy growing potatoes and onions for more than 37 years. She has great experience in farming. . Zabita sows potatoes and onions twice a year.

Farming is much expanded in Azerbaijan and raising potatoes and onions is in high demand. People raise onions and sell the harvest to restaurants, or to local bazaars. 

She is asking for a loan of 1500 AZN to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Shaig

texts.en:
Shaig is 35 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with parents and his lovely family. Both of his kids are going to secondary school. His wife is a housewife. The family is living in Absheron region but they have been IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Shusha city for over 22 years.

Shaig has a store. In the store Shaig sells daily food products. He has been selling products for 9 years. Shaig has applied to Komak company for a loan in amount of 1350 AZN for support his business. He plans to buy more products (food oils, makarones, sugars, meals, sausages, dairy produce and etc.) for selling with this amount.

Shaig says, “Thanks dear Kiva organization and lenders, I hope that this loan will help to develop my business”. 

In the future he wants to repair his store.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in his store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia de 54 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de mantenimiento en una finca cercana a su vivienda. Ella es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 25 y 22 años de edad, a los que ha logrado sacar adelante a base de esfuerzos y dedicación. Lucia desea construir un corredor en su vivienda, para evitar que el agua se introduzca en su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines, alambre y clavos para construir un corredor en su vivienda y así tener un lugar agradable en su vivienda y evitar que el agua se introduzca en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lucia is 54 years old and an enterprising woman who earns a living maintaining a farm near her home. She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her two children ages 25 and 22 whom she has succeeded in raising through effort and dedication
Lucia wishes to build a passageway in her home so that water won't get into the home, and for this she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to purchase sheet metal, lumber, wire and nails so that she can build a passsageway for her home and in this way have a pleasant area in he home and avoid water getting into her home.

loans.use: To purchase sheet metal roofing, lumber, wire and nails for building a hallway in her home

loans.name: Mirian Guadalupe

texts.es: Mirian de 33 años de edad habita junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 15, 17, y 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo artículos de belleza por catalogo desde hace 6 años, además buscando la manera de tener más y mejores ingresos decidió invertir en: jabón, detergente, cloro, etc. y venderlos en los cantones cercanos a su vivienda. Mirian desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI que le permita comprar: cemento, arena, grava y pagar mano de obra para encementar el corredor de su vivienda, Mirian ha depositado su confianza en la institución ya que anteriormente ha recibido el apoyo.
texts.en: Mirian is 33 years old and lives with her husband the 3 children ages 17, 15, and 5 years old. She is an enterprising woman who earns a living selling beauty supplies by catalog, a business she has had for 6 years. In addition she seeks a way to have increased income so she decided to invest in soap, detergent, chlorine, etc. and sell them in nearby neighborhoods. Mirian wants a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel and pay for labor to cement a corridor in her home. She has placed her trust in the institution from which she has received help previously.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and pay for labor to cement a corridor in her home.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia es una mujer de 43 años de edad, soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 5, 7, 18 y 20 años y su negocio es la venta de comida tipo snack.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, comprensiva, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘El Torno’ un área rural caracterizado por el comercio entre agricultores y comerciantes mayoristas que reparten los productos a mercados de la ciudad. De clima cálido tropical y húmedo, con una temperatura constante entre 18-35 grados centígrados durante todo el día.
Dionicia es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español por el comercio. su vida la comparte con sus 4 hijos, los dos mayores terminaron la escuela y se dedican a trabajar, los dos menores estudian en la escuela, viven en la casa de la familia que esta construidad de ladrillo y cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de comida tipo snack, como: empanadas de queso, salteñas (empanadas de carne a horno), tucumanas (empanadas de carne fritas), sándwiches (de queso, mortadela, palta, etc.), galletas (dulces y saladas), refrescos, gaseosas, etc. en un puesto de venta al aire libre en la puerta de su domicilio; ‘comencé mi negocio por la necesidad de trabajar, hasta el momento me ha ido bien porque la calle es muy transitada y los productos que ofrezco son de buena calidad…’ comenta. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes de mejor manera. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en un año que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Dionicia solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes de mejor forma.
texts.en:
Dionicia, 43, is single and has four children, ages 5, 7, 18, and 20.  Her business is selling snack food. She's independent, understanding, tenacious, responsible, and hardworking, and is a good mother. She works in El Torno, a rural area known for commerce between farmers and wholesale vendors who distribute goods to markets in the city. The tropical climate is warm and humid, with a constant temperature between 18 and 35 degrees centigrade throughout the year.

Dionicia is short and dark and has long black hair. Her native language is Guarani and she speaks Spanish for business. She lives with her four children. The two older ones finished school and are working; the two youngest attend school. They live in the family home, which is made of brick and has potable water and electricity.

Her business is selling snack food: cheese empanadas, salteñas (baked meat empanadas), tucumanas (fried meat empanadas), sandwiches (cheese, mortadella, avocado, etc.), cookies and crackers, soft drinks, sodas, etc.  She has a sales stall outside the door to her house. "I started my business because I needed to work. Up to now it has gone well for me because the street's very busy and I sell high-quality products," she said.

Dionicia's dream is to improve her quality of life, and she wants to expand her business with a purchase of tables and chairs to better serve more customers. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the year she has been doing this work. That's why Dionicia's requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs to reach more customers and provide better service.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to better serve more customers

loans.name: Ñaupaqman Purisum Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Ñaupaqman Purisum” de la Asociación Arariwa y viven en el distrito de Santa Ana de la provincia de La Convención

La socia es la Sra. Eulalia Merida ella es conviviente y tiene 64 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members in the photo belong to “Ñaupaqman Purisum”, an Arariwa Association community bank. They live in the Santa Ana district in the province of La Convención. 
Eulalia Merida is the member who will receive this loan. She is a 64 year old, married mother to 2 children. She runs her own business selling cereals, such as wheat, maize and quinoa, working from 8am until 5pm. She has been running this business for 4 years and it has been going well for her; in the future, she hopes to have shop where she can sell her goods. She plans to use this loan to buy wheat, maize and quinoa.
The member whose photo appears in the bottom corner took this photo of himself after the meeting, having previously requested permission to do so due to his work commitments.
The other members of the group run various businesses, including, selling animals, cereals, groceries and food.
Eulalia is grateful to whoever should be part of making this dream come true for her and is committed to fulfilling her repayment schedule within the specified period.

loans.use: to buy wheat, maize and quinoa.

loans.name: Mosoc Runa Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MOSOC RUNA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la señora Patricia, la socia tiene 44 años de edad es soltera y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de plantas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos de plantas para todos sus clientes que le solicitan , la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y plantas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de ropa, ferretería, carpintería.
texts.en:
Patricia, 44 years old, is single and has a child. She belongs to the communal bank Mosoc Runa, which is located in the district of Cusco, province and department of Cusco.

She combines her daily activities with her business of selling plants. She's been working for a while now and she's doing well thanks to the effort she puts into the business every day. She sells various kinds of plants to her clients who request them. She would like to continue working so that she can continue to support her family.

Patricia is requesting the loan to buy seeds and plants.

The other members work selling clothes, in a hardware store, and a carpenter's shop. The members pictured in the smaller photos asked permission to arrive late at the meeting because of their work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and plants.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina, is a 54-year-old widowed woman who lives in the small of village Orulu. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and two grandsons. Marina does her best to make good living conditions for her family, but her attempt is insufficient, at a time when the family's only source of income is generated from a small agribusiness. 

Marina takes care of three cattle on family-owned agricultural land, cultivates it herself and sells the harvested products at the local market. In order to deal with the financial difficulties and increase the family's living conditions, she wants to make another source of income. Marina needs financial support to purchase a truck and get income from renting it with private orders. 

The business will be profitable as the agribusiness is quite well-developed in this region and people will rent it, especially in season. Marina has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Marina as she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life.

loans.use: To purchase a truck and rent it with private orders

loans.name: Familia De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Familia de Jesús está integrado por Rubén, Rosa y Alberto hijos de Don Lorenzo quien tiene 59 años de edad. Él y su esposa Esperanza tienen ocho hijos en total aunque ya sólo una depende de ellos. Debido a la falta de trabajo y al notar que los gastos del hogar seguían aumentando, decidió comenzar su propio negocio vendiendo productos de limpieza y mercería aunque por temporadas también labraba la tierra. Don Lorenzo pasó 15 años de su vida recorriendo calles y mercados de su comunidad, pero por la falta de dinero fue imposible continuar con su actividad.

Tiempo después, sus hijos Rubén y Alberto empezaron a vender los mismos productos, contaban con la experiencia que su papá les había heredado. Por otro lado, Rosa decidió comenzar a críar y vender borregos, actividad que aún mantiene.

Al ver que sus hijos siguen trabajando con empeño, Don Lorenzo se siente motivado para volver a su vida de comerciante por lo que se acercó a VisionFund para solicitar un préstamo, comprar abarrotes y abrir una tienda. Don Lorenzo se muestra muy contento porque después de siete años volverá a tener un negocio.

Los integrantes están muy agradecidos por la ayuda que representa el préstamo para seguir impulsando sus actividades y mejorar su calidad de vida.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escalaras debajo del kiosco del municipio, Don Lorenzo es el primero a mano izquierda.
texts.en:
Familia de Jesús Group is made up of Rubén, Rosa, and Alberto, children of Lorenzo, 59.  He and his wife have eight children in total, although only one is still dependent on them.

Lacking a job and seeing that the household expenses continued to rise, he decided to start his own business selling cleaning products and notions, although he also farms occasionally. Lorenzo spent 15 years of his life traversing the streets and markets in his community, but he lacked the money to continue with that work.

Some time later, his children Rubén and Alberto started selling the same products, relying on the experience they had gotten from their father. On the other hand, Rosa decided to start raising and selling sheep, work she still does.

Seeing that his children continue to work hard, Lorenzo is inspired to return to work as a merchant.  He went to VisionFund to request a loan to buy groceries and open a store.  Lorenzo's very happy because he's going back to having a business after seven years.

The members are very grateful for the help of the loan to keep on inspiring their work and improving their quality of life.

The photograph was taken on the stairs underneath the town kiosk. Lorenzo is the first one on the left.

loans.use: to buy milk, eggs, sugar, ham, canned goods, and detergent

location.town: Santa Cruz Mextepec, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 60-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in the small village of Samtredia district. The family is involved in husbandry business. In particular, they have 2 cows. Natela milks the cows every day and produces cheese products, which she sells locally.

She decided to start an additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3000 GEL. With the credit, she will open a market and will generate stable income. She will sell home products and foodstuff there, such as: sugar, flour and so on.

Natela awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a market and generate stable income in order to increase family income.

loans.name: Paulina Isabel

texts.es: Paulina, una emprendedora mujer decidió tener una miscelánea en la que no obtuvo una gratificante experiencia, ya que sus ventas fluctuaban mucho a raíz de  las temporadas del año; ella nos cuenta que habían días en los que no vendía ni un solo articulo, razón suficiente para buscar otras alternativas de generación de ingresos, por eso se ayudaba prestando servicios como estilista, fue entonces cuando decidió dedicarse solamente a la peluquería, ella había hecho capacitaciones en esta actividad para tener un mejor desempeño. Adecuó su local con silla, lava cabezas, espejo y se quedo con una vitrina mostrador de la miscelánea, donde hoy exhibe productos de belleza. Este negocio ya tiene 14 años de estar funcionando y sus principales clientes son sus vecinos del barrio en el que reside, ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla, a quienes presta sus servicios de contado en el horario de atención de 8:00 a.m. a 9:00 p.m. todos los días, realizando  sus compras de insumos de contado, en almacenes especializados en productos para peluquería.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos de peluquería, como tinturas, productos capilares, pinta uñas y tambien articulos constructivos como cemento, arena etc, pues esta haciendo mejoras locativas, para que su local sea mas atractivo a la clientela.
