Paulina tiene 58 años y un hijo de 15 años, a quien desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida por eso desea tener su casa y poderle brindar estudios. Su meta a largo plazo es tener empleados en su negocio.
texts.en: Paulina, an enterprising woman decided to have a general store with which she did not have a gratifying experience, because her sales fluctuated a lot due to the seasons of the year. She tells us there were days when she did not sell a single item. This made her look for other alternatives to generate income. Because of this she supported herself by offering services as a stylist. This is why she decided to work solely as a hairdresser, since she had taken some courses in this job in order to be better. She arranged her place with a chair, a sink to wash hair, a mirror; and she kept the glass counter from her general store where she now exhibits her beauty products. She has had this business for 14 years already. Her main customers are her neighbors in the neighborhood where she lives, located in the municipality of Barranquilla. She offers her services from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. every day. She buys her inputs on cash at special department stores, specialized in hair salon products. Currently, she is requesting a credikiva,  the first loan she does with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy hair salon inputs such as dyes, hair products, nail polishes, and also some building materials such as cement, sand, etc. because she is improving her place in order to make it more attractive to her customers. Paulina is 58 years old. She has a 15 year old son to whom she wants to give a better quality of life. Therefore, she wishes to have a house and giver her child an education. Her long term goal is to have employees in her business.

loans.use: to buy hair salon inputs, such as dyes, hair products, nail polishes and building materials such as cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Uranys Beatriz

texts.es: Uranys, tiene 55 años de edad y una hija de 12 años; ella está dedicada a la elaboración y venta de productos cerámicos y paralelo a esta actividad también vende cervezas; Uranys nos cuenta que estudió modistería inclusive recibió su grado, pero nunca le gusto esta actividad por eso no la ejerció. Su proceso productivo consiste en comprar biscochos (productos de cerámica en bruto) los cuales pinta y los adorna, una vez listos para la venta, los ofrece a las personas del barrio en el que reside, ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla.  Ella semanalmente vende  en el horario de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m.,  su labor depende de los encargos que le hagan sus clientes, a los cuales les brinda facilidad de pago, porque como hace sus compras de contado en almacenes especializados en venta de insumos para la decoración, recibe buenos descuentos que traslada a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará los insumos necesarios con los que se encuentra elaborando adornos de cerámicas para entregar a  clientes que le han solicitado; con esta inversión su cobertura e ingresos se incrementaran y será mas productivo su negocio. Uranys desea a futuro tener su propio almacén cerámico, y su meta familiar es pagarle los estudios profesionales a su hija, para que brillen en su futuro exitoso.
texts.en: Uranys is 55 years old and has a 12 year old daughter. She makes and sells ceramic products; in addition, she also sells beers. Uranys tells us that she studied dressmaking, including receiving her degree, but she never liked this activity, so she doesn't do it. Her production process consists of buying ceramic products in bulk, which she paints and decorates. Once they are ready to sell, she offers them to people who live in her neighborhood, located in the Barranquilla municipality. Uranys sells weekly from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Her work depends on her clients' orders. She offers easy payments to her clients. Since she makes her purchases in cash at stores that specialize in decoration supplies, she receives good discounts that she transfers to her clients. Now she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy the necessary supplies to decorate ceramics to deliver to the clients who have ordered them. With this investment, her coverage and income will increase, and her business will be more productive. Uranys hopes in the future to have her own ceramic shop, and her goal for her family is to be able to pay for her daughter's professional studies so that she shines in her successful future.

loans.use: to buy supplies to decorate ceramics.

loans.name: Yina

texts.es: Yina, decidió tener su propia venta de calzado en el año 2010, su idea de negocio nace gracias a que ayudó desde muy niña en esta labor a su mamá y decidió colocar su propio negocio. Ella ofrece calzado para niños y adultos,  y su horario de atención es de 8:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. todos los días. El negocio esta ubicado en el centro del municipio de barranquilla y sus principales clientes son los transeúntes del lugar a quienes vende de contado razón por la que tiene un excelente flujo de caja. Ella realiza sus compras a proveedores y mayoristas de contado por ello está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en la compra en nuevos modelos de calzado para estar a la vanguardia y aprovechar la temporada decembrina para aumentar sus ingresos. Yina tiene 27 años de Edad y un hijo de 3 años a quien quiere brindar una mejor calidad de vida por eso su desafío es aumentar las ventas y clientes lo que le ayudará a concretar sus metas de comprar su casa y tener un almacén de calzado.
texts.en:
Yina decided to have her own business selling shoes in 2010. The idea for her business grew because she long helped her mother in business, and always wanted to become an entrepreneur. Her hours of business are from 8 am until 6 pm every day. Her business is located in the center of the municipality of Barranquilla and her main customers are the people who pass by to whom she sells to in cash. So she has excellent cash flow. She buys her product from suppliers and wholesalers in cash.

At this time she is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first loan that she has had through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy new models of shoes to be in the vanguard and to take advantage of the December sales to increase her income.

Yina is 27 years old and has a 3 year old son whom she wants to provide the best quality of living. So her challenge is to increase her sales with new clients which will help her achieve her goal of buying a house and having a shoe store.

loans.use: to buy new styles of shoes.

loans.name: Nihal

texts.en:
Nihal is married and the mother of two daughters. She had worked as a cashier, but she quit after her second daughter was born. She began to look into what she could do to contribute to the household, instead of sitting around at home. At her sister-in-law’s suggestion, she decided to make candies to hand out to celebrate weddings and births. She began working for a shop on a piece work basis at first. She didn't make much money, so she opened a website and sold the products she made there. She sells both to her friends and neighbors, and through the internet site. With the loan, she will buy wedding candy. In the future, she wants to open her own store.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nihal hanım evli iki kız çocuğu annesi.  Daha önce kasiyer olarak çalıştığı işten ikinci çocuğunun dünyaya gelmesi ile işi bırakmak zorunda kalmış.  Evde boş durmamak eve katkı sağlamak için neler yapabilirim diye araştırmalarda bulunuyor.  Görümcesinin önerisi ile nikah ve bebek şekerleri yapmaya karar veriyor.  İlk başta başka bir dükkana parça başı çalışıyor.  Emeği ucuza gelince internet üzerinden site açıp burada  yaptığı ürünleri sergileyerek satış yapmaya başlıyor.Hem çevresi hem de internet üzerinden satışları devam ediyor.  Aldığı kredi ile nikah şekeri alacak.  İleride kendine ait  bir dükkan açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy wedding candy

loans.name: Gulab Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Bindiya has those selfless leadership qualities. At the age of 32, she has decided to take charge of her life along with those who stand with her. She is the leader of a women's Self-Help group called “Gulab Mahila Samuha”. All the women in the group live in the Rupsagar village in the Deoghar district, Jharkhand. The group, under her leadership, has jelled well and, apart from sharing their rituals and festivals, they share the dreams of a better tomorrow. She has her own goat farm. A local NGO 'MESP’ has trained her in modern and scientific practices of livestock business.  Bindiya purchases lambs and goats from the market, raises them for 8 to 9 months with regular vaccinations and checkups from veterinarians. Once the livestock are ready, she sells them to local buyers. Every day in the morning, Bindiya takes the goats to graze in the fields. Bindiya has four children. They are living in a hut due to their economic condition.  Bindiya plans to purchase more livestock so that she can expand her business. For this reason, she is requesting this loan. With the new profit, she hopes to save more, construct a better house and provide a higher education to her children. She is very happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.
 
The other members (Fulmanti, Urmila, Janti and Lalita) are also seeking a loan from Kiva to improve their livelihoods. Lend now and be a part of the change.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock

loans.name: Carino Group

texts.en:
Quetzaltenango is the second largest city in Guatemala, and is situated near several volcanoes in the highlands. It is often referred to as Xelajú or Xela by the local people which means “under the 10 mountains” in the local indigenous language. The official town was founded by the Spanish in 1524 by conquistador Pedro de Alvarado and it currently has a population of 200,000 people.

In a rural area outside of the city, 10 women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Cariño” meaning “Affection, Dearness, Kindness”. One year ago, they received their first loan from Kiva which was invested by the women in their small businesses which include animal husbandry (chickens, pigs and cattle), vegetable sales and textile production. These ladies reported that they have just finished making their final payment and are requesting a second loan.

Previously, we reported on María Beatriz who used her loan to purchase more corn for her “tortillería” where she makes tortillas three times each day. She was not only able to maintain her business but also increased sales with additional customers. Maria, another member of the Trust Bank, used her previous loan for her agricultural business where she works along with her husband. The couple have five children and want to use their income to improve their family's nutrition and to take care of their children’s educational needs. Maria is requesting a new loan to purchase cabbage, broccoli and carrot seeds. However, she also has another business and raises animals to fatten and sell. She will use another part of her loan to purchase a bull to fatten and sell, creating additional income for her family.

The 10 women in the “Cariño” Trust Bank look forward to their monthly meetings where they socialize, make payments on their loans and participate in educational seminars on topics that affect their daily lives. A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares timely information about a variety of relevant subjects like self-esteem, women’s rights and health. Their businesses benefit when they gain knowledge about accounting, budgeting, customer service, marketing and pricing. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus”.

Thank you, Kiva investors, for your generosity and kindness for these women who want to empower themselves and eliminate poverty in their lives. We look forward to providing a follow-up report in the very near future!

loans.use: To purchase cabbage, broccoli and carrot seeds, and to purchase a bull to fatten and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Union Y Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “UNION Y PROSPERIDAD”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Luisa ella es soltera y tiene 54 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “UNION Y PROSPERIDAD” communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Maria Luisa is a member. She is single and 54 years old. She works as an artisan, selling weavings, sweaters, tablecloths, and blankets. She sells different weavings, working from 8 AM to 7 PM. She has had this business for 8 years and it is going very well for her. She dreams of expanding her business.

She seeks a loan to buy weavings, sweaters, and tablecloths. The other members have various businesses: selling artisan items, selling clothing, grocery store, and selling beauty products. The member is grateful to those who help form part of her dream and she promises to make the loan payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy weavings, sweaters, and tablecloths.

loans.name: Colibri Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Colibri, lo integra tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral, quien lo coordina es la señora Aminta que tiene la edad de 50 años, soltera, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa usada además desde hace un año y medio, esto le ha permitido satisfacer la demanda en su localidad es segundo ciclo que ADIM le brinda los financiamientos para su negocio, este último lo requiere para la compra pacas de ropa usada como camisas, shores, pantalones, sabanas, toallas de niños y adultos, vestidos, etc. Otras de las socias es la señora Karla de 23 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de tortillas, fritanga y nacatamales y la señora Johana tiene la edad de 25 años y es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Colibri is made up of three members, all successful in their working lives. Aminta is 50 years old and coordinates the group. She is single and has worked in the merchandising of used clothes and more for a year and a half. This has allowed her to meet the demand in her neighborhood.  

This second loan from ADIM provides financing for her business. She needs this latest for the purchase of bales of used clothes like shirts, shorts, pants, sheets, children's and adult towels, dresses, etc. 

The other members are Karla who is 23 years old and works in the sale of tortillas, fried food, and nacatamales [meat, rice, and cornmeal wrapped in a banana leaf] and Johana who is 25 years old and is the proprietor of a small grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, such as shirts, trousers, skirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Teofista

texts.en:
Teofista, age 56, is from Tipan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is married with four children.  Teofista joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. The Coop supported her by providing the capital to start her food vending business. 

Helping the family survive, she gives her best ability in cooking delicious food, in order to sell it all out. Teofista is now trying to expand her resources, so she decided to engage in pig raising. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy two piglets and bags of feed. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs.

 In addition, Teofista wants her business to be well-known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to live a happy and comfy life.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and bags of feed

loans.name: Thư

texts.en:
Mrs. Thư operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables.

She is 42 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province

This is Thư's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thư has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thư faces in her life is not having biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipments to build biogas system.

With her business profit, Thư hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase equipments to build biogas system

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is from the village of Sindangan. She is 53 years old and married. 

Lourdes owns and operates a store in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living standards and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Now Lourdes is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase household items to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase household items to sell

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Gavina

texts.en: Gavina is a buy and sell entrepreneur who lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is widow and has three adult children. She's worked in her business for many years where she generates income to support her family. However, to help continue her business she needs to borrow an amount of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase dry goods. With the capital aided by PMPC,she is very lucky to avail herself of the products and services that PMPC offers.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods for her buy and sell business to continue the operation.

loans.name: Misaela

texts.en: Misaela is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is 49 years old and is married. Amelita owns and operates a general merchandise business that sells umbrellas, bolos, water tubs, basins, etc. in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Misaela  joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Misaela is requesting a new loan to restock her store with various merchandise like plastic wares, household items, and ready-to-wear clothing. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with merchandise.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
In 2010, Daylinda learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and the financial assistance that it extends. As a businesswoman in Sindangan, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start her sari-sari (variety) store business. After several months, she was able to repay her borrowed capital. 

To this day, Daylinda feels she owes her good fortune to PMPC for having trusted her with the money she used to set up her business. Recently, she took out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities. Daylinda wishes to sustain her business and to be able to support her children's needs.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Bob Angel

texts.en:
Bob Angel had a loan used for paying the house rental for his boarding house while studying.  

Bob Angel is a very dedicated to his studies and wants to become successful in the future. He studies for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration in a university. He is now taking another loan to pay for the school tuition fee for the second semester. In the future, he wants to find a job that enables him to support himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for the school tuition fee for the second semester

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan, which she used to buy raw ingredients like meats, rice, vegetables, and condiments needed for her food stall business. Through her hard work and earnings, she was able to start a general store and is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to buy grocery items such as rice, packed dry goods, beverages and toiletries to add to her general store. She will also use part of the loan to buy ingredients such rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings for her food stall. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. It will definitely help cover their daily needs and the schooling of her child. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Rose Marie dreams that all her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries, and also, ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 27 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 41 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, eggs, etc.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment for his ice cream truck

loans.name: Trinidad Antonio

texts.es:
Desde pequeño su pasión por las matemáticas fue nato para Trinidad de 28 años quién está culminando su segundo estudio técnico, el cual le ha ayudado a poner en práctica lo que ha aprendido en todo su trayecto de aprendizaje, Trinidad siempre supo su pasión por llevar las cuentas y administrar por eso no dudo en estudiarlo, labora como operario en una zona franca donde ha podido solventar sus estudios por el mismo, convirtiéndose en un joven capaz, decidido, trabajador y responsable. 
Trabajar para Trinidad nunca ha sido un obstáculo en dejar sus estudios, al contrario, lo ha alentado a seguir sacando provecho de su juventud, para seguir estudiando y poder encontrar nuevas oportunidades de trabajo, Trinidad solicita el crédito para el pago de su titulación en técnico de Contabilidad, el cual siempre ha añorado, piensa seguir estudiando, así también el idioma inglés que es uno de los requisitos en la mayoría de los trabajos. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento ya que de esa manera podrá buscar otras ofertas laborales, seguirá cumpliendo sus metas de seguir estudiando y crecer en su perfil profesional, Trinidad tiene como metas a futuro seguir sacando otros cursos y expresa sentirse agradecido con el apoyo de KIVA-MiCrédito.
texts.en:
Ever since he was young Trinidad, 28, has had a passion for Mathematics. He is finishing his second year of technical studies which has helped him put into practice all he has learned throughout his training. Trinidad always knew his passion would take him into accounting and administration, so he had no doubts about this field of study. He works as an operator in a duty free area and has been able to pay for his education by himself, while becoming a capable, determined, hard-working, responsible young man.

For Trinidad, having to work has never been an obstacle standing in the way of his education. On the contrary, it has encouraged him to take advantage of his youth to continue his studies to find new work opportunities.

Trinidad is requesting a loan to pay for his Accounting Technician diploma, which he always has wanted. He plans to continue his education and also learn English which is a requirement for most jobs.  He trusts he will receive the loan and be able to look for other work opportunities. He will meet his goal and continue to study and grow professionally.  One of his future goals is to take other courses.  He is grateful for Kiva Lenders' support.

loans.use: To pay for his accounting technician diploma.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, cheese, and clothes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joe is a veteran of the mobile phone industry, having worked with phones for over fifteen years. He started out at a Sprint store, where he quickly rose through the ranks, eventually managing a chain of six different locations in San Diego and Arizona.

After a brief stint in another industry, Joe returned to the mobile phone industry to open his own store eight years ago. Since then, Joe has built a loyal and profitable customer base, selling prepaid services from five different providers as well as phone repair, computer repair, and phone “unlocking” services.

Joe has been able to differentiate himself by servicing multiple cell service providers, where most of his competitors are specific to one provider such as Boost or T-Mobile.

He will use his Kiva loan to beef up inventory for the holiday season. With the help of generous Kiva lenders, Joe will be servicing the mobile needs of the San Diego area for years to come.

loans.use: to beef up inventory for the holiday season.

loans.name: Dara's Group

texts.en: Dara’s group live in a rural village in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Dara makes a living cultivating rice and planting crops to support her family.In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Dúo Monica De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Monica de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señora Mónica quien se dedica a la confección de delantales típicos desde hace muchos años.  Al lado de su esposo y sus hijos le da muchas gracias a Dios por la habilidad que tiene y su sueño es tener un lugar hermoso en el mercado de su pueblo para poder vender sus delantales en un solo lugar en el mercado y dejar de ser una vendedora ambulante.  Las buenas fechas se aproximan y los pedidos de delantales empiezan a llegar a ella las cuales son varios.  Le hacen falta retazos de cortes y algunos adornos como el piquito, margaritas, aplicaciones, brichos para poder elaborar los delantales, pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza por ese motivo ella necesita un préstamo para poder comprar los adornos que le hacen falta y no quedarles mal a sus compradoras.
texts.en: The woman in charge of the Dúo Monica de San Pedro  is Monica, who has had a business selling traditional aprons for many years. At the side of her husband and children she gives thanks to God for the ability that she has and her dream of having a beautiful place in the market of her town to be able to sell aprons on a single place in the market and not selling on the street as a street vendor. The holidays are approaching and the apron orders are beginning to arrive. She needs fabric remnants, decorative items such as flowers, trims, and appliques to decorate the aprons. But her money can't meet the need so she seeks a loan to be able to buy decorative items that she needs in order to serve her customers well.

loans.use: to buy items to decorate aprons to sell.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 24 year old single young man from Rafah city. He lives with his parents in a small house. He has a stall where he sells different types of products. He gets a low income which is not enough to cover all his needs. Ayman is also a student in his last year where he studies Business Administration. He wants to take a BA degree and find a better job in the future.

Ayman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ayman will be able to do his homework and start preparing for his seminars.

Ayman appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Ricardo es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está casado y comenta que tiene un hijo, quien es motivo de lucha de el y de su familia. Ricardo es dueño de una casa de venta de celulares al por mayor y menor.
Trabaja en forma familiar con su hermano y su esposa, ya hace más de 10 años que se dedica a esto. El es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que con esfuerzo y sacrificio se ha abierto camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar accesorios varios para su negocio de venta de celulares, lo cual le permitirá poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: Ricardo is from the city of Encarnacion. He is married, and says that he has a son, who is the motivation for his struggle and that of his family. Ricardo owns a store where cell phones are sold wholesale and individually. He works in this family business with his brother and his wife. He has worked in this business for more than ten years. He is a very hardworking and enterprising person, who has moved ahead thanks to his effort and sacrifice. He is requesting this loan in order to buy diverse accessories for his business selling cell phones, which will allow him to continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy accessories for cell phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sewing supplies.

loans.name: Milagro Sulema

texts.es:
La señora Milagro de 54 años de edad es casada tiene 02 hijos que depende de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, carnes , frescos, golosinas.
Doña Milagro es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante junto con sus hijos que están estudiando, su venta es en su casa y también de forma ambulante, es discapacitada mas sin embargo es un ejemplo de optimismo, responsabilidad, es una de la mejores clientes,  desea superase y cambien su forma de vida.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de abarrotería como refrescos, churros, papas, plátanos, huevos, pan, etc.  Con el  apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y de esta forma mejorar también su condición de vida, ya que desea vender bastante para esta época de  navidad también quiere abrir  un negocio de golosinas.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa y también su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
La señora Milagro is 54 years old and married. She has 2 children who depend on her. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She has her own home and for the last five years she has worked in the business of selling groceries, meats, fresh foods, and sweets. 

Doña Milagro is an enterprising woman with a desire to help her children, currently in school, to prosper. She sells from her home and also as a street vendor. Milagro is disabled, however she is an example of optimism and responsibility. She is one of the best clients. She wishes to improve and change her way of life. 

She is requesting this loan to buy groceries like drinks, churros, potatoes, plantains, eggs, bread, etc. With the support of this loan she hopes to improve her income and in this way also improve her quality of life, since she wishes to sell a lot during this Christmas season and she also wants to open a candy shop. Her dream is to improve her house and also her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, churros, potatoes, plantains, eggs, bread, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, a resident of Tudela, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines, is in the business of mat making. She is 53 years old, and is married with five children. For many years, Emma has invested in this type of business where she generates income and supports her family in their daily needs. 

However, to continue operating her mat-making business, Emma is needing to borrow an amount of PHP 14,000 to buy materials. This will help her to supply her customers' demand.

loans.use: To buy materials for her mat-making business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, aged 52, is single and lives in Dulapo, Oroquieta City. In order to survive, she has found ways to earn income through her retail business in which she sells cellphone recharge loads. This began with only a small amount of recharge loads which she sold to her neighbours. 

Agnes joined Paglaum MP Cooperative (PMPC) which helped her with a loan to provide capital to establish her business in February 2014. She became a MIGS member which is why she has received another loan. Agnes is now applying for a loan of 12,000 PHP to pay for additional cellphone recharge loads that she can sell. She hopes that her business will continue and someday she will become a cellphone recharge load stockholder in their town.

loans.use: to pay for additional cellphone recharge loads to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 46 years old, married and lives at Dipolog City, Philippines.

In order to earn a living she uses her skills sewing and accepts sewing jobs like uniforms and customized costumes. Through Paglaum MPC, she obtained the capital to purchase her second-hand sewing machine. Now, she requests a loan to buy textiles, threads and buttons.

She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday she wants to save to start a piggery business for additional income.

loans.use: to buy textiles, threads and buttons

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 47 years old. She is married with six children, three of whom are still dependent on her for their needs. They are ages eight, twelve and eighteen.

Her husband drives a van to support the family, and for twelve years now, she has been selling frozen meat, fresh chicken, and processed food like Spanish sausages and hot dogs.

She is asking for a loan to buy more Spanish sausages and hot dogs to sell. Her income will be for her children's tuition fees, a healthy diet for her family, and house renovation.

In the future, Gina hopes to have a more established business so she can secure the future of her children through schooling.

loans.use: to buy more Spanish sausages and hot dogs.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is from Upper Dapitan City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 48 years of age. She and her partner have three school-age children. This year, 2014, she joined Paglaum MPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. From her desire to help the family, she is engaged in selling fish in different barangays in city of Dapitan, Zamboanga del Norte. Only her motorcycle is used as her source of transportation to reach the different barangays to sell fish. 

Her source of income has existed for two years now. In need of additional working capital, she has requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in an amount of PHP 45,000 to purchase more stock of fish. Through this, she hopes to increase her income so she is able to provide for the daily needs of her family.  She is happy she can support the education of her children, which is the main priority of her hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a plot of agricultural land

loans.name: Segundo Santos

texts.es:
Segundo Santos tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a su esposa y sus 02 hijos. El domicilio del cliente se ubica en el Caserío Granadillo, distrito de Querocotillo, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. La comunidad donde vive el Segundo Santos es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se dedican básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza el Segundo Santos es la de sembrar café variedad Catimor. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en mantenimiento del terreno cultivable, pues desea comprar abonos, fertilizantes entre otros para poder aseguar una campaña exitosa para el 2015, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Santos is 42 years old.  He lives in his own rustic house with his wife and their 2 children.  The client's home is in the Granadillo village, Querocotillo district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.  The community where Segundo Santos lives is a small rural area, where the inhabitants make their living in agriculture, ranching, and trade.

The activity that Segundo Santos engages in is planting the Catimor variety of coffee.  He will use the loan to invest in the upkeep of the arable land, in order to be able to ensure a successful season for 2015, which will allow him, in a short time, to improve his income, increase his earnings, and as a result, improve his quality of life and that of his family. More precisely, he wants to purchase fertilizer and manure to increase his harvest.

loans.use: to invest in the upkeep of arable land.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
His name is Ruel.  He is 34 years old and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines.  He is married to Myrna, a lady guard. They work to meet their everyday personal and household needs.

Ruel has operated a tricycle for a number of years already. His tricycle carries up to four passengers. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 a day. 

In the Philippines especially in the province of Dasmarinas, tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited . Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friends' homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. 

To help him continue his transport business, he is requesting an PHP 8,000 loan that he will use to pay for gas and maintenance of his tricycle. He is positive that this will boost his income. as tricycle transportation is really a necessity in their place.

Ruel dreams to have another tricycle unit to improve his income. He hopes to save and have kids someday and lead a happy family.  He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 47 years old, and married with seven children. With three children in school, Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. 

Nilda is taking out a bridge loan to restart her coconut wine vending business.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her coconut wine vending business.

She is using the new loan to stock up coconut wine to sell. 

Nilda is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, root crops, cooking oil, etc., for her food vending business.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 4 years. Luzviminda earns more income from buying and selling vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, root crops, cooking oil, etc., for her food vending business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is an adult married man with 4 children. Two of his children attend school. He deals in banana sales and works at this for 2 days a week and 6 hours a day.

He is also a farmer from which he gets an additional income to support his family. He has been in this business since 1998. He was motivated by the fact that it was his area of expertise. He mainly sells his goods to people in Ddwaniro Rakai district. He hopes to use the loan to boost the production of his plantations and to buy stocks of green bananas. This will fetch him more income because he has the clientèle.

His hopes and dreams are to be the leading supplier of bananas in Ddwaniro and surrounding areas. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations, limited capital and unfavourable weather conditions which affect his business.

He is described as an honest and hard-working man in business.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Chy's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Speu province, Chy is 30 years old and a mother of three children. She earns income to support her family's living condition via rice cropping. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 13,800 KHR per day.

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is the group leader.

She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine to support her living. She hopes that she can improve her family’s living in good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine to support her living.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie works hard to support her family. Benjie is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Benjie requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business.

Benjie has been in this business for eight years now.

Benjie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Jefferson Geovanny

texts.es: Geovanny es un joven de 19 años de edad, el vive con sus padres quienes se dedican  a la agricultura y ganadería y es de ahí que Geovanny aprendió a esta actividad, el se encuentra estudiando en un colegio semiprecencial solo los fines de semana, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una ternera para seguir en su negocio de crianza de ganado que empezó hace un año atrás, la aspiración de este joven trabajador es que le vaya muy bien en su negocio y asi pagar todo lo que gasta en su educación.
texts.en:
19-year old Geovanny lives in the countryside. He learned farming techniques through his parents, who are both farmers and also have cattle. He studies on weekends at a local community college.

Geovanny will use the loan to buy calves, to grow his husbandry business that he started a year ago. This young entrepreneur aspires to succeed in his business, to be able to meet his tuition costs.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Darsim

texts.en:
This is the story of Maskur, the son of Darsim:

'I come from a small family that can not afford a lot. I was born of parents who named the father Darsim and mother Sainah. I'm a child to one of three brothers. I want to go to school because I want my parents to be happy in the future, and I want to help all my brothers and my sister to be successful. 

My parents are farmers, and their income is uncertain. My father's monthly income is 1,000,000. However, such income is still not enough to pay for my school, and for my sister.'

loans.use: to pay his son's education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Nueva Luna De Igachi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUNA NUEVA DE IGACHI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, servicio de construcción, venta de queso, venta de ganado.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoria es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, pues desde niña apoyaba en el negocio familiar, ahora que tiene una familia independiente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo criara para poder comercializar la leche en las empresas distribuidoras. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y la atención de la institución ofrece.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Luna Nueva de Igachi" (New Moon of Igachi) will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional center of Copacabana. It is composed of nine members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Victoria is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Among them are: selling milk, construction service, selling cheese, and selling livestock.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of which Señora Victoria is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, entering at the invitation of a representative of the institution who came to visit her in her home. At this time she has a business of selling milk. She learned this business from her parents, since she helped in the family business when she was a little girl. Now that she has an independent family, she decided to begin her own business.

The loan that she will take out is to increase her capital to buy cattle, which she will acquire from the wholesale sellers in her community, and then she will raise them in order to be able to sell the milk to the distributing businesses. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she lives in free union and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the service that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Lago Sagrado Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAGO SAGRADO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cintya es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de papa, venta de pescado, tienda de barrio.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cintya es integrante, ella indica que es hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de pesca;cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, pues desde niña apoyaba en el negocio familiar, ahora que tiene una familia independiente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de red) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y la atención de la institución ofrece.
texts.en:
The "LAGO SAGRADO" communal association will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Achacachi. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board whose treasurer is Cintya. The businesses that the communal association's members carry out are varied and include: cheese sales, potato sales, fish sales and a neighborhood store. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small business owners of whom Cintya is one. She says that two years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a staff person from the institution who visited her in her home. Currently she has a fish business. She says that she learned this business from her parents since she supported the family business since she was a girl. Now that she has her own family, she decided to undertake her own business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital (to purchase a net) that she will get from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz and later will use it in her work space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family since she is married and has a child. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the attention the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama San Antonio, es un grupo muy unido con 17 integrantes, es un comité fortalecido y desde hace tiempo están trabajando  con el programa Comité de Mujeres Rurales, se encuentran  ya en el 6to ciclo, cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer.
La Sra. Sebastiana es quien cumple el rol de presidenta de este comité, es muy emprendedora y sus actividades se basan en el cultivo, cría de animales, El préstamo que pido lo quiere invertir en la construcción de un gallinero, ya que con ello podrá continuar con la cría de sus gallinas.
Así como la señora Sebastiana, sus demás compañeras demuestran entusiasmo e interés por seguir trabajando conjuntamente.
texts.en:
The committee named “San Antonio” is a close-knit group that consists of 17 members. This committee has gotten stronger as a result of working with the Committee Program for Rural Women for some time. The group is in its sixth loan cycle and all of the members are putting forth their best effort so that they can grow.

Sra. Sebastiana is fulfilling her role as president of the committee. She is an enterprising woman and her business activities focus on farming and raising animals. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the construction of a chicken coop. This would allow her to continue raising chickens.

Just like Sra. Sebastiana, the other group members demonstrate enthusiasm and interest by continuing to work together.

loans.use: to build a chicken coop for raising poultry.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé le 17 Mai 2007, et vient d’entamer son douzième cycle. Malgré les difficultés de la zone à maintenir une activité génératrice de revenues, ces membres sont d’une détermination assez solide et très courageux. Les membres sont solidaires entre eux et vivent dans le même village. L’activité principale est le petit commerce, accompagné de la culture sous pluie.

 Madame Ramatoulaye (assise à  droite avec la main gauche levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants uniquement des  filles. Son activité s’inscrit dans la vente de petit déjeuner. Pour se faire elle achète en quantité au marché communale afin de minimiser les frais de transport. Elle est très dynamique et jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 01 sac de sucre de 50 kg, 5 cartons de lait en poudre, 10 pots de café grand modèle et au moins 200 kg de niébé.

Les bénéfices lui serviront d’aider son mari dans la gestion quotidienne de la famille d’une part et d’autre part de conforter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created on May 17, 2007, and it has just started its 12th loan cycle. Despite the difficulties in the area in maintaining revenue-generating businesses, these members have a rather strong determination and are very courageous. The members have solidarity amongst themselves and live in the same village. Their main work involves small-scale commerce along with rainy season farming. 

Ms. Ramatoulaye (sitting at the right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 47 years old and a married mother of four children (just girls). Her business involves selling breakfasts. To do so, she purchases in quantity at the communal market in order to minimize transportation costs. She is very energetic and enjoys good experience in this domain. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase a 50-kg sack of sugar, 5 boxes of powdered milk, 10 large coffee pots, and at least 200 kg of black-eye peas.

The profits will be used to help out her husband in managing the family day to day, as well as to bolster her savings.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, powdered milk, coffee pots, and black-eye peas

loans.name: Moris Arnobio

texts.es: Moris de 28 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su madre y su abuela, a las que trata de apoyar en lo que puede con los gastos del hogar. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que a pesar de las adversidades no se deja vencer y desde hace 3 años se gana la vida como motorista de un vehículo de transporte de carga. Moris ha observado que el techo de su vivienda, se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que él ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito que le permita cambiar el techo de su vivienda para contar con mejores condiciones de vida, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, polines, pines y pagar mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Moris is 28 years old and lives in his own home with his mother and grandmother, who he supports as he can with the household expenses. He is a hard-working man who doesn't let adversity keep him down. For 3 years he has works as a driver for a cargo transport vehicle. Moris has noted that the roof of his home is deteriorating so he has made the decision to seek a loan that will permit him to change his home's roof in order to have better living conditions. So he seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in laminate, structural beams, pins and pay for labor to change the roof of his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in laminate, structural beams, pins and pay for labor to change the roof of his home.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 37-year-old married father of four children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, Saleh opened a small cafe shop inside the camp to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Saleh is trying desperately to develop his business; thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a new espresso machine which will facilitate his work and satisfy his customers' needs.

Saleh hopes to expand his business more in the future and open a bigger cafe shop to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new espresso machine.

loans.name: Luis Ignacio

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Trabajando Juntas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive el señor Luis,  tiene 22 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio.
Don Luis es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta ganar lo suyo y así forjarse un futuro para cuando le toque formar su familia, el tiene un deposito  en el cual vende  gas de uso doméstico y agua en bidón, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00 que cierra su local, son muchas las personas de la localidad y sitios vecinos que compran en su local el cual está ubicado donde paran muchos carros que se transportan lo cual le resulta muy conveniente ya que siempre les vende a ellos, lleva más de 5 años en este negocio con el cual se gana lo suficiente para ayudar a sus padres y ahorra para su futuro. 
Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar agua y  gas de uso doméstico. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que crezca su negocio.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the credit group Trabajando Juntas gather at the canton Rocafuerte. This place is known by its delicious candies made by the local people and are widely known around the country. 

In this place lives Luis of 22 years of age. He is single and lives with his parents. He has been for four cycles in the credit group and he likes it because the loans allow him to finance his business. 

Luis is a hardworking young man who likes to earn his own money and forge his future for when the time comes of having his own family. He has a store where he sells gas for domestic use and water in drums. He works everyday from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm when he closes his store. 

A lot of people from the town and nearby areas buy at his store, which is located in a place where lots of cars stop. This is very convenient for him since he always gets to sell them. He has had this business for over 5 years, and it gives him enough money to help his parents and save for the future. 

This loan will be used to buy water and gas for domestic use. His dream is to continue with his business and make it grow.

loans.use: to buy water and gas for domestic use.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 54 years old and married. She lives in Kalasan, Pagadian City. She is managing her corn farm to earn a living, and she is also engaged in a hog raising business. Demetria mastered doing this type of activity over twenty years.

She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in May of 2014. She is hardworking and has a strong determination to pursue her goals to sustain their family’s needs, alleviating poverty.

Demetria requested a loan to purchase fertilizers to increase crop yields on her corn farm, and also to buy bags of animal feed and vitamins. This will greatly help Demetria boost her income.

Someday, she hopes to buy a parcel of land to expand her farm and venture into the corn retailing business. Demetria is now supporting her two children in their college education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to increase crop yields on her corn farm, and also to buy bags of animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Delwende De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Madame ASSETA est la  représentante  du groupe DELWENDE DE ROLLO. Elle  se porte très bien. Mariée, elle n’a pas d’enfant. Elle a 07 personnes en charge.
Madame fait de l’élevage depuis 07 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier, ces clients sont les habitants des villes voisins. 
Elle veut  s’acheter  02 moutons.
Madame désire épargner ces bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. ASSETA is the representative of the group DELWENDE DE ROLLO. She is in good health. A married woman, she has no children. She has seven persons to support. Ms. ASSETA has been raising livestock for seven years. She gets her supplies from the market in her district. Her customers are the residents of neighboring towns. She wants to purchase 2 sheep. She would like to save her profits. Her ambition is to expand her business and to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and school supplies for the return to school next year.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés, de 56 años de edad, se casò muy joven y con su esposa procrearòn cuatro hijos y de ellos solo dos viven con él, los otros dos hijos ya se casaron, pero siempre estan al pendiente de las siembras agricolas de su padre.

Don Andres con esfuerzo y dedicacion a logrado sacar adelante a su familia, tiene varios años desempeñandose como albañil, gracias a su buen trabajo es muy reconocido y las personas que lo han contratado anteriormente se sienten satisfechas por su trabajo. En la época lluviosa aprovecha para sembrar granos bàsicos, los cuales almacena para los gastos del hogar y para la venta.-

Andrés, necesita el crèdito para reconstruir su casa, ya que tiene unas piezas de madera que ya no sirven y es necesario cambiarlas por su seguridad y la toda su familia.- En un futuro espera arreglar mas su vivienda y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Andrés is 56 years old. He married at a young age and he and his wife have 4 children, two of whom live with him and the other two are now married, but they are dependent on their father's crops.  Andres, with effort and dedication, has been able to support his family. He has worked as a bricklayer for several years. Due to his good work he is well-known and people who have contracted his services are very satisfied with his work. In the rainy season he wants to take advantage of basic grains, which he sells for his household expenses and for income. Andres needs a loan to reconstruct his house as he has some pieces of wood that are of no use and it is necessary to change them for his safety and that of his family. In the future he hopes to do more repairs on his home and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to reconstruct his house as he has some pieces of wood that are of no use and it is necessary to change them for his safety and that of his family.

loans.name: Voeurn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Kampong Speu province, Voeurn is 50 years old and a mother of eight children. For her family, she grows rice as the single main source of income. Now, she can earn income of about 13,800 KHR per day.

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle to be healthy.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Flor De Sopocachi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE SOPOCACHI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de papa, venta de pescado, tienda de barrio.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, pues desde niña apoyaba en el negocio familiar, posteriormente con un pequeño capital decide emprender un negocio independiente iniciando en pequeñas ferias de la cuidad de El Alto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de queso por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y la atención de la institución ofrece.
texts.en:
The Communal Association, "Flower of Sopocachi" will begin its first funding cycle with Pro Mujer as a part of the Achacachi Focal Center. This group is made up of 8 members and it is directed by a board where Julia is the President. The businesses that the Communal Association's members are managing are diverse. Among them there are: cheese sales, potato sales, fish sales and a neighborhood store. 

The loan that they will receive will benefit these small micro enterprises including the business of the member Julia. This is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer. She joined by invitation from a promoter of the group who came to visit her home. Currently, she has a business selling cheese. She told us that she learned this trade from her parents because ever since she was a child she supported her family's business. Later, with a small amount of capital, she decided to begin her own independent business, starting in the small fairs in the city of El Alto. 

The loan that she will receive shortly is to increase her capital--to purchase cheese via wholesale--that she will acquire from the established vendors in her community and later she will sell from her retail space. This form of work allows her to obtain resources to support her family now that she is married and has five children. When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the training and the attention that the institution provides.

loans.use: to purchase cheese via wholesale.

loans.name: Kantu De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Beatriz ella es casada y tiene 48 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio para vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ponches, negocio de carpintería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Kantu de San Jeronimo.” This bank is located in the Cusco district, which is part of the Cusco province in the Cusco region.

Beatriz is a member who is married, 48 years old, and has two children. She works as a primary school teacher. She works from 8:00 AM until 2:00 PM. She has been working in this business for 8 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a clothing sales business. She is requesting the loan to buy sound equipment for her house. 

The woman whose face is covered is no longer part of the communal bank Kantu de San Jeronimo. 

The other members make a living in businesses such as selling punch, carpentry, grocery stores, and the restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy women's sandals and clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANECER” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de helado, venta de ropa, venta de busos deportivos, venta de frutas, venta de verduras, venta de rellenos, venta de ropa.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de helados; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace veinte años, al observar que este producto era requerido por los pobladores de su comunidad.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de saborizantes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y la atención de la institución ofrece.
texts.en:
Amanecer Communal Bank will start its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Justina's the president.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including sales of ice cream, clothing, tracksuits, fruit, vegetables, and "relleno" [a traditional Bolivian dish].

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Justina. She said she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, having joined on the invitation of a loan officer who visited her at home. Currently she has a business selling ice cream. She started this business on her own initiative 20 years ago when she noticed the product was in demand among the residents of her community. 

Justina's loan is to increase her capital with a wholesale purchase of flavorings, which she'll buy from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz, then, sell in her sales stall after production. This job allows her to earn an income to support her family, because she's married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said the institution's trainings and its service.

loans.use: to buy flavorings wholesale

loans.name: Patron San Pedro De Cuyo Chico Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON SAN PEDRO DE CUYO CHICO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Casiana ella es soltera y tiene 55 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de ganadería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank 'Patrón San Pedro de Cuyo Chico'. This bank is located in the district of Calca, in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

One member, Casiana, is single, 55 years old, and has five children.  She works in her grocery store.  She sells staple products like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She works from 8:00 a.m to 7:00 p.m.  She already has 5 years in this business and it is going very well.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The other members are in the businesses of agriculture, livestock, grocery stores, and animal sales.

Casiana is grateful to Kiva lenders who help her pursue her dream and she agrees to comply with the payment of her fees by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUARAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Matilde se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra papa y maiz, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the “Huaraypata” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Quiquijana, which belongs to the province of Quispicanchi in the department of Cusco.

The borrower’s name is Matilde and she makes a living from agriculture. She has a plot of land where she sows potatoes and maize. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm. She has been in this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business. She is requesting the loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers.

She is happy to get the loan and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilisers

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry from Rizal, Nueva Ecija, is taking a Mechatronics course. The family’s source of income is through farming. Even though his father is earning, it is not enough for all their expenses. 

That’s why Jerry wants to seek a PHP 15,000 financial assistance loan from Kiva lenders to pay for his school expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Apolinar tiene 70 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en una ciudad con un clima cálido, Apolinar está dedicado a la agricultura, él cultiva café de la variedad catimor. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Ubicada en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Apolinar se dedica al cultivo de café, desde hace 20 años. El destino del crédito será para comprar abonos para su cultivo y para invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca. Dado que manteniendo sus fincas obtendrá mayores rendimientos. Apolinar posee conocimientos en el cultivo de café, por lo que se esperá que sea una cosecha existosa.
texts.en:
Apolinar, 70, lives alone in the community of El Limón. He lives with his wife and children, in a house is made of the rustic material typical of the area. His community--located in the district of Callacyuc in the province and region of Cajamarca in the northern highlands of Peru--works primarily in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

Apolinar works in agriculture growing the Catimor variety of coffee. He has grown coffee in El Limón for 20 years.

He's going to use the loan to buy soil amendments for his crop. He's also going to invest in taking care of his farm, which will result in a greater yield.

Apolinar knows coffee production, so he expects to have a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments for his crop and to invest in taking care of his farm

loans.name: Gladys Elena

texts.es:
Gladys, de 40 años, tiene gran experiencia en el área de la confección gracias a sus múltiples empleos en diferentes fabricas donde trabajaba como operaria de maquinas de confección.

Hoy en día es una mujer independiente y gana sus propios ingresos a través de la confección a terceros y una pequeña línea propia.

Es una mujer muy emprendedora y su motivación más grande para trabajar son sus hijos quienes en algunas ocasiones le ayudan en su negocio.

Ella tiene muchos proyectos los cuales desea cumplir en la medida de lo posible, pero para eso necesita la ayuda de un auxilio económico el cual le permitirá inyectarle capital a su negocio a través de la compra de algunos insumos de trabajo como tela, agujas, entre otros.

Con este préstamo ella podrá mantener su actividad vigente y seguirá ofreciendo empleo a las 6 personas del sector que tiene contratadas.(Ver en la foto a dos de sus empleadas)

Con el apoyo de un préstamo y con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar, el taller de Gladys podrá prosperar.
texts.en:
Gladys, age 40, has extensive sewing experience thanks to the multiple jobs as a sewing machine operator that she had held at various factories.  Today she is an independent woman who earns her own income by fulfilling third-party sewing contracts and producing her small line of products.

Gladys is a very enterprising woman.  Her greatest motivation for working comes from her children, who occasionally help out in her business.

Gladys has many projects that she wants to complete as soon as possible, but she needs financial help in order to inject capital into her business. She needs to buy a few supplies for her work such as fabric, needles, and other items.  With this loan, Gladys will be able to maintain an active business and continue employing the six people from the area that she has hired (some of which are pictured with her).

With the support of this loan and the assistance from Interactuar, Gladys’ workshop will be able to prosper.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, and other supplies for her work.

loans.name: Jose Aldivier

texts.es:
Jose es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo de papa y lechuga; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Marinilla.
