Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes y la compra de semillas de papa.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
José's a modest and hardworking farmworker with the drive and tenacity typical of rural men and women.  He's a man with an entrepreneurial mindset who learned at a very young age all the farm tasks like crops and raising animals--so much so that he currently has his own potato and lettuce crops. He sells the food in the market plaza in a nearby town.

José's goal is to expand his crops and improve the ones he currently has, so he's requesting the help of a loan to buy potato seeds and agricultural inputs such as fertilizer.

The loan will allow José to make progress as an entrepreneur and as a person, as well to increase his income and keep on contributing to the support of his household. The only thing he wants is to be able to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and agricultural inputs such as fertilizer

loans.name: Pegwende De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Madame  MARIAM est la  représentante  du groupe PEGDWENDE DE ROLLO. Elle  se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé à 22 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Madame fait de l’élevage depuis 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier, ces clients sont les habitants des quartiers. 
Elle veut  s’acheter  02 moutons.
Madame désire épargner ces bénéfices et réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. MARIAM is the representative of the group PEGDWENDE DE ROLLO. She is in good health. A married woman, she has five children. The oldest is 22 years old, and the youngest is 4. Three go to school. She has six persons to support. Ms. MARIAM has been raising livestock for ten years. She gets her supplies from the market in her district. Her customers are the residents of neighboring towns. She wants to purchase 2 sheep. She would like to save her profits and reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to expand her business and to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, sets of cutlery, and sets of plates. She will also buy some ingredients for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Wendkuni De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Madame  ZOENABO est la  représentante  du groupe WENDKUNI DE ROLLO. Elle  se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 33 ans et le moins âgé a 09 ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.
Madame fait de l’élevage depuis 07 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier, ces clients sont les habitants des villes voisins. 
Elle veut  s’acheter  02 moutons.
Madame désire épargner ces bénéfices pour scolariser ses enfants. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en: Ms. ZOENABO is the representative of the group WENDKUNI DE ROLLO. She is in good health. A married woman, she has four children. The oldest is 33 years old, and the youngest is 9. Three go to school. She has three persons to support. Ms. ZOENABO has been raising livestock for seven years. She gets her supplies from the market in her district. Her customers are the residents of neighboring towns. She wants to purchase 2 sheep. She would like to save her profits to provide education for her children. Her ambition is to expand her business and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sheep

loans.name: Teegwende De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Madame NERWAYA ZOENABO est la  représentante  du groupe TEEGWENDE DE ROLLO. Elle  se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé à 24 ans et le moins âgé a 17 ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Madame fait de l’élevage depuis 19 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier, ces clients sont les habitants des villes voisins. 
Elle veut  s’acheter  02 moutons.
Madame désire épargner ces bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. NERWAYA ZOENABO is the representative of the group TEEGWENDE DE ROLLO. She is in good health. A married woman, she has five children. The oldest is 24 years old, and the youngest is 17. Two go to school. She has six persons to support. Ms. NERWAYA ZOENABO has been raising livestock for 19 years. She gets her supplies from the market in her district. Her customers are the residents of neighboring towns. She wants to purchase 2 sheep. She would like to save her profits. Her ambition is to expand her business and to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sheep

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en: A local resident from Kampong Speu province, Vannak is 24 years old and the mother of two children. To support her family, she grows rice as her main source of income. She can earn an income of about 20,000 KHR per day. This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She leads a group of two to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions and good health.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Corapata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAPATA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Natividad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, servicio de construcción, venta de queso, venta de ganado.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Natividad es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso y leche; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, pues desde niña apoyaba en el negocio familiar, ahora que tiene una familia independiente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de moldes y canastas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo implementará es su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y la atención de la institución ofrece.
texts.en:
Corapata Communal Bank will start its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Natividad is the president.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including milk sales, construction services, cheese sales, and livestock sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Natividad.  She said she has belonged to Pro Mujer for three years, having joined on the invitation of a loan officer who visited her at home.  Currently she has a business selling cheese and milk.  She said she learned this business from her parents, because she used to help in the family business when she was a little girl.  She decided to start her own business now that she has her own family.

Natividad's loan will be to increase her capital with a wholesale purchase of molds and baskets, which she'll get from wholesale vendors in her community  and later use in her sales stall.  This job allows her to earn income to support her family, because she's married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the institution's trainings and service.

loans.use: to buy molds and baskets wholesale

loans.name: Cecilia Esperanza

texts.es:
En el sitio El Limón de la  parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Grupo De  Crédito El Limón.
En este lugar vive la señora Cecilia, tiene 44 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 27 y 14 años de edad, una estudia en universidad y es quien aun vive en su casa.
Doña Cecilia trabaja de enfermera en una clínica particular de la ciudad pero también se dedica a la comercio, vende zapatillas y su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, ella sale a realizar sus recorridos los sábados y domingos y también les vende a sus compañeras de trabajo, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días, lleva más de 2 años dedicada esta actividad la cual le da ganancias extra que le ayudan a salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos y zapatillas. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The El Limón Credit Group meets twice a month in the El Limón section of Colon Parish in the city of Portoviejo. People in this area have a reputation as hardworking farmers and ranchers. El Limón is also the home of Doña Cecilia, a 44-year-old divorced mother of two children, ages 27 and 14. The older child is a university student and the  younger one still lives at home. Doña Cecilia is pleased with the loans that she's obtained through the El Limón group before, as they've helped her business. 

Doña Cecilia works as a nurse in a private clinic in Portoviejo, but also sells shoes to customers door to door on weekends as well as to some of her colleagues at the clinic. She enjoys working at both her job and her business so that she can meet her household expenses. She sells on credit and collects payment after one or two weeks. Doña Cecilia has sold shoes for over two years, earning extra income that helps improve her finances. 

Doña Cecilia will use the funds from this loan to purchase footwear, and hopes one day to open her own store.

loans.use: to purchase footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: corn, chicken, lime, tomatoes, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jesus Roberto

texts.es:
Jesús de 44 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos de 25, 20, 18 y 16 años de edad, solo tres viven con él y uno está estudiando. Él estudió hasta 8° grado de educación básica,  su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

Jesús es agricultor, aprendió trabajando con su padre desde muy pequeño en dicha actividad le apoyan sus hijos mayores, además presta servicios de molienda, en su casa tiene un molino de nixtamal del que se encarga su pareja. No tiene un horario fijo de trabajo, pero sale de su casa a trabajar en su parcela a las 5:00 am.

Solicita el préstamo para cubrir los gastos de cosecha, su sueño es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y trabajar para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús is 44 years old, lives in a partnership and has four children, aged 25, 20, 28 and 16, of whom three live with him and  one is studying. Jesús went to school until the 8th grade of elementary schooling. His wife is a homemaker and only she and his sons live with him.

Jesús is a farmer, who learned all necessary activities from his father at a very young age. His eldest sons support him. Furthermore he offers the services of a nixtamal [tortilla flour] mill, which is in his possession. His wife is in charge of it at their home.

Jesús does not have fixed working hours but he leaves home to work his land at 5am.

He is asking for the loan to cover harvesting costs. Jesús dreams that his children will finish their education and that he can work to support his family.

loans.use: to cover harvesting costs.

loans.name: Nohemi Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Nohemí de 45 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos estudiando, ella estudió hasta bachillerato y es muy conocida en su comunidad, su pareja es agricultor de granos básicos y también trabaja como albañil, solo él y sus hijos viven con ella.

Nohemí es comerciante, aprendió con su madre desde muy pequeña y le gustó mucho cocinar, hoy en día tiene un puesto en el mercado local en el que vende pupusas y que la ayuda su hija. Solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, repollo, vinagre condimentos y demás para su negocio. 

Nohemí, tiene pensado reemplazar su cocina de plancha y comprar mesas más mesas para atender más personas.
texts.en:
Nohemi is 45 years old, lives with her common law husband, and has three children. She studied through high school and is well known in her community. Her life's partner is a farmer who grows basic grains and, also, works as a bricklayer. Only he and their children live with Nohemi.

Nohemi is a merchant. She learned from her mother from the time she was very small and she loves to cook. Today, she has her own post in the local market from which she sells 'pupusas' (a favorite Salvadoran snack). Her daughter helps her. Nohemi is requesting the loan to purchase corn to make tortillas stuffed with cream cheese, plus sausage, cabbage, vinegar, condiments and other inputs for her business.

Nohemi is thinking of replacing her iron-plate kitchen, and of buying more tables to accommodate additional customers.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas with cream cheese filling, and sausage, cabbage, vinegar, condiments, and other food supplies for her business.

loans.name: Painem

texts.en:
This is the story of Krisnia, daughter of Painem:

I was the fourth of four children; I live only with my mother because my father is long dead, because of illness.

My mother did not work; she just takes care of the household and cares for her grandson. Meanwhile, to meet the daily needs I was assisted by my brother who works. But I still lack money for my school fees.  My concern is that I can not finish school because my mothers economic conditions which are minimal.

So a little story about my family life. Thank you for your attention and hopefully this Kiva loan will be very helpful in resolving my school.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Speu Province, Long is 40 years old, and a mother of four children. To support her family, she earns income via rice cropping and it earns her about 20,000 KHR per day. 

This is Long's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of five members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that her family can live in healthier home than before.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for her family.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
Yola es una mujer de 31 años de edad, casada, tiene 6 hijos de 13, 10, 8, 6, 3 y 1 años, y su negocio es la venta de charque (carne deshidratada) y la venta de leche.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, paciente, responsable, emprendedora,  constante y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad de ‘Copancara’ ubicada a orillas del lago sagrado Titicaca, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura entre 2-12 grados centígrados que varía en el día durante todo el año.
Yola es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymara y habla español. Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y sus 6 hijos; los 4 mayores estudian en la escuela, los 2 menores todavía se encuentran al cuidado de su madre, viven en una casa construida de adobe, que cuenta con electricidad. Su negocio es la venta de charque (carne deshidratada); que es básicamente la carne, ya sea de llama o de res, que ha pasado por un proceso de deshidratación expuesta al sol por varios días cubierta de sal (Se trata de una receta ancestral), también tiene otra actividad relacionada que es la lechería, ella ordeña a su ganado para venderle la leche a los productores queseros de la zona. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de ganado vacuno para producir mayor cantidad de leche. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Yola solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno para producir mayor cantidad de leche.
texts.en:
Yola is a 31 year old mother to 6 children, aged 13, 10, 8, 6, 3 and 1 years old, who runs a business selling jerky (dried meat) and milk. She is a good mother: optimistic, patient, responsible, entrepreneurial, consistent and hardworking. She carries out her business in the 'Copancara' community, located on the banks of the sacred lake Titicaca where the climate is cold and dry, with a temperature of around 2-12 centigrade that varies daily throughout the year. 

Yola is of dark complexion with long, black hair which she wears in plaits. She is shorter in stature and she wears traditional dress (hat, shawl and full skirt). Her native language is Aymara and she also speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband who is a farmer and their 6 children: the eldest 4 attend school and the 2 youngest are still in their mother's care and they live together in an adobe house which has electricity. 

She makes jerky either llamas meat or beef, which has been covered in salt and left to dry out in the sun (this is an ancestral recipe). The milk she sells comes from her cattle, and she sells it to cheese producers in the area. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's quality of life and to invest further in her business by buying more cattle. This will be her first loan with the institution in the 10 years that she has been running this business. For the reasons mentioned above, Yola is applying for this loan so that she can buy more livestock and increase her production of milk.

loans.use: to buy cattle livestock in order to produce more milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in chocolate, vegetables, eggs, spices, meat, etc.

loans.name: Israel De Jesus

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad, el posee un negocio de enderezado y pintura ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus trabajos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz, aceites, y demás herramientas para seguir con su trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The young man's face has been pixelated because he is 24 years old. He has a paint and body work business located in his place of residency. He is able to cover some household expenses with what he makes from his work. The young man lives in his own house with his wife and two children.

He is requesting a loan to buy paint, varnish, oils, and other tools to continue with his work and in that way make a better profit to give his family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy paint, varnish, oils, and other tools.

loans.name: Clorinda Yaneth

texts.es:
La sonrisa de Clorinda, refleja lo feliz que se siente porque su negocio de venta de ropa usada va creciendo cada día más con paso firme. Esta mujer de 50 años de edad, cuenta con gran entusiasmo lo agradecida que está con las personas que la apoyaron económicamente en el préstamo anterior, ya que con este pudo comprar ropa y zapatos deportivos de segunda mano. Este crédito le permitió aumentar sus ventas y tener mayores ingresos.
Clorinda al ver el resultado de su primer préstamo, está optando por uno nuevo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Con este segundo crédito quiere comprar más ropa usada y bisutería de acero, esto le permitirá seguir creciendo profesionalmente y ofrecer productos nuevos a sus clientes. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, lo que la ha mantenido en pie. Más adelante ella considera alquilar un local y vender ropa nueva en ese nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
The smile of Clorinda reflects the happiness that she feels because her business of selling used clothing is growing steadily, more every day. This woman of 50 relates with great enthusiasm how very grateful she is to the people who supported her economically with her previous loan, since with this she was able to buy clothing and sports shoes secondhand. This loan will allow her to increase her sales and have greater income. 

Clorinda, on seeing the results of her first loan, is opting for a new one to continue investing in her business. With this second loan she wants to buy more used clothing and steel jewelry. This will allow her to continue growing professionally and offer new products to her customers. She has the support of her children, which has kept her on track. In the future, she is thinking of renting a shop and selling new clothing in this new business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing and steel jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water tank truck for delivery.

loans.name: Jenny Lucia

texts.es: Lucia se separo de su esposo, tiene 28 años de edad, sus 2 hijas tiene  4 y 8 años y se encuentran estudiando, Lucia trabaja de costurera y también vende ropa, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra ropa para ofrecer a sus vecinas y clientas o puerta a puerta, la aspiración de Lucia es mejorar sus ventas y seguir trabajando para el bienestar de sus hijas.
texts.en: Lucia separated from her husband. She is 28 years old, her two daughters are 8 and 4 years old and are school-going.  Lucia works as a seamstress and also sells clothing. The loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing to offer to her neighbors and customers or door-to-door. Lucia's goal is to improve her sales and continue working for the well-being of her daughters.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.en:
Augusto lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. He is dedicated to agriculture (African Palm). Aged 32, he is unmarried. It is clear that Augusto works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. He hopes that with the solar energy system, improve the living conditions.

Augusto is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge his cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Acenaida

texts.en:
Acenaida lives in a community in the Department of Atlántida Honduras. She is dedicated to agriculture and livestock. Aged 51, she is widow and has two children. It is clear that Acenaida works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She hopes that with the solar energy system, her children will be able to continue studying and improve the living conditions.

Acenaida is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from SOLUZ Honduras, that will permit to have a better lighting, charge her cell phones, and saving in traditional energy expenditure.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow her to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Wilibardo

texts.en:
Wilibardo is a 36 year old Popoluca farmer. He owns a butcher shop in Soteapan. With the support of a NGO, he obtained the technical expertise and built the necessary infrastructure to develop a silvopasture system in his farm. With a loan from El Buen Socio, last year he bought 15 calves to fatten them in his farm and sell them in his butcher shop directly. With the earnings from his first loan he opened a second butcher shop in Soteapan. 

Wilbardo is now asking for a second loan to buy 10 dairy cows, to produce milk and his own calves. His wife will help him with the milking of the cows and he will be responsible for the feeding of the cows and the calves.

With this loan, Wilibardo and his wife will improve their living conditions, while contributing to the conservation of an area of high environmental value and thus setting the example for other families that sustainable practices can also be profitable.

loans.use: to purchase 10 cows to produce milk and meat he will sell at his butcher shop .

loans.name: Coralia Del Carmen

texts.es: Coralia de 48 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida desde hace 15 años, por lo que se siente satisfecha de tener un lugar propio donde vivir. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo una gran variedad de prendas de vestir en el mercado municipal y por las tardes vende platillos típicos en su vivienda, obteniendo de esta manera mejores ingresos. Coralia desea mejorar el corredor de su vivienda, ya que el techo de este se encuentra deteriorado, además desea construirle paredes para darle una mayor privacidad, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, polines y lámina para cambiar el techo y construir paredes al corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: Coralia is 48 years old. She has lived in her own house together with her domestic partner for 15 years, and she feels happy to have her own place where to live. She is an enterprising woman who earns her life by selling clothing items at the Municipal market, and in the afternoons she sells typical dishes in her house, earning more income this way. Coralia wants to improve the hallway of her house, since the roof is damaged. Also she wants to build walls to have more privacy. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, beams and construction sheets to change the roof and to build walls in the hallway of her house.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, beams and construction sheets to change the roof and to build walls in the hallway of her house.

loans.name: Dúo Gladiolas Group

texts.es: Dúo Gladiolas La señora Hermelinda es la encargada de este grupo, es tejedora y vendedora ambulante de güipiles típicos, fajas, servilletas, algunos delantales típicos y tiene un puesto de ropa de tela variada de niños y blusas típicas nuevas y usadas en el mercado del pueblo.  Su esposo quien es confeccionista la apoya en todo y sus hijos ya adolecentes siempre están a su lado ayudándola para que ella alcance su sueño de ser reconocida como la mejor tejedora de güipiles típico.  Tiene algunos pedidos de güipiles pero los hilos que utiliza no le alcanzan, por eso necesita pedir un préstamo para comprar los hilos que le hacen falta y tener variedad en colores y calidad que es así como el cliente paga, por la calidad de tejido.
texts.en: The woman in charge of Dúo Gladiolas is Hermelinda. She is a weaver and street vendor of traditional clothing, sashes, napkins, and other decorative items. She has a clothing stand with items for children and traditional new and used blouses in the city market. Her husband is a tailor and support her. Their children are teenagers and help her with her work so that she can achieve her dream of being known as the best weaver of traditional clothing. She has some orders for items but she doesn't have enough thread. Therefore she seeks a loan to buy the thread she needs and have a variety of colors and qualities to produce what the customer orders in the quality of the weaving.

loans.use: to buy materials to make traditional weavings to sell.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
She hails from Ormoc City, Leyte. Marisol is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman with two children ages 13 and 16 years old. She engages in the hog raising business. She raises and sells hogs. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for 12 years now. To augment her income, Marisol also sells balut (a food in the Philippines consisting of duck eggs incubated almost to the point of hatching and then boiled).

Marisol is asking for a loan of 27,000 PHP to buy additional piglets, pig feed and additional capital to purchase more balut. This will help Marisol sell more balut and improve her method of raising hogs. In the long run, she could save some of the profit so that she could have her own capital to run her current livelihood.

Marisol is hoping that she could manage both her businesses successfully to provide for the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, pig feed and additional capital to purchase more balut.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en: Sary, 55, is the mother of three children living in Kampong Speu province. She earns income to update her lifestyle via rice cropping. She has been involved in her business for ages and earns about 20,000 KHR per day. For Sary, this is her first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to drink and lives in good health.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 61 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Dolores has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to work with it as a driver.

loans.name: Aristides Bladimir

texts.es: Arístides es un hombre emprendedor que cuenta con 25 años de vida y habita en vivienda propia junto a su padre y su madre desde hace 25 años. Él es un hombre que se esfuerza por salir adelante apoyando también a sus padres gracias a su trabajo de atención al cliente en una empresa cercana. Arístides desea encementar el piso del corredor, ya que este es de tierra, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para encementar el piso del corredor y así mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de sus padres.
texts.en:
Arístides is a 25 year old entrepreneur who lives in his own home with his father and mother. He is a man who strives to succeed while also supporting his parents through his work in customer service at a company close by.

Arístides is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and labor for setting in a concrete floor on the existing ground in the corridor, thereby improving the quality of life for him and his parents.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel and labor to set a concrete floor in the corridor.

loans.name: Shohsanam

texts.en: Shohsanam lives with her husband and four children. Her husband is a builder. Shohsanam and her husband always work for the well-being of their children. Shohsanam has her own business deal. She has been busy buying and selling children's clothes in a local market. She has her own store. She renews the assortment of her goods three times a month. Shohsanam must buy coal and wood to keep her house warm in the winter season but she doesn't have money. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy coal and wood for the winter season.

loans.name: Neerwaya De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Madame MAMOUNATA est la  représentante  du groupe NEERWAYA DE ROLLO. Elle  se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 09 enfants. Le plus âgé à 48 ans et le moins âgé a 16 ans. 01 va  à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Madame fait de l’élevage depuis 06 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier, ces clients sont les habitants des  villes voisins. 
Elle veut  s’acheter  02 moutons.
Madame désire épargner ces bénéfices pour réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. MAMOUNATA is the representative of the group NEERWAYA DE ROLLO. She is in good health. A married woman, she is the mother of nine children. The oldest is 48 years old, and the youngest is 16. One goes to school. She has six persons to support. Ms. MAMOUNATA has been raising livestock for six years. She gets her supplies from the market in her district. Her customers are the residents of neighboring towns. She wants to purchase 2 sheep. She would like to save her profits and reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to expand her business and to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sheep

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in the village Ddmashen of the Gegharkunik region. Susanna lives with her three children; her eldest daughter is 22 years old and she works as a teacher at the school. Her other two daughters are still school-aged. Susanna has a vocational education with the specialty of accounting. 

For several years, Susanna worked at the kindergarten, but now she is engaged in farming and agriculture. Since Susanna’s husband now is in the Russian Federation, and he works there, Susanna runs the farming and agriculture business alone. On her farm, she takes care of two cows, two bulls, two pigs, eight sheep and thirty chickens. As she describes, she has a lot of loyal customers to whom she sells her farm milk, meat and eggs. With the coming of New Year’s holidays, she manages to sell a lot of meat with a rather good income for her family. 

Susanna asks for this loan in order to buy one more cow for her farm, and a lot of fodder (which every cattle farmer greatly needs during the coming cold season) for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for her farm and a lot of fodder for her all farm cattle

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo es soltero y vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus padres Gustavo es de las personas que estudia y trabaja, su ocupación esta en un bufete de abogados y afortunadamente el cliente no corre peligros ni otros riesgos a comparación de otras personas Aún así Gustavo necesita con urgencia un credito para pagar sus pensiones universitarias. En la casa recibe ayuda de la madre (el padre acaba de perder su empleo) y eso no es suficiente pues la familia tiene gastos pero al menos Gustavo goza de buena salud y espera que le ayuden
texts.en: Gustavo is single and lives with his parents in La Paz, in a house made of bricks and cement that belongs to his parents. Gustavo is a person who works and studies, and has a job at a law firm. Fortunately, he is not exposed to dangers or risks, especially relative to other people. Still, Gustavo urgently needs a loan to pay his university tuition. At home, he receives help from his mother (his father recently lost his job), but this is not enough to cover his family's expenses. At least Gustavo enjoys good health, and he hopes to receive help.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Assy Group

texts.fr: ASSY est un groupement d’intérêt économique mixte qui est composé de 5 personnes. Ils habitent dans le même quartier et pratiquent les mêmes activités. Ils se rencontrent pour organiser des tontines mensuelles. Leur présidente s’appelle Aïchatou Henriette. C’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans l’aviculture. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des poussins et de l’aliment pour faire de l’aviculture. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a une parente bénéficiaire dans l’institution. A l’avenir elle souhaite avoir une ferme et gagner le monopole du marché dans la vente des poulets. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et  élargir le nombre de ses employés et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
ASSY is a mixed economic interest group composed of five persons. They live in the same district and have the same work. They met one another to organize their monthly tontines. Their president is named Aïchatou Henriette. She is the one in the photo with a hand raised. She is a married mother and works in poultry farming. She has over five years of experience in this business and is requesting this sum of money to purchase some chicks and feed for poultry farming. Her day starts at 9 AM and ends at 7 PM.  

She helps out her husband in managing day-to-day expenses and the children’s schooling costs. She has a relative benefiting from the microfinance institution. 

For the future, she would like to have a farm and earn a monopoly on the market selling hens. Thus, she will be able to increase her revenues and expand the number of her employees, as well as to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and feed for poultry farming

loans.name: Pakresaya De Rollo Group

texts.fr:
Madame ASSATA est la  représentante  du groupe PAKRESAYA DE ROLLO. Elle  se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé à 30 ans et le moins âgé a 10 ans. 03 vont à l’école. 
Madame fait de l’élevage depuis 07 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier, ces clients sont les habitants des villes environnantes. 
Elle veut  s’acheter  02 moutons.
Madame désire épargner pour la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. ASSATA is the representative of the group PAKRESAYA DE ROLLO. She is in good health. A married woman, she is the mother of six children. The oldest is 30 years old, and the youngest is 10. Three go to school. Ms. ASSATA has been raising livestock for seven years. She gets her supplies from the market in her district. Her customers are the residents of neighboring towns. She wants to purchase 2 sheep. She would like to save her profits to provide schooling to her children. Her ambition is to expand her business and to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sheep

loans.name: Angelica Marìa

texts.es:
Angélica, de 40 años de edad, vive actualmente con su hijo de 16 años de edad; el estudia en la escuela del cantòn.- Angélica, actualmente se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, también tiene su negocio de venta de minutas y bocadillos típicos, para generar ingresos en su núcleo familiar.

Angélica, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de minutas, ella sale con su carretón a distintos lugares dentro del cantòn donde vive, como en la cancha de futbol, en la iglesia y en la escuela. También en las tardes vende bocadillos típicos como pasteles de papà, yuca frita y otros, para generar ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor alimentación.

Ella sueña en un futuro poder obtener un lugar màs adecuado para poder vender sus productos y así ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes.


Angèlica, planèa utilizar el préstamo para comprar un carretón nuevo, lo demás lo invertirá en comprar papas, arina, repollo, miel de frutas, hielo, entre otros.
texts.en: Angelica is 40 years old. She currently lives with her 16 year old son, who is studying at the canton's school. Currently, Angelica takes care of household chores, and she also has the business of selling shaved ice snacks and typical snacks in order to generate income for her family. Angelica has worked selling shaved ice snacks for 5 years. She goes out with her cart to different places within the canton where she lives, such as to the soccer fields, the church and the school. In the afternoons she also sells typical snacks such as potato pies, fried cassava, and others in order to earn income and give her family better food. She dreams to be able to have a more adequate place to sell her products in the future, and in this way offer more variety to her customers. Angelica plans to use the loan to buy a new cart. She will invest the rest in buying potatoes, flour, cabbage, fruit honey, ice, among other things.

loans.use: to buy a new cart; and with the rest to buy potatoes, flour, cabbage, fruit honey, ice, among other things.

loans.name: Sarik

texts.en:
Sarik is a 45-year-old married farmer with four children who lives in Takeo province of Cambodia. She has cultivated rice and fattened animals since 1990. Her husband is 51 years old and he is a house builder. Two of the children are garment workers. Together, they can earn approximately $18 a day. 

Currently, she has been building a house. Because she is lacking finances to buy cement, bricks, and steel, she decided to secure a loan. This loan will provide her and her family with a proper house for living. In the future, she wants her children have a tailoring shop at home.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and steel

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Jovia. She lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills carpeted in manicured maize plantations. 

Jovia is a mother of six children and she has been in the agriculture business for ten years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and maize. Jovia has been relying on agriculture to make all her income. However, rising costs of farming inputs, such as fertilizers and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. 

Despite these tough conditions, Jovia remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. Jovia is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run, and the demand for chicken products is always high. 

With this loan, Jovia will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. An increase in income for her is timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields. 

This loan will support Jovia’s economic activity, and will change her family’s living standards indirectly.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Habibajon

texts.en:
Habibajon is divorced. She is the only provider for her children. 

Habibajon began her business after her divorce because she needed to make money to provide for her children. Her former husband didn’t help her with providing for the children. 

She at first has sold food items, than she changed her business. Now, she sells bedclothes. She develops the business little by little and maximizes business. 

Habibajon is going to increase working capital. She is asking for a loan to buy bedclothes for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy bedclothes to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 53-year-old mother of three who lives in the Kitale area which is located in the Rift valley province of Kenya. She has farmed for five years and earns an honest and decent income. 

She has both crops and a dairy farm and has a small business to make ends meet. Although she has been making profits, life has not been easy for Beatrice. However, she has managed to overcome every challenge she faces. 

Beatrice seeks a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to venture into horticulture farming. Her location is favorable to other types of farming due to the good road network, climate, and market demand. Beatrice and her family will work very hard to take good care of their investment in horticulture, in which they put their hopes for a better life. 

She is disciplined regarding finances and she plans to enter international markets to earn more income and a obtain a stable future for her family.

loans.use: To venture into horticulture farming.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new tires and more ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more buffaloes for his dairy farm business

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en:
Emilly is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Emilly has a restaurant business and has been in this business for nine years. She operates her business from home six days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

Emilly has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, beans, ground nuts and cooking utensils. 

Emilly aspires to buy a plot of land on which she can build her own house.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, cooking oil, beans, peas, and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, sugar, a leavening agent, and  flavoring

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her son who pursues the bachelor’s degree majoring in Agriculture.

loans.name: Dominga Magdalena

texts.es:
Uno de los negocios característicos de Suchitepéquez es la crianza de animales de todo tipo. Desde hace 4 años, Dominga de 20 años, quien vive en Suchitepéquez, se dedica a la crianza de pollos, negocio que genera una satisfactoria ganancia para poder superar en la vida y tener un futuro mejor.

La  actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo todos los días es la crianza de pollos en la comunidad donde ella vive, ella viene realizando dicha actividad durante 4 años dicho negocio le deja muy buena ganancia para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y la de ella.

Hace una solicitud de préstamo para la compra de más pollos y los insumos como el concentrado que necesita para la crianza de pollos para luego venderlas por los alrededores de la comunidad y pueblos vecinas e así obtener recursos económicos para el sustento de su familia.

Son sus metas para generar más ingresos y el sostenimiento de su familia como el desarrollo de su comunidad donde ella vive para que todos tengan las condiciones de vidas adecuadas.
texts.en:
One of the characteristic businesses of Suchitepéquez is raising animals of all types. For four years, Dominga, who is 20 years old and lives in Suchitepéquez, has been raising chickens, a business that generates satisfactory earnings for her so that she can achieve in life and have a better future.

The activity that she carries out with such effort every day is the raising of chickens in the community where she lives. She has been doing this work for four years. This business gives her very good earnings to improve the living conditions of her family and herself.

She is applying for a loan to purchase more chickens and the supplies, such as concentrated feed, that she needs to raise the chickens to then sell them through the outskirts of the community and neighboring towns and thus obtain economic resources to sustain her family.

Her goals are to generate more income and sustain her family, as well as the development of her community where she lives, so that everyone has suitable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chickens and supplies.

loans.name: Ilusión Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad rodeada por cañales, cerca del cerro donde la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a trabajar en el campo sembrando caña o maíz, se formó un conjunto de 13 personas llamado Ilusión para poder solicitar un préstamo a VisionFund. El nombre del grupo surgió a raíz de la ilusión que cada uno de los integrantes tiene de que su actividad económica rinda buenos frutos.

Los integrantes son:

Mayra y Aaron -Venta de abarrotes
Blanca -Venta de pan
Silvia -Servicio de molino
Ángel - Venta de carne de pollo
Elvira -Venta de carne de cerdo
Yasmin -Venta de cosméticos
Jacinta, Carmela -Venta de comida
Carolina - Venta de pan
Sara -Venta de productos para el hogar
Nicolasa -Venta de productos para el hogar
Luz - Venta de masa y maíz

El señor Aaron  está casado con Clara y tienen una hija de 2 años quien da alegría a su hogar, él se ha dedicado desde hace 10 años a la venta de abarrotes. La pequeña tienda lleva funcionando 35 años, la madre de Aaron fue quien la comenzó justo un año antes de que él naciera. Las ganancias obtenidas les dieron a los padres de Aaron la posibilidad de ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Actualmente el negocio permanece abierto de lunes a domingo hasta las 8 de la noche y si algún cliente llega a buscar leche, agua, café, azúcar o cualquier otro producto, Aaron lo atiende sin problema alguno. 

En temporada de zafra (corte de caña) Clara se encarga de la tienda mientras que Aaron se decida acarrear caña al ingenio (fábrica azucarera) y debe estar al pendiente de la quema, corte y siembra de la caña.

Don Aaron utiliza las ganancias y las inversiones como el préstamo para comprar más mercancía: arroz, frijol, sopa, azúcar, café, leche, harina, cal, chiles enlatados, queso, jamón, salchichas, refrescos, etc. De igual manera, ha podido remodelar el local donde tiene el negocio y que aún espera poder expandir pensando en el futuro de su familia; a Aaron le encantaría que el negocio pasara a manos de su pequeña en un futuro.
texts.en:
In a community surrounded by sugar cane fields, near the mountain where most of the residents work in the fields cultivating sugar cane or corn, a communal bank named "Ilusion" (Hope) was formed by 13 people.  They came together to request a loan from VisionFund.  The name of the group reflects the hope that each of the members have, that their economic activity will pay off well. 

The members of the group are: 

Mayra and Aaron - grocery sales
Blanca  - bread sales
Silvia - mill services
Ángel - chicken meat sales
Elvira  - pork sales
Yasmin - cosmetics sales
Jacinta, Carmela - food sales
Sara  and Nicolasa - household products sales
Luz - corn and cornmeal sales

Aaron is married to Clara, and they have a 2 year-old daughter who brings joy to their home.  For 10 years, he has been selling groceries.  The small store he owns has been operating for 35 years; Aaron's mother started the business just before he was born.  The earnings from the store gave Aaron's parents the possibility of providing their children with a better quality of life.  Now the business remains open every day until 8pm, and if some customer comes to look for milk, water, coffee, sugar, or any other products, Aaron serves them without any problems.

In the harvest season (the season when the cane is cut) Clara tends to the store while Aaron works hauling cane to the mill (sugar factory), and also must watch over the burning, cutting, and cultivation of the sugar cane. 

Aaron uses the earnings and investments from loans to buy more merchandise, including: rice, beans, soups, sugar, coffee, milk, flour, lime powder, canned chilis, cheese, ham, sausages, drinks, etc.  In addition, he has been able to remodel the store, and he even hopes to expand it, thinking of his family's future.  Aaron would love it if the business could be passed down to his young daughter in the future.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

location.town: Localidad Selva Segunda, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa

loans.name: Elvin Noe

texts.es: Elvin, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa y dos hijos, y reside en un sector del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Elvin trabajó en una panadería por un tiempo y hace 8 años quedo sin empleo y decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de hot dog, este negocio lo realiza ambulantemente ofreciendo su producto en una carretilla en la comunidad, el hot dog lo prepara con pan, salsas y encurtidos. Con el fin de mantener el negocio ha solicitado un prestamo por 7,000 Lempiras para comprar una carretilla más y materiales para la preparación del hot dog. Su idea es ampliar el negocio y seguir creciendo con su negocio para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Elvin is 31 years old. He lives in free union with his wife and two children. He lives in a sector of the  town of Choloma, Cortes. Elvin worked in a bakery for some time, and eight years ago he was left without employment. He decided to set up his own business of selling hot dogs. He carries out this business as a street vendor, offering his product through the community from a cart. He prepares the hot dogs with bread, salsas, and pickles. With the goal of maintaining the business, he has applied for a loan of 7000 Lempiras in order to buy one more cart and materials for the preparation of hot dogs. His idea is to expand the business and continue growing with his business in order to help his family.

loans.use: to buy one more cart and materials to prepare hot dogs and continue selling them.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Nancy, 42 years of age, a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Matunda, a remote village in Kitale area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with two adorable children. 

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Kitale area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved, knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going child.

Nancy hopes to make progress as a poultry farmer and have a more stable income

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.en:
Muhabat lives with her husband and two children in Tajikistan. She is a business woman because she has her own food shop and runs this business well. 

She sells a variety of food items and has regular customers. Now, she plans to improve the business. She is going to open a café where she will cook pies and sambusa and sell them in her café to local people. 

Muhabat is asking for a loan of 2,300 USD to buy equipment and food items as flour, oil and etc. for her café. She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy equipment and food items such as flour, oil,etc., for her café

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 38 years old and has five children. She is married and four of her children are currently in school.

Rosana is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Rosana requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Rosana has been raising livestock for 17 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin, 37, is a single lady who comes from Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. She has been involved in this type of business since 1997. She is able to make an income of USD 2.00 per day, on average.  

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 33-year-old married father of two children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He started fourteen years ago working in the construction field specialized in painting to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Rami is a hard worker and ambitious man who is trying desperately to provide his family with better living conditions. Thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to proceed in his baby's birth registration. Rami hopes to develop his business in the future to improve his family's social and financial conditions.

loans.use: to proceed in his baby's birth registration

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Hello world, meet an inspirational smallholder farmer by the name of Caroline. Born in 1983 in the Nandi region of Kenya, Caroline has grown up to be a very hardworking and enterprising woman.

Her upbringing was not easy but at least she managed to finish her primary education. She is currently running a 1.5 acre mixed farm in Kabirsang village with the unwavering contribution of her dear husband. She keeps poultry, sheep and dairy cattle that give her eggs, meat and milk to sell.

Caroline is seeking a loan to purchase land. Since 2000, when she ventured into farming, she has been relying on her husband's farm to run the agribusiness, and still will. However, the business has grown and all the space is totally utilized. With the loan investment, she will acquire additional land to facilitate the growth of her business. Her financial discipline led her to be appointed the treasurer of Molwet Group (made up of farmers who save together and use the savings to access and guarantee loans of each member).

Returns from the investment will go toward loan repayment, setting up the new land and food for her family. She will also use the money to meet the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo por que ve en ellos una herramienta útil para surtir su negocio de manera rápida, invertirá en frutas, verduras,azúcar, pan, galletas, jugos, gaseosas, golosinas, jabón, etc. para aprovechar la temporada de fin de año y tener mejores ventas.
La señora María cuenta que el negocio ha tenido un comportamiento en las ventas positivo, debido a la buena inversión y administración del préstamo anterior. Las circunstancias familiares y económicas tienen una mejoría.
texts.en:
Maria is asking for a new loan, because she sees it as a useful tool to stock her business quickly. She will invest in fruit, vegetables, sugar, bread, cookies, juices, sodas, candy, soap, etc., to take advantage of the year-end holiday season and have better sales. 
Maria says that her business has had positive sales results, due to the good investment and the administration of the previous loan. Her family circumstances and economic situation have improved.

loans.use: to invest in fruit, vegetables, sugar, bread, cookies, juices, sodas, candy, soap, etc. to take advantage of the year-end holiday season.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: A local farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Ny is 53 years old and a mother of five children. She struggles to make a living via rice cropping on two hectares area as her single main source of income. For Ny, this is her fifth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She will spend her loan to pay the tuition fee for son who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Management. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for son who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree majoring in Management.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more buffaloes for his dairy farm business

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is a 64-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She is also engaged in dried fish vending.

Mely wants to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like rice, soap and detergents, shampoo and toiletries, biscuits and cookies, canned goods, noodles, condiments and other items. This loan will help her improve her stocks and inventories, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Mely hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like rice, soap and detergents, shampoo and toiletries, biscuits and cookies, canned goods, noodles, condiments and other items

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sonia, tiene una tortillería y venta de ropa, posee casa propia, vive con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijas, su pareja tiene un taller mecánico y su hija mayor trabaja en una comercial, todos colaboran para cubrir necesidades básicas de su hogar; su negocio lo abrió hace 18 años, la tortillería la atiende sola y en la venta de ropa la apoyan sus hijas. Trabajan todos los días, el domingo lo hacen hasta el mediodía.
Invertirá en maíz, leña y variedad de ropa, tendrá la materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas y ofrecerá nuevos estilos de ropa a sus clientes. Con la compra busca mejorar la competitividad de su negocio y generar más ganancias para cumplir con sus compromisos.
Desea seguir teniendo su negocio funcionando para darles a sus hijas menores una buena educación así como la han recibido las mayores.
texts.en:
Sonia has a tortilla shop and sells clothing. She owns her own home, and lives with her life partner and their four daughters. Her partner has an auto repair shop and her oldest daughter works in a shopping center. They all work together to cover basic household needs. She opened her business 18 years ago; she takes care of the tortilla shop by herself, and her daughters help with clothing sales. They work every day, on Sundays until noon.
She will invest in maize, firewood, and a selection of clothing, in order to have the raw materials to sell tortillas and offer new clothing styles to her clients. With the purchase, she seeks to improve the competitiveness of her business and generate more profits to fulfill her commitments. 
She hopes to be able to keep her business going, to give her younger daughters a good education, in the same way that the older ones have received their education.

loans.use: to invest in maize, firewood, and a selection of clothing, in order to have the raw materials to sell tortillas and offer new clothing styles to her clients.

loans.name: Jose Ezequiel

texts.es:
José, cuenta con un negocio de peluquería y juegos de video, vive con su esposa de 31 años de edad y su hija de 3 años de edad, Su esposa tiene un negocio en el mercado municipal, José atiende todos los días su negocio, lo fundo hace 5 años.
Invertirá en una máquina para cortar pelo, video juegos, controles y dará mantenimiento al equipo de  trabajo para que sus servicios sean más agradables para sus clientes, espera contar con mejores ingresos y tener puntualidad en el pago  de sus cuotas.
Sus principales objetivos son crecer con su negocio y que su hija tenga acceso a estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Jose has a barbershop and video game business. He lives with his 31 year old wife and 3 year old daughter. His wife has a business in the city marketplace. Jose works at his business everyday. He founded it 5 years ago. He will invest in hair clippers, video games and controllers and for maintenance of his work equipment so that his services are more pleasant for his customers. He hopes to get a better income and to be punctual in making his payments.

His main objectives are to grow his business and for his daughter to have access to study at a university.

loans.use: to invest in hair clippers, video games and controllers and for maintenance of his work equipment so that his services are more pleasant for his customers.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 63 años de edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el a pesar de su edad el realiza un enorme esfuerzo para poder tener una vida digna en un futuro no muy lejano.

El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de maxan en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 30 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para la compra de terreno para poder cultivar mas maxan en su comunidad, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de maxan produzcan hojas de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de maxan y construir una casa digna para habitar ya que las condiciones de vida con la que ahora cuenta no son las adecuadas para vivir.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 63 years old. He is an entrepreneurial man, determined to be able to achieve in life. He doesn't let himself be defeated by the obstacles that life presents to him, but he achieves all his goals and dreams. In spite of his age, he makes an enormous effort in order to be able to have a dignified life in the not-too-distant future.

He obtains his economic income through the production of maxan [a plant whose green leaves are used for wrapping tamales in Guatemala] in the community where he lives. His parents taught him this work 30 years ago. He sells his products in the market and the surroundings of his community, and thus he has an economic income to improve the living conditions of his family.

The use that he will give to the loan is to buy a plot of land in order to be able to raise more maxan in his community, since for him, it is of great importance that his maxan plants produce leaves of first quality, so that he won't lose the customers that he has.

One of his great aspirations is to plant more maxan plants and build a worthy house to live in, since the living conditions that he has now are not suitable for living.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Maria Martina

texts.es:
María, está satisfecha con el buen trato y facilidad de pago que se le da en la institución cuando hace uso de préstamos, por lo que está motivada a solicitar un nuevo financiamiento para comprar golosinas, detergentes, aceite, pan, bebidas, granos básicos, etc., seguir creciendo con su negocio.
El negocio está generando más ingresos, tiene más clientes satisfechos, su estilo de vida familiar es más digno y ha cancelado parte de sus deudas.
texts.en: Maris is satisfied with the good treatment and the convenience of payment that the institution gives her when she makes use of loans. For this reason, she is motivated to apply for new financing to buy candies, detergents, oil, bread, beverages, basic grains, etc., to continue growing with her business. The business is generating more income, she has more satisfied customers, her family lifestyle is more dignified, and she has paid off part of her debts.

loans.use: to buy candies, detergents, oil, bread, beverages, basic grains, etc., to continue growing with her business.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie, age 45, is married with 3 children between the ages of 8 and 14 years old, all of whom attend school.  She has operated a retail shop for 10 years.   

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, bananas, and maize flour to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bananas, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Dolores Isabel

texts.es:
Dolores, invirtió el préstamo anterior en materia prima para la venta de antojitos, el impacto ha sido positivo ya que sus ganancias con mayores y la clientela ha aumentado, todos en su familia se encuentran saludables.
Está solicitando un nuevo capital para invertirlo en harina, leña, carnes, aceite, verduras, bolsas, condimentos, etc., tendrá todo a su disposición para seguir elaborando enchiladas, tostadas, yuca frita y otros antojitos, se muestra entusiasmada por seguir luchado para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dolores invested her previous loan in staple items for the sale of traditional corn-based dishes. The impact has been positive, because her profits are bigger, and her clientele has increased. Everyone in her family is in a good state of health.
She is asking for a new loan to invest in flour, firewood, meat, oil, vegetables, bags, condiments, etc. She will have everything at her disposal to keep making enchiladas, plantain chips, fried yucca, and other traditional dishes. She is very enthusiastic to be able to keep trying to get ahead.

loans.use: to invest in flour, firewood, meat, oil, vegetables, bags, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Doña Alejandrina, tiene 55 años de edad, esta casada con su esposo con quien tienen tres hijos, los tres son independientes, ella vive en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes.
Doña Alejandrina es una señora trabajadora, que lleva aproximadamente 21 años de tener su propio negocio, elabora y vende pan casero como quesadillas, rosquillas, empanadas y tustacas.  Además hace tamales por encargo en ocasiones. Doña Alejandrina reinvierte sus ganancias y solicita prestamos para mantener estable su negocio. Ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo por 16,000 Lempiras para comprar materia prima como harinas, manteca, azúcar, levadura, huevos, leche para hacer pan y mantener siempre materiales para cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes. Ella considera que al comprar en cantidades mayores va conseguir mejor precio y va tener un ahorro. Tiene como meta obtener ingresos para ayudar a su hija a terminar de pagar su casa y seguir creciendo con el negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Alejandrina is 54 years old, married, and has three children who are independent. She lives in a neighborhood in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

Doña Alejandrina is a hardworking woman who has managed her own business for approximately 21 years. She prepares and sells baked goods such as cakes, donuts, empanadas, and cookies. Alejandrina also makes tamales by order on occasion. She reinvests her earnings as well as requests loans so that she can maintain a stable business.

Doña Alejandrina has decided to request another loan of 16,000 HNL so that she can buy ingredients such as flour, butter, sugar, yeast, eggs, and milk to make bread as well as to have these materials available for requests from her customers. She thinks that when she buys in larger quantities, she is going to get better prices and save money. Her goal is to generate income to help her daughter complete the payment of her house and to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, butter, sugar, yeast, eggs, and milk to make bread and to sell.

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed is a 28-year-old married man from Rafah city, in Palestine.  He lives with his wife and three kids; a son and two daughters, in a small house.  He works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income, which is barely enough to cover all of his family's needs.  Nahed is also a student studying Business Administration.  He is studying for a BA degree so that he can find a better job in the future, and eventually improve the living conditions of his family.

Nahed took a USD loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him buy a new laptop for his studies.  By taking this loan, Nahed will be able to do his homework and write the reports needed to prepare for his seminar.  Nahed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza, tiene 43 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien vive en una aldea del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos, cultivando maíz y frijol, luego cultivó café también que es la producción que mas ingresos le genera. El café lo vende en húmedo en la misma comunidad. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo y es por 5,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar abonos y va invertir en limpieza para darle mantenimiento a su finca. Su idea es seguir cultivando café para ayudar a mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Lorenza is 43 years old and lives in a free union with her husband in a village in the municipality of Azacualpa, in Santa Barbara. She has always been dedicated to farming basic grains, especially cultivating corn and beans. Later, she cultivated coffee, and it became the crop that generates the most income for her. Lorenza sells her coffee before it is dried in her community.

The loan Lorenza requests is a part of her group's second loan cycle and is for 5,000 Honduran lempiras, with which she will purchase fertilizers and invest in clearing land in order to maintain her farm.

Her idea is to continue cultivating coffee in order to help improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and invest in clearing land to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Nelyn works hard to support her family.

She operates a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle passengers.  Nelyn is borrowing 40,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Nelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Al Wafaa Group

texts.en:
Ghoufran is the featured borrower of Al Wafaa. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been best neighbors and loyal friends.

Ghoufran is a 34-year-old Syrian citizen and a married mother of six children who is working hard as a hairdresser from her house to develop her family's living in a well-managed way. She started her current business nine years ago and is working hard on developing it properly. She is well-known in her region for her special talents and prices.

Ghoufran's acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with newly-released hair colors, highlights and special hair treatment creams, especially before the coming Christmas and New Year's celebrations. She is the lady at the center of the picture. 

As for the other group members, Maha is the first on the left and is requesting her loan to pay for her daughter's university tuition fees, while Sikna, the first on the right, works as a tutor and her acquired loan will be used to pay for her expected baby's needs.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with newly-released hair colors, highlights and special hair treatment creams especially before the coming Christmas and New Year's celebrations

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
El señor Luis  de 42 años de edad es casado  tiene dos hijos  que depende de él, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 04 años  a la venta de cuajada, detergentes y ropa usada.
Don Luis vende en su casa y de forma ambulante, sus clientes le prefieren por su buena atención y porque vende buen producto y vende todo los días de lunes a domingo.
Don Luis está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de detergentes, pantalones, blusas, camisas, etc. para tener mercadería suficiente para vender con el apoyo del préstamo el pretende mejorar su negocio y salir adelante, es su primer crédito que solicita a Prisma.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Luis is 42 years old and is married with two children who depend on him. He lives in the neighborhood of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. 

He has his own house and has made a living for the past 4 years selling curd, detergent, and used clothes. Don Luis sells out of his house and travels to sell his products. His customers prefer doing business with him because of his good service, good products, and he sells everyday from Monday to Sunday.

Don Luis is requesting a loan to buy detergent, pants, blouses, shirts, etc. to have sufficient merchandise to sell. With the help of this loan, he hopes to improve his business and get ahead. This is his first loan that he has requested with Prisma. His dream is to improve his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2014.

loans.use: to buy detergent, pants, blouses, shirts, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Rene Fernando

texts.es:
Rene, de 36 años de edad, es reconocido en la comunidad como un hombre honrado y trabajador, dedicado siempre a su familia y dispuesto siempre a ayudar a quien lo necesite. Estudió hasta sexto grado, ya que se le dificultaba estudiar y trabajar a la vez.- Está casado, tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando, su esposa  se dedica a la venta de tamales, pasteles, frutas entre otros productos. 

Rene, trabaja en actividades agrícolas en la época lluviosa, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 22 años y la aprendió gracias a su padre.- En verano trabaja en la elaboración de teja, tiene 14 años de experiencia gracias a que su hermano mayor le enseño el oficio.- Además, tiene una vaca que ordeña  para el consumo de leche de su familia.

El préstamo lo invertirá para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de teja, ya que se aproxima la época de mayor demanda de este producto. Este año espera invertir un poco más que años anteriores para lograr obtener mejores ingresos.

Su principal sueño es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, para que tengan mejores oportunidades de ganarse el sustento diario de manera honesta.
texts.en:
