Rene, who is 36 years old, is known in the community as being an honest and hard-working man, always dedicated to his family and ready to help whoever is in need. He studied until the sixth grade, because it was difficult for him to study and work at the same time. He is married, he has two children who are in school, and his wife makes a living selling tamales, cakes, fruits, and other products. 

Rene works in agricultural activities during the rainy season. He has had this occupation since he was 22 years old, and learned it thanks to his father. In the summer, he works in the production of tile. He has 14 years of experience, thanks to his older brother, who taught him the trade. Furthermore, he has a cow, whose milk is consumed by his family. 

He will invest the loan to buy raw materials for the production of tile, as the season of highest demand for this product is approaching. This year, he hopes to invest a bit more than in previous years to obtain a better income. His main dream is that his children can finish their studies so that they have better opportunities to earn their daily sustenance in an honest way.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the production of tiles, as the season of highest demand for this product is approaching.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 20-year-old single man from Gaza city. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Yousef is a student who studies Economics. He want to take a BA degree and find a job in the future to improve the family's living conditions.

Yousef took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Yousef will be able to do his homework and write his reports to prepare for his seminar.

Yousef appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Laxmi Sss Group

texts.en:
In the community where the “Laxmi Sss” group is found, recently a maize harvest has started. Maize is an important crop of the region and is the fundamental nourishment for poor families all year. Having a good harvest requires a lot of work, effort, and dedication, but above all, a lot of money. The residents know that all of this investment is worth it, because in the future, they will have the opportunity to enjoy the maize cobs, corn, corn flakes and traditional foods made with maize flour. 

The members of the group are very hardworking women and they currently need a loan to be able to invest in their businesses. Meena will invest in her maize farming.

Meena, 44, is very talkative and friendly. She is the mother of three children all of whom are in school. She lives in her parent's house with her children and parents. Three years ago, Meena was invited to attend a social meeting for women. This is how she came to know about Peoples Forum. A little while later, she started maize harvesting.

The loan from Peoples Forum will help her even more, considering that the end-of-year season is an excellent time to harvest maize and make good earnings. Meena dreams of increasing her level of production. She will use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for maize farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for maize farming.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a 46-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has a 16-year-old daughter. Angela has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. Fishing is their main source of income.

Angela is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and a new boat engine or motor. With this, Angela and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Angela hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and a new boat engine or motor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies, craft foam, felt, glue, accessories and Christmas decorations, to increase sales and pay for her studies

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 51-year-old married man with five children ages 23, 20, 18, 15, and 12 years old, all attending different schools. He is a director of a primary school in Kamuzinda and works for 6 days a week and 10 hours a day.

He is also a farmer from which he gets additional income to support his family. He has been in this business since 2004. He was motivated by the profitability of the business and also the need to bring education to his community. 

He hopes to use the loan to buy stock of school supplies like corn flour and beans for feeding the students.
 
He faces a challenge of parents who take a long time to pay school fees, which affects the operations of the school. He is described as an honest and hardworking man in business.

He appreciates the services of lenders and asks UGAFODE to give bonuses to clients who have been with the institution for a long time.

loans.use: To buy school supplies (corn flour and beans)

loans.name: Aroma Group

texts.es:
Aroma es el nombre que los integrantes dieron al grupo formado en una colonia ubicada en una región cañera donde en época de cosecha se puede apreciar a lo largo del camino a los habitantes quemando, cortando y trasladando la caña a la fábrica de azúcar.

Las integrantes del grupo eligieron el nombre por uno de sus grupos musicales favoritos. Los integrantes del grupo y sus actividades son:
Alicia - Venta De Abarrotes
Margarita - Venta De Refrescos
Luciano - Venta De Refrescos
Elías - Venta De Cerdos
Araceli - Venta De Dulces Y Pan 
Vicencia - Venta De Dulces.

La señora Alicia tiene 31 años y está casada con el señor Feliciano son padres de dos varones uno de 8 años y el otro de 12, ambos estudian en la escuela de la localidad. Ella comenta que hace cuatro años inició con una tiendita de abarrotes para la cual acondicionó un cuarto en casa y despachaba a través de una ventana grande. Al enfermar su madre ella tuvo que ir a Vercruz a cuidarla y tuvo que cerrar la tienda. 

Por esta razón, nuevamente solicita un préstamo a VisionFund ya que quiere iniciar nuevamente su tienda de abarrotes y tener nuevamente un ingreso sin descuidar a su familia. Esta vez su gran reto será no tener que volver a cerrar. Con el préstamo comprará frijol, arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, huevos, galletas, café, jitomates, chiles, cebolla y refrescos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. “Gracias por una nueva oportunidad, la aprovecharemos al máximo y creceremos de la mano con nuestra actividad” comentó Alicia. 

*La fotografía tomada en el camino de la colonia, al lado de la casa de doña Alicia quien viste blusa a rayas y falda de mezclilla.
texts.en:
Aroma is the name that group members gave to their group, formed in a neighborhood located in a sugar-cane region, where in the time of the harvest, it is possible to see the inhabitants along the road burning, cutting, and transporting the cane to the sugar factory. 

The members of the group chose the name in honor of one of their favorite music groups. The members of the group and their activities are:
Alicia: grocery sales
Margarita: soda sales
Lucina: soda dales
Elías: pig sales
Araceli: sweets and bread sales 
Vicencia: sweets sales 

Alicia is 31 years old and married with Feliciano. They are the parents of two boys, one is 8 and the other is 12, and they both study in a local school. She says that four years ago she opened a small grocery shop, for which she set up a room in her house, and she would sell through a large window. After her mother got ill, she had to move to Veracruz to care for her, and had to close her shop.

For this reason, she is once again requesting a loan from VisionFund, as she wants to reopen her grocery store and again have an income without neglecting her family. This time, her big challenge will be not having to close again. With the loan, she will buy beans, rice, sugar, oil, milk, eggs, cookies, coffee, tomatoes, chilies, onions, and sodas to fulfill the needs of her customers. “Thank you for a new opportunity, we will make the most of it, and we will grow together with our occupation” Alicia said. 

*The photograph was taken on the way to the neighborhood, next door to Alicia’s house, who is wearing a striped shirt and a denim skirt.

loans.use: to buy: beans, rice sugar, oil, milk, eggs, cookies, coffee, tomatoes, chilies, onions, and sodas.

loans.name: Deggo Tamakh Group

texts.fr: DEGGO TAMAKH est un groupement mixte qui est composé de femmes et d’hommes. Ils font parti de la même famille et habitent dans le même village qui se situe à quelques kilomètres du guichet. Ils font pratiquement la même activité. Etant à leur 1er prêt, ils veulent booster leur activité et renforcer leur stock de marchandises. Le président s’appelle Hamath, c’est lui qui a levé la main sur la photo. Il évolue dans l’achat et la vente de poisson sèche  et les fruits de mer. Il sollicite ce montant pour aller en ville acheter des poissons sèches et des fruits de mer qu’il va revendre dans son village. Hamath a une expérience de plus de 6ans dans cette activité. Il commence sa journée à 6h du matin pour la terminer vers les coûts de 20h. Il voudrait avoir un grand magasin dans le marché pour y stocker ses marchandises. Et Il souhaite aussi augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent. ainsi il pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Deggo Tamakh is a mixed group composed of men and women. They belong to the same family and live in the same village, which lies a few kilometers from the branch office. Their business activity is basically the same. This being their first loan, they want to boost their business and increase their stock supply.

The president is Hamath, who is raising his hand in the photo, and is active at buying and selling dried fish and seafood. He is requesting this loan amount to go buy dried fish and seafood in town, to be resold in his village.

Hamath has more than  six years' experience in this business. He starts his day at 6 am to finish around 8 pm.

He would like to have a large store in the market to store his goods. He also wants to increase his revenues and save money, so that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy dried fish and seafood for resale

loans.name: Rainabe Ii Group

texts.fr: RAINABE II est un groupement de femmes qui habitent dans le même quartier et qui font pratiquement les mêmes activités. Elles se réunissent à chaque fois de besoins et organisent des tontines régulièrement.  La dame KADEL qui a levé la main sur la photo est leur présidente. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui n’a pas de parent bénéficiaire dans l’institution. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des denrées alimentaires.  KADEL sollicite ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter et vendre du thé, sucre, savons, et huile. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 10h car elle doit faire ses taches ménagères. A l’avenir, elle souhaite être autonome financièrement et ouvrir d’autres points de vente. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent à coté.
texts.en:
Rainabe II is a group of women who live in the same neighborhood with virtually the same business activities. They meet when needed and regularly organize tontines (savings group).

Kadel, the lady raising her hand in the photo, is their president. She is a married mother who has no relative who is beneficiary of the institution. She is active at marketing food products.

Kadel is requesting this loan to buy and sell tea, sugar, soap, and cooking oil. She helps her husband in managing the family's daily expenses and her children's school fees. She starts her day at 9 am to finish at 10 am because she has to do her household chores.

In the future she would like to become financially independent and open other outlets. This way she can increase her revenues and save money on the side.

loans.use: buy food products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy chicks to raise and resell

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdou est un ouvrier qui exerce le métier depuis plus de 10 ans maintenant. Il est marié et père de famille. Abdou a installé un atelier métallique  devant chez lui ou il exerce et où il compte une clientèle parmi son voisinage
Abdou n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC et voudrait acquérir une somme de 300 000F pour acheter du matériel dont il a besoin pour la fabrication des outils (hilaires, râteaux, arrosoirs…)il lui arrive aussi de fabriquer des meubles : salon, table à manger pour revendre.
Habitant au village, en grande famille, il se partage la dépense quotidienne à tour de rôle avec ses frères dans la maison.
Comme ambition, il aimerait élargir son activité et ouvrir un autre grand atelier en ville.
texts.en:
Abdou is a worker who has been exercising his profession for over ten years. He is married and a father. Abdou installed a metal workshop at his homefront where he works for a neighborhood clientele.

Abdou has never before received a loan from IMCEC and would like to borrow 300,000 francs to purchase materials needed to manufacture tools (ladles, rakes, watering cans ...). At times he also makes living room furniture and dining room tables for sale.

Living in an extended family in the village, he takes turns with his brothers in dealing with daily household expenditures. His ambition is to expand his business and open another large workshop in town.

loans.use: buy materials and iron to make tools and furniture

loans.name: Gpt Juboo Ndièmane 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Juboo Ndiémane2 regroupe six femmes  dont la présidente, la dame Codou habillée en bleu, s’active dans le domaine de l’agriculture depuis plus de 5 ans, spécialement dans le stockage des produits cultivés dans la zone : mil, arachide, haricots. Le stockage consiste à acheter une grande quantité de céréales à un prix abordable, de le stocker des mois durant pour pouvoir le revendre à un prix plus élevé lorsque ces produits se feront rares dans le marché.
Grâce à son activité, elle arrive à nourrir sa famille car son mari évolue aussi dans l’agriculture, ils s’appuient mutuellement dans les charges de la maison.
Codou souhaite un jour construire un grand hangar où il pourra faire son stockage en grande quantité
texts.en:
The 'Juboo Ndiémane 2' Group is made up of six women.  Codou is the group president and is seen in the photograph dressed in blue.  She has been working in agriculture for more than five years, especially in the stocking of products which are cultivated locally - millet, peanuts and beans.

She buys a large quantity of cereals when the price is affordable and then keeps them until prices rise and she can sell them and make a profit.  Thanks to this business, Codou is able to work with her husband (who also works in agriculture) in order to provide for the expenses of their household.

In the future, Codou would like to be able to build a large warehouse where she could store the cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals - millet, beans and peanuts, to stock and sell in the future.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen is 26 years old. She is married with two children aged between 3 and 8 years old, one of whom goes to school. She sells wood and has been in the business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more wood to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To buy more wood to resell.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and two go to school. She operates a pub at the market. She serves all kinds of people in her pub. She has been in this business for eight years. She takes care of additional family members. Doreen works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling used shoes. She has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO of 500,000 Ugandan shillings to buy crates of beer and soda, jerrycans of local brew and spirits. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to buy a fridge for her pub and also better serving utensils. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: to buy spirits, crates of soda and beer and jerrycans of local brew.

loans.name: Assoupé

texts.fr: Assoupé est née en 1975 à Wogba. Elle veuve et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait le commerce de du jus de maïs communément appelé « liha » ddepuis 1991. Elle vent dans le quartier d’Adamavo et s’approvisionne 2 fois par mois au marché d’Akodésséwa. Avec ce crédit elle veut 50 bols de maïs et 20 bol de sucre. Les revenus de sont activités lui permettent de faire face à l’éducation de ses 6 enfants et à leur charges quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Assoupé was born in 1975 in Wogba.  She is a widow and mother to six children.  She has been preparing and selling liha (a juice prepared from maize), since 1991.

Assoupé lives in the Adamavo district and travels to the Akodésséwa market twice a month to buy her supplies.  She plans to use her loan to buy 50 bowls of maize and 20 bowls of sugar.

Her profits are used to provide for the education and daily needs of her six children.

loans.use: to buy 50 bowls of maize and 20 bowls of sugar for her juice making business.

loans.name: Abléwavi

texts.fr: Abléwavi est âgée de 46 ans, elle est veuve et  mère de 3 enfants. Elle vend de friperie et surtout des draps. Elle s’achète au marché d’Hédrzanawé et revend aux marchés d’Avépozo et Agodékè, elle s’approvisionne 2 fois par mois. C e crédit lui permettra d’acheter 30 unités de draps de 2 places et 15 draps de 3 places. Les revenus de son activité lui de prendre ses 3 enfants  en charges sans dépendre d’autres personnes.
texts.en:
Abléwavi is 46 years old, widowed and mother to three children.  She sells second-hand clothing and especially sheets.  She buys her supplies twice a month from the Hédrzanawé market, and resells them at the Avépozo and Agodékè markets.

Abléwavi plans to use her loan to buy 30 double sheets and 15 triple sheets.  Her earnings will allow her to provide for her children without depending on the help of anyone else.

loans.use: to buy 30 double sheets and 15 triple sheets for resale.

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.en:
Suhrobjon is from Tajikistan. It’s a country where one can disconnect from the noise and appreciate the beauty of nature since its scenery is very beautiful. Suhrobjon loves his country very much.

Suhrobjon is 32 years old. He is married and has two children. To make a living, he sells food items in the market. He has been engaged in his business for two years and earns a little money for these activities. Suhrobjon works day by day in the local market. He works around 10 hours a day. He thinks his activity is going well because he is very kind and he always loves what he does.

He is requesting a loan of 1500 USD which will be used to buy more food items to sell.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a 40-year-old married man from Concepcion, Iloilo. Noel and his wife are engaged in a food vending business. They have a small eatery or carenderia in their place. Noel has been in the business for more than two years now.

Noel wants to expand his business but lacks the financial resources to do so. Because of this, he joined CEVI and is now requesting a loan to buy ingredients for cooking like meat, vegetables, seasonings and condiments, rice, and soft drinks. This loan will allow him to cook more food and sell it to his customers, thus augmenting his sales and income.

In the future, Noel hopes to make his business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking like meat, vegetables, seasonings and condiments, rice, and soft drinks

loans.name: Ni¤O Jesus Group

texts.es:
Ritha es una mujer de 51 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 20 años, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de artesanía en yeso.
Ella es emprendedora, paciente, generosa, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘El Torno’ un área rural que agrupa a productores de; carne, verduras, hortalizas, frutas y otros, con distribuidores mayoristas que se encargan de acomodar la producción campesina en los diferentes mercados y supermercados de la ciudad. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante en día entre 18-35 grados centígrados.
Ritha es de tez trigueña, cabello negro largo ondulado, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español para el comercio (sentada lado derecho, usa blusa color naranja y pantalón corto negro). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al transporte libre y con su hijo que trabaja y estudia, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; puesto de venta de comida, venta de refrescos, venta de camisetas, venta de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio y carnicería, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la artesanía en yeso, los materiales que mayormente utiliza son; Molde (puede ser de silicona), yeso, Agua, Recipiente para colocar la mezcla y Aceite. Para realizar este trabajo realiza los siguientes pasos;  Llena el molde con agua para saber qué cantidad de yeso necesitará, Transfiere el agua al recipiente y comienza a integrar poco a poco el yeso hasta que el agua la absorba, Coloca la pasta en el molde previamente aceitado, y cuando queda lleno lo agita para que salgan las burbujas, Espera entre 20 y 30 minutos para desmoldar, Retira los excesos que queden en el borde, Deja secar la figura durante 1 o 2 días y la lija si es necesario, posteriormente la pinta. “mi trabajo comenzó por la necesidad de realizar imágenes de navidad como; ángeles, palomas, reyes magos, luego me fui acercando a las ferias y realizaba alcancías, continúo en la misma línea y tengo trabajos según la fecha…” comenta. Su sueño es que su hija sea profesional, y desea realizar la compra de material de trabajo por mayor para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año. Esta es la tercera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Ritha solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de trabajo en yeso por mayor para aumentar su producción.

loans.use: to buy plaster in bulk in order to increase production.

loans.name: Youssou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Youssou travaille comme mobilisateur communautaire depuis des années. Il travaille de 8h du matin à 18h. Il est marié et père de deux enfants. C’est un habitué du guichet parce qu’il est à son 5ème crédit, mais aussi parce qu’il a beaucoup contribué à la promotion de l’IMCEC depuis la création de celle-ci jusqu’à maintenant.
Youssou sollicite ce crédit pour la réfection de sa maison. Il vit en grande famille, mais cela ne l’empêche pas de prendre tout en charge sans attendre de remboursement des autres membres de la famille capable de participer. Il a aussi l’appui de son épouse qui participe aussi à la dépense quotidienne et à l’éducation de leurs enfants.
Youssou souhaite un jour faire une activité génératrice de revenus comme l’embouche afin de diversifier ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Youssou has been working as a community mobilizer for years. He works from 8 am to 6 pm. He is married and has two children.

He is a regular at the branch office because this is his fifth loan, but also because he has contributed significantly to the promotion of IMCEC since its creation until now.

Youssou is requesting this loan to repair his house. He lives in an extended family, but that does not prevent him from taking charge of things without awaiting reimbursement from other family members who are able to participate.

He also has his wife's support, who contributes towards daily expenditures and their children's education.

One day Youssou hopes to diversify his revenues with an income-generating activity such as fattening livestock.

loans.use: buy building materials to renovate house

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace varios años una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia donde comercializa una variedad de productos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 52, lives with her family in a house of their own. She has had a store at home for some years now, and sells different products.

She is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, grains, beverages, sweets, sweet bread, etc. This will result in a higher income and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, grains, beverages, sweets, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Cristina Lisseth

texts.es:
Cristina, de 25 años de edad, es una joven de orígenes humildes, su nivel académico es hasta séptimo grado de educación básica, no logro continuar sus estudios  porque la situación económica no se lo permitió. Actualmente está acompañada, su compañero de vida se dedica al cuido de ganado y manejo de cultivos de hortalizas. Ellos tienen tres hijos, pero solo su hija mayor está estudiando.

Cristina, tiene crianza y comercialización de pollos de engorde, realiza ésta actividad desde hace dos años, también, ayuda a su compañero de vida en el cuido de ganado y manejo de cultivos, ellos trabajan también, como jornaleros en una finca. Ella además, realiza los quehaceres del hogar y cuida los niños.


El Préstamo lo utilizará para comprar concentrado, 3 comederos y vacunas para establecer 100 pollos de engorde y comercializarlos en Diciembre pues en este mes del año es cuando mayor demanda tiene la carne de pollo. Es así, como Cristina espera tener mayores ingresos para su familia. 

Cristina, tiene una vaquita pero su deseo es poder contar con mucho ganado, ésta actividad en el comercio deja buen margen de ganancia, esto significaría una importante entrada de dinero para ella y su familia que tanto lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Cristina is 25 years old. She is of humble origins and could study up to the seventh grade of primary school, when she had to quit because of her family’s financial situation. She is in a relationship and her life partner works in agriculture. They have three children, but only their daughter goes to school.

Cristina raises and sells chickens. She has been doing this for two years, and she also helps her husband with his activities. They both work as day laborers for a local farm. She also works taking care of the household chores and her children.

She will use this loan to buy animal feed, three troughs and vaccines for her one hundred chickens. December comes with a high demand for chicken meat, so Cristina hopes to receive a good income for her family.

Cristina has a cow, but she would like to have many more. Cattle leave very good profits, which is why this would represent an important source of money for her and her family, who are in need.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, three troughs and vaccines for her chickens.

loans.name: Las Tres Cruces Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad mazahua se encuentra ubicado el grupo “Las Tres Cruces” las integrantes decidieron usar ese nombre porque cerca del lugar donde viven hay tres cruces que caracterizan a la comunidad, allí se llevan a cabo las fiestas patronales cada mes.

Las integrantes son tres mujeres muy amables, sonrientes y muy trabajadoras, cada una de ellas tiene familia por lo que tienen algún tipo de negocio. Doña Martina es suegra de Erika (quien se dedica a bordar) y Adela (cría animales) es su amiga desde hace ya varios años. Doña Martina es la representante del grupo, tiene 47 años de edad y está casada desde hace 28 con el señor Lorenzo quien trabaja en la construcción de casas en la Ciudad de México. Son padres de cinco hijos aunque ya sólo una joven depende de ellos. 

Martina está solicitando un préstamo para comprar más tela cuadrille, hilos, estambres, pollos y borregos. Durante 17 años se ha dedicado a la elaboración de servilletas, manteles, entre otras piezas y a la cría y engorda de pollos y borregos. Inició las actividades porque quería ayudar con los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos ya que el sueldo de su esposo era mínimo. 

Para Doña Martina no significa gran dificultad tener tres negocios porque atiende a los animales por la mañana, los saca a pastar al campo; al mediodía les vuelve a dedicar una hora para cambiarlos de lugar y volver a alimentarlos. En la elaboración de bordados pasa las demás horas de su día, puede tomarle hasta 20 días para terminar una pieza. En ocasiones, las personas de su comunidad le hacen encargos de varios bordados para entregar en celebraciones como bautizos, primeras comuniones, confirmaciones, etc.

A Doña Martina no le preocupa la competencia de su comunidad porque ya tiene clientes seguros y siempre trata de hacer su trabajo con la mejor calidad para que la puedan seguir recomendando. Su único sueño es seguir creciendo en sus negocios, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
The "Las Tres Cruces" group is located in a Mazahua community. The members decided to use that name because close to where they live there are three crosses that distinguish the community. That is where they have the patron saint festivities are held every month. 

The members are three women who are very kind, smiling and hardworking. Each of them has a family and that is why they have some type of business. Martina is Erika's mother in law  (she works in embroidery), and Adela (who raises animals) has been her friends for several years. Martina is  the group's representative. She is 47 years old and she has been married for 28 years to Lorenzo, who works in home construction in Mexico City. They are the parents of five children although only one daughter depends on them.  

Martina is asking for a loan to buy more checked fabric, thread, worsted wool, chickens and sheep. For 17 years, she has worked making napkins, table cloths, and other items, as well as raising and fattening chickens and sheep. She started her activities because she wanted to help with the household expenses and her children's education expenses, because her husband's salary was minimum.  

For Martina, it hasn't been difficult having three businesses because she cares for the animals in the morning, and takes them to graze in the pasture,. At midday she spends more time moving them to a different place and feeding them again. Doing the embroidery is what she spends the rest of her time on every day. It can take her up to 20 days to finish a piece. At times, people from her community order different embroidered pieces to deliver to celebrations for baptisms, first communions, confirmations, etc. 

Martina isn't worried about competition in her community because she already has regular customers and she always tries to do her work with the best quality so that they will keep recommending her. Her only dream is to keep growing in her businesses to help with the household expenses and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy more checked fabric, thread, worsted wool, chickens and sheep.

location.town: Guadalupe Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sheeting, wood, wire and nails. She will also pay for labor to build a corridor for her house.

loans.name: Hugo Fermeliz

texts.es: Hugo de 41 años de edad habita en vivienda propia al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad, por lo que se siente feliz ya que ellos le apoyan con su cultivo. Hugo es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida con el cultivo de diferentes verduras, granos y legumbres, como: loroco, chile, pipianes, frijol, etc. Y es en estos cultivos que es apoyado por sus hijos que se sienten felices de aprender el oficio. Hugo desea terminar de construir su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, hierro, lámina y madera para terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en: Hugo is 41 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and 2 children, aged 19 and 17. He is happy because they help him with his crops. Hugo is a hardworking man who earns a living growing different types of vegetables, grains and legumes such as lorocco, chiles, pipian squash, beans, etc. His children help him with these crops and they are happy to learn the trade. Hugo wants to finish building his house and to do that he is asking for a loan from  FUSAI  to invest in cement, sand, gravel, iron, sheeting and wood to finish building his home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, iron, sheeting, and wood to finish building his house.

loans.name: Yanira Marisol

texts.es: Yanira es una mujer joven de 37 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia al lado de su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 18 y 10 años de edad desde hace 7 años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder brindarles un lugar donde vivir. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia apoyada en su trabajo, además su compañero de vida la apoya económicamente gracias a su trabajo como motorista. Yanira se siente triste de ver que el techo de su vivienda se encuentra deteriorado y las filtraciones en el mismo cada día son más abundantes, es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, pines y polines para cambiar el techo deteriorado de su vivienda, lo antes posible.
texts.en: Yanira is a 37 year old young woman who has lived in her own house at the side of her life partner and their 2 children, ages 18 and 10 for the past 7 years, for which she is happy to be able to offer them a place to live. She is an enterprising woman who works hard to get her family ahead, supporting them with her work, and also her life partner supports her thanks to his work as a driver.  Yanira is sad to see that the roof of her house is deteriorated and every day there are more and more leaks. For this reason she has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, pins, and beams to replace the deteriorated roof of her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, pins, and beams to replace the roof on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in improving the hygienic conditions of her bathroom.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Most of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and a lack of capital. This is true for Sarah, who is based in the Kitale area of Kenya and is a mother of two lovely children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past four years and has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. 

Sarah passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking Daddy (the name of her dairy cow). She sells milk to her neighbours and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. 

The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit margins and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying back the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Sarah is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling, and also to start selling dairy products such as yoghurt. 

An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Gloria Margarita

texts.es: Gloria es una mujer emprendedora de 56 años de edad, que desde muy joven se interesó en aprender a cocinar y con el apoyo de su cónyuge quien le ayudó a iniciar el restaurante, en el año 2010 empezó a funcionar, desde entonces ella ha ofrecido comida típica como sancochos,  pescados, arroces entre otras delicias a sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son empleados de obras en construcción o contratistas de empresas a quienes les ofrece facilidad de pago.  Gloria,  abre su restaurante a las 8 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m., de lunes a domingo, hace sus compras víveres de contado a graneros y mayoristas.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará los ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz, aceite, aderezos, verduras, carnes.  El negocio tiene un buen flujo de caja y se ha mantenido a través del tiempo.  Gloria es madre de 2 hijos y una hija a quienes desea seguirles brindando su apoyo.  Ella es una mujer muy visionaria y tiene como meta a largo plazo abrir un restaurante con mayor capacidad.
texts.en: Gloria is an enterprising woman, 56 years old, who since she was young was interested in learning how to cook and, with the help of her spouse who helped her to open a restaurant, she started to run it in 2010. Since then, she has offered typical foods such as stews, fish and rice dishes, among other delicacies to her customers, who are largely constructon workers or contractors in businesses to whom she offers ease of payments.  Gloria opens her restaurant at 8:00 am until 3:00 from Monday to Sunday. She purchases her supplies in cash at granaries and wholesalers. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing that she is getting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase the ingredients to make her meals such as rice, oil, seasonings, vegetables, and meat. The business has a good cash flow and has maintained itself over time.  Gloria is the mother of two sons and a daughter to whom she wants to continue offering her support. She is a very visionary woman and has a long term goal to open a restaurant with larger capacity.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare her meals such as rice, oil, seasonings, vegetables, and meat.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 34 years old. She is married with four children aged between 8 and 17 years, all of whom go to school. She has a shop and has been working in a business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, match boxes and rice to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, match boxes and rice to resell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, all of whom go to school. She is not looking after any other member of her family.

She has been selling food at the market on a retail basis for the last two years, working seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more bunches of green bananas for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to acquire more land to grow off-season food. She joined MCDT because of their interest in serving low-income people.

She resides in a rented house with no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo, aunque su vivienda es muy humilde ella se siente feliz de poder contar con un lugar propio donde vivir desde hace 8 años. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza por salir adelante prestando sus servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo de forma domiciliar. Rosalina desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para encementar el corredor de su vivienda, ya que actualmente es de tierra y en época de lluvia esto genera insalubridad y criaderos de mosquitos, por lo que espera contar con este apoyo lo antes posible.
texts.en: Rosalina, age 43, lives in her own house with her husband. Although the house is very humble, she is happy to be able to have her own place to live for the past 8 years. She is an enterprising woman who works hard to get ahead, offering domestic services for a long time in her customer's homes.  Rosalina wants to get a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to cement the outdoor walkway o fher house, which is currently dirt an din the rainy season it causes poor health and is a breeding ground for mosquitos, so she hopes to have this loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand and gravel to cemment the outdoor walkway of her house.

loans.name: Wuanerges Amed

texts.es: Wuanerges de 34 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijas de 8 y 3 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se esfuerza por sostener la economía de su hogar, por medio de su negocio de venta de productos básicos el cual instalo en su vivienda desde hace 5 años. Wuanerges desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este tiene un tiempo presentando filtraciones, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Wuanerges is 34 years old, and lives in his own house alongside his wife and their 2 daughters, ages 8 and 3. He is an enterprising man who works hard to sustain his household's economy through his business selling basic products which he opened in his house 5 years ago.

Wuanerges wants to replace the roof on his house, since it has been leaking for a while, so he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof on his house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof on his house.

loans.name: Alba Lely

texts.es:
Alba, solicita capital para invertir en cebollas, aguacates, melones, zanahorias, manzanas, etc., abastecerá  su negocio con frutas y verduras frescas cada vez que sea necesario y aprovechara la temporada de festividades navideñas para tener mejores ingresos.
El préstamo anterior le ha sido de mucha ayuda para tener un negocio competitivo, con nuevos clientes y recursos económicos para ir cambiando su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Alba is asking for a loan to invest in buying onions, avocados, melons,  carrots, apples. etc. She will stock-up her business with fruit and vegetables whenever it is necessary and make the most of the Christmas festivities season to earn more income. 

Her last loan was very helpful. It helped her to have a competitive business, with new clients and economic resources to allow her to go about changing her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy onions, avocados, melons, carrots, apples, etc., to stock-up her business with fresh fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Yan, 45, lives in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She has two children, one of whom is in school and the other is in university. She struggles to make a living by selling groceries. In addition, she grows rice to earn extra income. For Yan, this is her fourth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she successfully repaid her past loans. She will use her loan to pay the tuition fees of her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in midwifery. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition fees

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture for his own private school.

loans.name: Lucio De Jose

texts.es: Lucio de 63 años de edad es un hombre casado que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 24 años acompañado de su esposa. Él es un hombre trabajador que se esfuerza para sostener la economía de su hogar, por medio de su trabajo como albañil independiente, el cual realiza desde hace 15 años por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Lucio desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible, por lo que espera poder contar con este apoyo para lograrlo.
texts.en:
63-year old Lucio is married and has lived in his own house for 24 years along with his wife. He is a hardworking man who makes a lot of effort to provide for his family through his work as an independent builder. He’s been doing this work for 15 years and has a large number of customers who seek out his services.

Lucio wishes to put a new roof on his house as it is in poor condition, so he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, nails, and wire. Then he can change the roof as soon as possible. He hopes to have support so that his plan can succeed.

loans.use: buy galvanized sheeting, wood, nails, and wire for a new roof

loans.name: Alma Yanira

texts.es: Alma de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo ya que esta muy deteriorado por las lluvias, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza por esa razón solicita un credito para la compra de polines, laminas y pago de mano de obra para que eella y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en:
39-year old Alma lives in her own house with her husband and son. She has earned her living selling tortillas for several years. With what she earns she manages to live. 

Now Alma wishes to improve her house by putting on a new roof as the current one is in poor condition because of the rains. However, she doesn’t earn enough to be able to afford to do this, so she is seeking a loan to buy beams, laminated sheeting, and hire someone to do the work. Then she and her family will be able to live more safely.

loans.use: buy beams, laminated sheets, and hire someone to build a new roof

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: A farmer living in Siem Reap province, Soun is 42 years old and a mother of three children. For her family's living condition, she grows rice and plants vegetables. She can earn income of about 40,000 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan to pay tuition fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in marketing. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in marketing.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Soni kom District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Nirmal Sss Group

texts.en:
Lakshmi is the featured borrower for Nirmal sss Group. She partnered with her other group members to take this loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and improve their living at the same time.

Lakshmi is a 31-year-old married mother of one child who has worked as a daily laborer for two years to cover her and her son's expenses.

Lakshmi is trying hard to provide her son with better living conditions, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, People's Forum, to renovate her grocery store to make it a better and more attractive shop for her customers.  

The other group members will invest in their respective businesses.

Lakshmi is the woman standing with her raised hand in the photo.

loans.use: to renovate her grocery store to make it a better and more attractive shop for her customers.

loans.name: Shradha Sss Group

texts.en:
Shashi is 40 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is suffering from a disease. 

She lives and works in Chhindwara district, a rural area in Madhya Pradesh, India.

Shashi has a retail business selling stationery items. Shashi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Shashi faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more stationery (books, notebooks, pens) to resell.

Shashi is the group leader of the Shradha Sss. This group consists of 15 members. In 2013, Shashi joined People's Forum with her all group members. Shashi has committed on the behalf of her group to repay on time.

With her business profit, Shashi hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stationery (books, notebooks, pens) to resell.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is a merchant operating a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various merchandise like canned goods, noodles, beverages, soft drinks, seasonings, lubricant oil and motorcycle tires. She is a 51-year-old married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 23 and the youngest is 12.

Nieves is asking for a loan of 28,000 PHP to purchase various groceries, firewood, gasoline and charcoal. These supplies will fill her store and this could attract more customers. This could create a higher yield and she will provide proper diets to the whole family.

Nieves hopes that she could expand her current business to be successful and that this could help finance the schooling of her children for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to purchase various groceries, firewood, gasoline and charcoal.
